6LAMHrRuvm_UEFN2fR4y9Q.review_text: The last time I was at Sparky's, the place was pretty much dead. Our waiter was this Harry Potter look alike, and he seriously could not remember our order at all. He blamed it on his inability to read his own handwriting.  The jukebox was playing nothing but Tupac. Tupac Tupac Tupac and Tupac. Our Harry Potter waiter was singing along to the words, and we even simultaneously said "this song is about his gun, not his girlfriend," which was pretty awesome. All the Tupac made up for the fact that I got no cheese on my cheeseburger.  When our bill came, our waiter forgot to charge us for the drinks when he printed the bill, so he just let laziness win (his words, not mine) and gave us the drinks for free. The service was pretty shitty but it was probably one of the most entertaining dining experiences I've had in a while. The Tupac helped a bit, too.

HYQoxBC1y1DGPq6pGP09Tw.review_text: Daughter and I picked up mommy (my wife) and son at the airport. Then we came here for an early dinner. Yes, the "Fantastic-4" have reunited and are finally back at "full-strength." After spending most of the Summer-time in Hong Kong, wife and son doesn't want to see or eat any Chinese food for a while. So Sparky's serves your typical All-American diner food including breakfast, pizzas and Italian foods 24-hours a day. I used to come here many years ago when I used to party in the Castro and also dine here for my meal/snack when I work the graveyard shift. Yeah, this place never closes. I needed to work the following evening so I had half of the Famous Sparky's Cheeseburger. For $6.25, the burger has a 1/3 of a lb beef patty cooked your way, fresh condiments and choice of cheese (I got Provolone) in a fat bun. There are no combo meals and the optional sides are charged extras. And for an additional $1.50, we got the fries with our burger. The burger hasn't changed much through the years and was still good and greasy. yelp.com/biz_photos/9d1i… Wife and son split the Tuna-Melt. For $7.25, the filling had Tuna melted with Swiss-Cheese in a pair of toasted Rye Bread. And she also chose fries as her sides and there is also a charge. For a lady who spent all summer in Hong Kong, she enjoyed it and her unusual eating habit proves it. (I trained her to eat like the Tazmanian-Devil.) yelp.com/biz_photos/9d1i… On the plus side, Sparky's is best known for their specialty milkshakes, which is made with San Francisco's own Mitchell's Ice Cream. Besides the usual Neopolitan flavored milkshakes, there are 15 different kinds. The kids and I split a Chai Tea Milkshake. For $6.00, the milkshake has the usual milkshake ingredients and the special Chai Tea Ice Cream. The milkshake has a overpowering taste of the Indian Spice with the Chai Tea Ice Cream. A unique treat and I highly recommend. yelp.com/biz_photos/9d1i… I paid our meal in cash and my night with the rest of Fantatstic-4 was brief because of work! =(

xipyrIBO-r1j6PLJ7sIduA.review_text: Worst nachos of my life. They called it a deluxe. It was more like a  deeeeeeeh. The cheese tasted like yellow.  There was no Guac, no sour creme no salsa!!! There nothing but dry burnt chips!!!!  My homies got the breakfast and it was beyond mediocre. What made it wonderful was the sever was attentive and sweet.

MvlKo-sk5nye0us4Czon4A.review_text: One day before all my friends met up for a night of drinkin' in the Castro, I said to my friends (who were there already) "hey lets go to Sparkys, drink beer for $1.25 and eat some curly fries."    I didn't drink beer, I decided to partake in three of their finest cocktails...probably the stupidest decision I've made in my entire life.  I've taken 8 shots of 151 in an hour and been less sick then I was that night.  The food is pretty gross.  I have it for lunch three times a week.  It's just because I work in the area.  It's really nothing special.

lg0YuuSm_A8M-wMCIBpkHA.review_text: Absolutely terrible service! Don't waste your time here. If I wanted rude service given purposely, I'll go to Dick's Last Resort in San Diego.  My friend and I were seated promptly upon entering Sparky's at 11pm and the service got worse from thereon. The young troubled waiter decides that he's going to pass us and help two other people that came in after us. So now we are stuck waiting a few more minutes to order. It wasn't until a few of my friends brought food from another restaurant that the waiter finally decides to come over and greets us with 'are you going to order food, or are you just going to bring food from other restaurants here' Are you kidding me? I'm holding a menu in front of your face, so do your job and just take my order. Being very hungry and waiting so long to order, I put that comment aside and put in my order. Also something to note, was the whole restaurant had approximately 14 people already eating, and 4 looking to order.   The food is your typical diner food, but with a good selection of pasta. The many selection of food items was the main reason why we were primarily into this place. I ordered the chicken fettuccine($12) which was sub-par and looked like they nuked it under the microwave. My friend ordered their french toast combo($9) which he said was 'good, but the eggs lacked milk to make it fluffy'  Being in an area that offers great service and a wide variety of fantastic food, Sparky's definitely does not belong in this neighborhood.   Sorry Sparky's, but you lack that spark other diners have.

TC3qtTFrOgKuEZAeap5Exw.review_text: Come in for some late night food and get zero service after 20 minutes. What appears to be the manager advises the staff serve me, yet they must be deaf.  Stormed out and was told "fuck you asshole" as I walked out.  I'm a simple customer, Wings, burger,.milkshake, done. Avoid this place.if you're actually looking for something to eat.  If you want to just sit there for a long time while everyone around gets service, come here.

5F_ASUSCHFf3YotkKioZ5w.review_text: Not as bad a Lori's on Powell, not nearly as good as It's Tops.  The blueberry pancakes were actually really good.  The ham and eggs were barely edible.  Open 24 hours - it's a meet-up place more than anything, I think.  Get your late-night carbs right here, especially after a nice walk/tour through the Mission (thanks Steve!).

KU7AutPH8_0IIlY8Lk3Lgg.review_text: Worst. Service. Ever. They get one star, simply for the fact that they are open late and have pretty good food, but the girl who processed our order was a complete idiot and had ZERO ability to prioritize or rectify a mistake of any kind.   We placed an online order for three burgers and three shakes. Nothing too complicated. We called to confirm that they received our order (you know...just in case), which was promptly read back to us. Cool! They got it.   Fast forward an hour later. Where is our food? Should we check on it? We called back and were told by the same girl who took our order that she'd check on it and call us back. (For some reason, she couldn't just put us on hold and do this? Like I said, NO ability to prioritize.)   15 minutes later, I get a voicemail on my cel phone that "I mistook your order for another on your street and it will be another hour before our driver can make it to your place. I know that's really bad, but...it's what happened." Are you kidding me? Not even any apology! No offer to expedite our order. No offer for any kind of discount.  On top of that, my street isn't all that big.  I have a hard time believing that on a Sunday afternoon, anyone from my street placed an order to the same restaurant for delivery.  Yeah, right, Incompetent Girl.  You can't even lie well.  I called back to explain to Incompetent Girl that we needed to leave our house to go somewhere and, unless she could get our order TO OUR HOUSE in 20 minutes, we would need to cancel it. Again, she said she'd call us back and let us know.   Waited a little bit...almost two hours since placing the original order.   I called back and was told that our order had been cancelled and that our card would initially be charged, but would be refunded within a couple of days. So...she cancelled our order and didn't even bother to call. And STILL no apology.   We went to Tower Burger instead and they were super friendly and got our order to us within ten minutes.   Sparky's sucks.

rbPJO1Mc5ddzgucXelSQ0g.review_text: After a shitty day at work having to deal with shitty asshole customers that are fucking divas in every sense of the word, a few of my co-workers/friends and I went out for a late night meal. Someone suggested we go to Sparky's. Sounded like a good idea and it turned out to be a good meal.  I ordered the corn beef and hash. Now, I know many of you out there think there is no such thing as the real stuff and not the stuff from a can. Well, this place cooks the can stuff without it being oily and mooshy. How many diner places can you say that can pull that off? Not many, right? I also ordered some onion rings to go because I had a craving for them. Someone else ordered a side of fries with her mac and cheese and the others had a BLAT (Bacon Lettuce Avocado Tomato) sandwich. One had curly fries and the other had seasoned steak. I think they cook the regular fries twice, once to par cook them and the second to crisp them up really good. Kinda surprised they would do that at that time of night. But the fries were really crunchy, all of them. And the onion rings were awesome! Nothing like fresh onion rings. Soo crunchy and tasty! I personally left feeling better and happier. Nice place to go to. Not sure why there are soo many bad reviews of the place. It's a freaking diner, deal with it.

GDnuRcvlkMRHJW1jqYIqpA.review_text: After way too much karaoke and just as much beer, a friend-and-Yelp-staffer directed Oleg H. and me to Sparky's for a late night meal.  I got the Philly Cheese Steak and a chocolate milkshake.  Oleg had the Eggs Blackstone.    It was pure Heaven, and I don't care if that's only because we were wasted.  We cleaned out plates and woke up hangover free.  Thanks, Sparky's.

NDH7N_TqW7uZPqLBuGTWqA.review_text: poor service.  inadequate food.  I'm not really sure why my friends wanted to come here around 9pm when there were plenty of other dining options in the hood.

DeD9meMUULkw2nXllefrAQ.review_text: First of all, this place rocks.  I mean, you can't expect everything from a late night diner.  This place is usually full of drunks and you're usually there late.  So don't be a bitch and leave a shitty yelp review because they took forever to get you your food when you're drunk and high at 3.30am on Saturday night.  That said,. for a late night diner, this place is great.  The servers are always friendly and the guy who is always there (he knows who he is) is always accommodating.  Besides, gays, lesbians, straights, couples, parties, transvestites, hookers, and more, plus great late night food and really loud music.  What the hell else could you ask for?

muaD-BwKfuHPPxaSyFcc4Q.review_text: Not bad if you don't mind being ignored by the waiter the whole time and paying about $2 more for every item than one typically pays at a diner - and I don't. The jukebox is kickass, the food is tasty (and as a vegetarian, I appreciate their options), the location is convenient, and honestly, it is kind of my go-to spot when I feel like being left alone because it's always half empty and the waiters, while usually friendly enough when they do occasionally descend (or weird enough that you can't possibly take their unfriendliness personally), will hardly be in sight. Sometimes that's what I want, sometimes in broad daylight and sometimes in the dead of night, and when I want that, I know I can always go to Sparky's.

O8UYGyFMXxq58htx4lqYzg.review_text: This place was alright. My coffee was cold when I got it plus the driver spilled it all over the bag. The biscuits I ordered taste like it was store bought or frozen or something but it didnt have that geniune taste. The gravy was good tho. I also ordered some pancakes with bacon and supposely Over hard eggs but they ended up giving me over easy  : (      I cant stand runny eggs yuck. All together I spent about $20.  $ 15 for the food and $5 for tip. I just wanted to try this spot cuz it was close to work and I was bored.

Cn1QEqzYLt7ehSv-lMB-4Q.review_text: Sparky's is my favorite place to hang out at night in the City. But I've also been here in the morning, and around dinner time. I most highly recommend dinner time if you actually want to eat a meal, because they have a special uber-awesome dinner menu then, and the place is usually nearly empty, too, so service is ideal.  I've never had bad service here. Sometimes in the wee hours, the waitstaff is really busy and you may have to get their attention if you need something, but other than that I've found everyone there to be really helpful and accommodating. Once I was there and ordered a milkshake, and it didn't show, so I reminded the waitress and she apologized, said there must have been a mix-up, and brought it. Stuff happens.  Last night the boyfriend and I had dinner there, and we got the appetizer platter. We don't like the batter they use on their onion rings, so we asked if they could give us more of everything else instead, and they did, no problem. We got a hot fudge sundae for dessert, ate all the fudge before we were halfway done...and the waitress noticed and offered to put more fudge on it. They've made custom milkshakes for us before, too.   The decor in here is awesome, even when it's packed it's not too loud, the jukebox has the best selection ever, and they have some of the best milkshakes you can find anywhere.

CZssyoCdLWGWeOVdpDWRMw.review_text: Do not go to this place they will steal your money. One of the employees he said his name was "steve" is rude he works early mornings! Return my money or at least have the decency to apologize for your mistake!! Do not eat here!

psU-3xa-1LwumHQ6PrxjNg.review_text: This was one of the most disappointing meals ever ordered. Wasn't expecting fresh gourmet at 1 am from a greasy spoon, but would at least expect the order to include what was ordered after waiting 60 mins for order to arrive. Received a bacon & egg burrito when a veggie burrito was ordered and then the replacement (that was delivered another hour later) contained just hot spinach, I mean the people were nice, but the food was just disgusting.

ejGh3E7sAysb1gbRcxs0yg.review_text: Ordered delivery from here... Won't be ordering again. The grub hub page states a $15 minimum for delivery with a $0.10 delivery fee. But on my receipt they charged $1 The food got here within an hour which is pretty good, but that wasn't the issue. The food is. I ordered fettuccini carbonara with white sauce and it was VERY oily. The pasta could've been so much more delicious and enjoyable if it wasn't swimming in oil... I had to chug water after to balance it out. They included a piece of bread which I used to soak up some of the sauce but there was so much of it... I would've needed maybe half a loaf to soak up all the excess oil. To meet the $15 minimum I ordered a cup of their soup which was like a minestrone... But it wasn't good. It came in a small hot cup that's usually used to tea and it didn't feel like $3 worth. It didn't taste good.. It was bland and could've used a bit more pepper in my opinion.  The food was alright but it's definitely not my go to and I won't be ordering from here again.

1bWxVXw4tZU28fJPZxbfRA.review_text: This is a diner for all of those partying all night and need some great home-style food just before the sun rises to minimize the hangover.  LOVE it!

H5_X2_Pns21G86tIsymgqQ.review_text: Sparky's: a lesson learned in reading health inspection cards.  So, I got food poisoning from Sparky's. Not too sure what I need to say after that. I really wished I had read the reviews about the multiple health violations before plopping down for a burger. Lesson learned.

x4Ekzrr7WVp04aPoLsgy0w.review_text: These people take their omelettes SERIOUSLY.  Huge, lots of feta, and a happy, HAPPY Texan eating it.  YUMTASM.    The tragically hip staff, as Whitney P put it, were terribly overworked, and thus the service was slow, but the coffee was piping hot, the fruit fresh and tasty, and the experience positive on a whole.  I also witnessed a Hell's Angel discussing the cut of suits.  o.O  Cool little diner.

WSDvMF1Oxu8mgEObz-sCgg.review_text: I love, love, love, love, love this amazing delicious heavenly adventure to the mouth. The staff are very friendly and attentive. The food is heavenly and scrumptious. The atmosphere is an all day party. It is a great place to go on or after a date, to bring the family, or to be alone to meet your neighbors. Yummy to the tummy and wallet- very economical.

u1yoezHtAZA_UGO3UEVDhg.review_text: Choice post-party destination. Condoms in a basket in the loo, greasy spoon fare to soak up the booze, great music on the juke box, cute bitter wage-slave hipster employees. What else is there at 2:45AM? Nothing as good as this place.

FbtXt61Mb5vcko0PNX7nmw.review_text: First I have to say that there ARE about 4 employees here that are very professional and the few times that I have returned have only been because I peeked in and saw that they were working.  For still providing fast, free WiFi in this dystopia of ours, Sparky's gets 3 extra stars. For reliably undercooked or overcooked (but never just cooked???) grub I have to subtract 2 stars. For little games like sending rye toast when wheat was ordered, and dirty dishes & utensils, they lose 2 more stars.  For seating us and never, ever returning to refill coffee or water, not ever checking to see if the meal is "okay," not bringing the check unless you beg for it, minus two more stars.  ...and for the constant employee huddles/group therapy/gossip time while no one gets refills or orders taken, "how's everything?," or the even the bill... minus 2 more stars. I was going to photograph these little klatches, but they seemed to notice and moved the discussion to the back/booth area.  ATTN OWNER / MANAGEMENT, this one's for you; no contact option on the web page (other than phone number, which would only take us to the naughty employee's) minus another star. I would have preferred taking these issues directly to you, as I've been a recurrent visitor over the years and it's only been like this of late.  I won't be back any time soon, if at all.

FbgqbR_Tr8hTHjYy32KG4A.review_text: It pisses me off when I pay good money for food and it is ABSOLUTELY REVOLTING. Everything on my plate came from A Sysco box. I could care less if they are open 24 hours, there is no excuse for serving this schlock. No strain of pot, no amount of vodka can make me ignore the crap that was laid before me. If the Grubstake can put fourth fairly minimal culinary effort and create a great meal at 3:30 in the morning, why can't Sparkys do it at 5?

AFilqlzt2YZHsDFOGVrlKA.review_text: Zero stars for this joint.  Ordered an omelette and the eggs were not mixed up or cooked.  Waitress was rude and the had the audacity to even put her own tip on the bill!!  Ants crawling across the table, too.  Don't know how they stay in business.  They don't deserve your business.

_SVAW_bwFx3G2tDqmsmOBw.review_text: As a San Franciscan I'm ashamed this is one of the few options for late  night food that isn't a taco or burrito.  I'm tired of burritos...  ...and Best of Thai Noodle won't deliver to me  .... and Grubsteak is too far away  ... and I had to take out a loan to go to Nopa (once)  well, there's always cereal I guess, assuming I haven't run out of peanut butter.

2CtmwS8YmGovYtYSjNKAag.review_text: food is alright but delivery time is too long, I do not live that far i live like maybe 10 mins from there and its seriously been about a two hour delivery wait, never again  UPDATE: when food arrived my food was soggy cold and hard -__- sorry no mas

XkLK2iBsgqF6mWwDfRgqqQ.review_text: I'd never been here before 2 or 3am until the other night (I know, I know, big surprise).  It used to be a good place to eat breakfast to soak up whatever I'd had prior and they didn't weird me out by using baby bottles as creamer dispensers like another place up the street.  Going for a late dinner sober is an entirely different experience.  Our waiter was fantastic and all but the food was just not good.  To be specific, the egg whites had a very strange texture so I found them inedible.  The blueberry pancake was ok and stuffed with blueberries but I wasn't all that hungry.  The sausage was ok too.  My friend liked his meatloaf sandwich and peanut butter banana shake so it all depends on what you order, I guess.    So, I'd be ok with returning here late night but I wouldn't make it a dinner destination.

6pryBgYDVCmp1JudhoKpmg.review_text: Things Sparky's Has in Common with Your Mom:  - Open 24 Hours - More fun with a group - Cheap  - I'd only hit that when I'm drunk - l always regret it in the morning - Herpes*  * just kidding

hnVpgrdHkUmeBx5k0nTSdg.review_text: This place has literally the best Pasta Primavera I've ever had.  That said, I came in at 10 for finals studying/writing/reading/being that guy that drinks many many coffee refills for hours. There was one server. Despite being drastically understaffed, I never had a cold cup of coffee, and my meal was fast and perfect. My only complaint is the lack of staff. The sign on the door said "Now hiring Cashier" So I am assuming that this is noticed by management. Regardless, my service was rapid and patient with my homeword-doing-while-taking-up-a-booth-ness. They have an amazing Jukebox too.

RlXfOTtpgTfcisRmukrGbw.review_text: At 2 or 3 AM, your choices for dining are limited.  Sparky's has many strengths and weaknesses -- love it or hate it, it's often your last resort.  I've found the One Dish that I can eat there that is consistently acceptable every time and that's what I always order.  I get the "Yolk-O-No-No" omelette without the eggs -- sometimes the kitchen gets creative and throws in some extra veggies for me but it's always what I expect.  I know it will take a while -- and if the fries are cold, we send them back (no excuse, just because it is 3am, right?).  If you like shakes, this is your place -- I don't know anyone who has eaten at Sparky's on purpose in daylight.  It's a late night dive -- the wait staff are not perky, the kitchen is slow -- everyone wants to be in bed just like you, so quit yer whining!

StdA8xG5Fgn6Nl9LDGaJIQ.review_text: Once upon not to long ago I lived directly across the street from this place. Yeah, I had my fair amount of late night food from Sparky's TiLL I started seeing critters crawling here and there and here and there and there and here.  YIKES! I don't go there any longer....

efxR8cZlwUtUg7r-Lc-4-A.review_text: 2 hours and 8 minutes later. nothing. no delivery. no call.

MJkn27RXipv76KJlqRa9ag.review_text: Jazelle is the bomb. No, srsly. 1:30 in the morning and she was hospitable as fuuuuuhhhh.  She was knowledgeable, patient, and hilarious. She needs a raise. And a hug. And a puppy. Unless she's allergic - Man. Just - She's awesome, a'ight. Love, the chicks from Ohio/Sacramento.

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: To be totally honest, the chicken sandwich was a little small and the bun was on the dry side, and the spinach salad was drenched in dressing. The fries were about perfect though.  Service seemed a little apathetic also, though they are really on top of refilling your water glass. Water is always free and plentiful at sparky's.  The fact that they serve breakfast all day and that they're a 24 hour diner meaning that breakfast all day is really breakfast ALL DAY is worth an extra star.

sdHs2V6cfHILYcD_SlZndA.review_text: Pretty standard diner food to me. I got an omelette and a milkshake. Both were good, though I probably wouldn't pay $14 for that again. At most id probably just get a milkshake or something, it just wasn't worth the price for me. My friends really enjoyed their breakfast burritos though, so I guess it depends on what you get.

gIFaKRi0tCUgywkZWBX4xw.review_text: FALLING REVENUE DEATH SPIRAL?   I could just wish.  Take over a landmark diner, and be either incapable, or just don't care to keep it going? Well this is what happens.  Three of us, hungry and none of us could finish those dishes.  Maybe the best would be let it out of misery.  Really, if people give you advice, ask why they tell you.

ukwuhZbHwYXOVa9Fk9EqvQ.review_text: I'll start by saying that I'm not a fan of the food at Sparky's and left to my own devices I would almost NEVER eat there, but alas my household was ordering, I was tired and hungry so I got on board and ordered.  So here's my story: Today my household ordered 4 meals from Sparky's Diner at 11:30AM. After waiting for a ridiculous amount of time, several phone calls made by my roomies, multiple explanations of missing driver and having been told at least twice that our order was "on it's way" and many hours later at 3PM (yes 3pm) we STILL had not received our meals. Wow!!   My roommates were laid back, understanding and patient with the situation. I called Sparky's to talk with them myself, because I still had no idea what was happening, weather our food would ever come at all and why in the hell they weren't jumping to remedy the situation.   Keep in mind, I could make this low quality food at home...I'm playing them to make it so I don't have to, right?  To my utter disbelief the girl on the phone was exceptionally unhelpful and ineffective. She was more interested in explaining what happened, how it had happened, why we'd been told several times that our food was on it's way (which was obviously not true), in interrupting/talking over me and denying my request that she call her manager to get our food comped/delivered immediately than in problem solving a situation they had clearly F-d up COMPLETELY.   If it were my business and I had screwed the situation this hard, I'd be kissing my customers ass, getting their food delivered immediately, and for FREE. But, I understand that the customers opinion and experience of my business can and will make a difference. (If it were my business the food would also be decent and reasonably priced though.) Sparky's passed an opportunity to do right, and impress me, but chose instead to completely blow my mind and piss me off.  I called once more, again I got another explanation and I asked the useless unhelpful girl on the phone to please call her manager and get our food delivered pronto, for free. She called me back and said they could cancel our order or send it for 50% off. Wow! End of Story. She can blow me.  Wish I could give ZERO stars.

fbOFTx7DaYTRH_OzjbrgdA.review_text: 1 slice of turkey!  3 slices of white barely toasted bread!! on a turkey club sandwich?! Get the F*** outta here! How can u mess up a EFFIN sandwich??

H1YXtj4sj2G5VTv0sSrb-Q.review_text: Seriously the food here doesn't taste good and is visually a train wreck.  I was here tonight after going out, my friends all thought I was drunk and over reacting, but I think that an "executive chef" should be able to relay to the wait staff what is available and what is unavailable.  When my friend ordered the Scallop Fettuccine he was told that it was unavailable, then 5 minutes later the waitress came back telling us that the chef now told her it was available.  This place has horrible decor, it definitely is catered to the after club scene and the quality of food is horrendous.  I had the smart sense not to order anything, but I had a bite of everything my friend ordered and it was horrible.  This place needs the touch of Robert Irvine, please, Restaurant Impossible, come to this diner's rescue.

NeopksW_Qs2GL57K1aifEQ.review_text: Sparky's is open 24 hours a day. That's pretty much all it has going for it.    The food is really low quality, and the decor is somewhat depressing.  They added a 18% gratuity to our party of 4 people.  If this is the only place open then its often better than nothing, but that about it.

dJtrZhOFp7TAF685qc8JjA.review_text: You guys. This place blows. And anyone who doesn't think so is lying to themselves.  So my first encounter with Sparky's was when my friends and I wanted food at 8ish. We called and ordered and they never asked for our address which we didn't catch, but was strange at an after thought. Apparently they just assumed they were going to the same address that was previously linked to that number. We waited for an hour and a half and when they finally called they were at the wrong address. sigh.  My third encounter (my second encounter was pretty anticlimactic, although the waitress was a better-than-you vegan punk hipster type who never made eye contact with us or smiled) was super late at night. My friend and I were going to make our way to Orphan Andy's (WHICH IS WONDERFUL) when we opted to stop here since it was closer. We ordered ice cream and fries. Our ice cream was served first and ten minutes apart from our fries. Now you may be concerned that our ice cream would have melted by the time we got our fries...Well you're wrong. It was melted before it even reached the table. "SWAN" another bored hipster served us the ice cream by sliding it across the table without ever turning her body towards us in a sort of jaded tone.  And my last encounter was two nights ago. I asked to sit at a booth because I wanted to read and the lighting is pretty awful at the counter. They wouldn't let me because the guy working the tables was busy...Sparky's has a weird idea of what is busy btw.  Regardless why couldn't the woman behind the counter help instead? She wasn't busy at all. I ordered a chicken sandwich and curly fries. I waited a long time as usual and was served a chicken sandwich. She forgot my fries which was super disappointing. I know this review speaks for myself, but sitting next me at the counter were two tourists. I don't know what went on in their service, but I did here him tell the waitress that something "wasn't acceptable" and he didn't tip her. True that's hearsay... but judging by some of the other reviews I would trust it.

QKbq76KuUHLRZjWXDtbwWQ.review_text: I'll probably return here, despite their slow service and borderline crappy food.  They're open all night long, have a killer jukebox, and delicious milkshakes, especially the chai.  But the food??? I pointed out that we'd had been better off going to jack-in-the-box.   Oh and tip: stay the help away from the mac and cheese!  It looked like they made it about four hours prior, and the cheese tasted like rubber.  I took one bite, added salt, took another bite, and sacrificed the rest.  The fact that my "meal" was also $10 at the end of it all was kind of extreme, because it wasn't $10 worth of food.  A milkshake and a TINY little bowl, and I mean TINY, of mac and cheese.  I've ordered sides of mac and cheese that were bigger than this.  They should charge $0.50 for that crap.  anyway, you can't go wrong with fried stuff like jalapeno poppers and mozzarella sticks.  Pretty hard to mess them up.  *My friend spent the whole night puking after we went.*

3cjnXvd0KcMw3NzkfyNa4g.review_text: We ordered 2 burgers. At $7 each, they did not come with fries. Strike one. The burgers were small, mediocre, came with stringy, gross-looking onions, and the buns were not toasted. Strike two. Also got a side of crispy fries ($3.50) which was so small it wasn't even enough to share between us. Strike three. For $20 I expect to have a meal for two, and a decent one at that.   To top it all off, this was a late night order, and I specifically asked them not to ring the buzzer because my roommate was sleeping. I gave them my number to call when the order arrived. Well, they rang the buzzer anyways.   There are far better places to order a late-night burger, sorry Sparky's but I won't be ordering again.

JwkLRs3-kDZFtNAuY0vJ5Q.review_text: What am I gonna tell you that you don't already know?  Sparky's is one of the few precious 24-hour restaurants in SF.  Greasy-spoon style. Long menu. Harried waiters/waitresses who seem to have be covering too many tables.  The food itself can be hit-or-miss: pretty big burgers, but shrunken miserable cheesesteak portions.  The milkshakes are particularly glorious though.  Think of this place as Mel's Diner's underachieving younger brother who's still in college and will show up to a party unshowered, snarky, and still drunk from the night before -- all the good and the bad that this connotation carries.  Recommended? = Well, sure, if you need to. But don't have too high of expectations. And don't forget a shake.

1cElLpEfjYxc6zKFenpoWA.review_text: Sparky's is great.  Late night diner food.  Good when you're drunk.  24/7  Good milkshakes!  I love the people, they are snarky.  Oh, and free condoms!

TI76ih9RoIQS6ghEfXSJBA.review_text: I wish I could be leaving this place a better review, but instead, I have to report that Sparky's seriously dropped the ball when it came to customer service. 1.5 hours after I placed my order, I called the store, only to discover that the driver allegedly couldn't reach me via phone once he arrived here, so he turned around and went back. Seeing as my cell was at my side with 5 bars the whole time, I'm not buying it. Absolutely NO effort was made on their end to rectify the situation. In this city, restaurants are a dime a dozen, and I will be taking my business to one that actually wants my business.

WUlosg9j5yHzcVYPwrjhnw.review_text: DEAR GOD! BEST DELIVERY EVAR!!! super fast and inexpensive and GOOD!    We were feeling indecisive tonight and I'd been craving Sparky's for a while. I went to show him the menu and then we discovered THEY DELIVER!! I got a burger with curly fries (my fave!) and my boyfriend (who is a chef btw) got a Supreme burger. We both decided to be fat kids and got Mozzarella sticks and cheesy garlic bread. In 35 minutes the grub had arrived. I opened the box of stick and OMG THEY GAVE US 11!  for $6.25 thats AMAZING! The boy loved his burger but thought the fries were mediocre (fry snob!) I loved my order.   This is our new favorite delivery place!

RSwOHlYYSbUIKzOZDBz44g.review_text: Service is horrible. We have waited for our breakfast for an hour, and it never arrived. The waiter was rude.

TXv6qXJgFb2ZQeWVa-vLNA.review_text: I came in here at 1 on a Friday afternoon and this place was empty. I had a great server all to myself and got prime seating by an outlet so I could take advantage of the free wifi. Waited for 12 ish minutes to get the chicken pesto sandwich I ordered. It came out hot and delicious! I can see why it's a favorite around here. Even with the fried batter on the chicken and pesto sauce the sandwich was super fresh and not too greasy.

Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w.review_text: You know you are spoiled when you are hungry in the middle of the night and you have a few restaurants to choose from, that don't require a drive through to order from.   After the Bay to Breakers, I crashed hard into power nap mode- which was out of pure exhaustion. When I woke up, it was late, I was hungry and needed something good to eat. Most places were closed short of midnight on a Sunday, so I opted for Sparky's 24 Diner. I had not been to Sparky's in years and wanted to see if they still were as good as I once thought.  We ordered a Chicken Sandwich with Curly Fries, Mashed Potatoes with Gravy and a Vanilla Chai Milkshake. We split it all, devouring each bite as if we haven't ate in days. The milkshake and the curly fries were my favorites and very comforting.   Everything was good and fast, we were in and out in less than an hour. I'll be back based on the food and can't wait to try some of their other shakes.

GREZ581_6e3M3avnKIx5rA.review_text: First off, I feel abused having to give this restaurant the courtesy of one star.   2nd, I would rather eat my own shit.  3rd, the only reason I ended up at this horrible craphole was bc my taxi driver was pissed at us and used this place as revenge.   4th, this is my first yelp, so I feel very strongly about the nastiness, I had to endure this evening. Even being drunk this food tasted like shit. It wasn't even drunk food, it was poison.   5th, As soon as I got home I immediately put my face in the toilet. And word of the wise, it tastes worse coming up, to my surprise I didn't think it was possible.   Avoid at all costs....  Oh and the plastic cheese on top of that dog meat chili was so shiny I could see my reflection. That shit aint real. It makes Kraft cheese look like gourmet gruyere.   Shelly our waitress said her name was Chili, I think she was brainwashing us to order the chili bc it was about to turn.

1uiqIO4IXFFh2fcgEUCJag.review_text: I am all about Sparky's. Its the best place to eat when you're drunk in the middle of the night or hungover the next morning. I even go to Sparky's when I haven't been drinking!   I don't know why everyone complains about the food, the food is always really good when I go, and I definitely give some kudos for an awesome yogurt fruit and granola bowl. The Yolk Oh No No omelette is good too. In fact, everything I have ever had here has been good!  The service can vary, depending on how busy they are, but usually the staff is friendly and attentive. I've never had a bad experience.   Also, they are not dirty at all. The place is always clean when I go.   So overall they have good food (extra star for having really healthy choices, as well as some vegetarian and vegan dishes), the service is alright, the vibe is chill, the people are fun, the jukebox is bumpin, and they're open 24 hours. Does it get better?

Pl-UgvMNjSEHvk-ns796Mw.review_text: This place is great for those late night excursions. Food is good considering this place is open all weekend without closing. We had great service provided by Betsy. Will definitely come back again for drunk munchies.

7C2Fs9FHpaTxWIFeBtawGQ.review_text: Not happy!  I ordered takeout and they forgot to bring my macoroni and cheese.  Then I noticed that they charged me for it.  I kept calling to tell them that they never delivered it and they kept telling me to call back another time.  Very annoying.

10fYAA14iBTlgil264oJ1A.review_text: I'm unsure at this point what the worst part of my experience was... the horrifically late delivery, or the disgusting food I finally received.  I ordered Sparky's for delivery on a Saturday afternoon. I was catching up on work all weekend and wanted to make my day a bit easier by having some food delivered instead of having to spend time to go grab it or make it. And so it began...  I placed my order around 12:30pm and was told it would be about an hour for my delivery. This was already disappointing considering my order was garlic fries and chicken strips (unhealthy, I know! stop judging me). So 1:30pm rolls around and no food arrives. I wait until about 1:50 before I call to find out where my food is. I was assured that it has been out for delivery for quite a while and should be there "any minute". At this point I'm hungry and grumpy. At 2:15 my food still has not arrived so I call again. Of course the man on the phone has no clue where the hell my food actually is and I get brief apology and a promise that it will be there soon.  My food arrived slightly after 3pm, at this point I've already decided that Sparky's is the worst food establishment on the planet, but I'm so hungry that all I care about is finally eating what I've been waiting for hours to eat. I open the box and find a generous mound of soggy, cold fries - the kind that are as disgusting to look at as they are to eat. In the next box are my "chicken tenders" presented upon a bed of lettuce that is so brown and wilted, it looked on the verge of rotting (these were also cold).  I threw the food in the trash where it belonged and walked to a sandwich place a few blocks away like I should have at 12:30pm.  In summary: -delivery nearly 2 hours late -food is horrible

PzFQA9SMI3CiZO2HSoMa_g.review_text: I dunno what you guys are comparing to, but for a 24 hr greasy spoon, this place is awesome! Been going to Sparky's since, hmm, 1992 or so. My impression is that it went downhill in the late 90s/early 00s, but the food is actually back up to snuff now. The prices have crept up, but so has quality, and it ain't cheap running a restaurant in SF nowadays.  I usually get the turkey burger and fries. Mmmmm.

-9G2n1R0oqjvtpsy_CdE1A.review_text: I have gotten food poisoning/sick from Sparky's too many times... I just can't go back!  Eat at your own risk.

h2_1oL03hIMZWFgvwCbnyQ.review_text: I must begin this review with a huge sigh, rubbing temples that throb (mainly from the ten phone calls I have exchanged with the manager who refuses to refund my card for food that was never delivered to me!), and trying to figure out a new way to say what my fellow yelpers have already made painstakingly clear...Sparky's does not even deserve one star. If there was a negative rating system, that would be more efficient for such a joint. Usually, I create a list of positives and negatives, often unbiased, for my readers, but I can honestly and wholeheartedly not come up with one single positive thing to say.   To be blunt: Sparky's, I did not feel sparks. How do you steal almost $40 from a customer? How do you agree to a refund, then refuse, then ignore and avoid calls, then agree again to a refund...I'm still waiting.  Let me make a list of other restaurants that I would recommend for late night eats (it's worth the walk/ride/drive because Sparky's delivery is far from the convenience you might have had in mind):  1. Orphan Andy's (This is my first choice for late night eats, after dancing and drinking, a long sex session, or getting all beach dirty at a bonfire. Their food is amazing! AND, the service is always super cute gay boys, with much love! Castro locale, 6 a.m.- 6 p.m.) 2. Ryoko's Japanese Restaurant & Bar (Civic Center, 6 p.m.- 2 a.m.) 3. Osha Thai (multiple locations, open til 3 a.m.) 4. NOPA (western addition, open til 1 a.m.) 5. Vietnam Restaurant (North Beach, open til 4 a.m. on Fri/Sat) 6. Grubstake (Burgers! on Pine St., open til 4 a.m.) 7. El Farolito (Delicious burritos-check. Quick and good service-check. Open til 3:30 a.m.-check. My intense appreciation for The Mission-check.) 8. Its Tops Coffee Shop (Greasy & yummy noms! A little pricey but, hey, it's worth it. Duboce Triangle locale, open til 3 a.m., Wed-Sat.) 9. Zeitgeist (Another of my faves, but mostly because I can get a top-notch, snotty but amazing beer in a divey bar, outdoor patio setting with a grilled cheese that always melts perfection down to my tum. Open til 2 a.m.) 10. I'm just going to finish with the obvious...almost any pizza place in your neighborhood is open until 2 or 3 a.m. I happen to enjoy Arinell's on Valencia, but have been known to grab a funky-topped slice in SOMA.   In case I haven't made my point, eat anywhere else but Sparky's. I understand the convenience of delivery, but you'd be better off putting the delivery fee towards a cab ride to any of the above places. I may even be down to split the ride with you!   As always, enjoy--this is, after all, a city where one can almost always eat happy. I know I do, as long as I remember that Sparky's is never an option.

ipM70dVcbx5T3RAnHDxTow.review_text: We ordered a meatloaf sandwich, not a MEATLESS sandwich, dimwit. That's why you only got a dollar tip. Well, besides your abysmal service, put-upon attitude, dry-ass BLT, and half-filled soda cups.  I'm reminded why I stopped coming here about twenty years ago. One star for that. And for the truthful '666' in their phone number.

OCcHlcwqFtHcKFo5t4UBYA.review_text: Delicious! First had my taste of Sparky's a couple of months ago when a friend and I were on the hunt for something delicious (and open). Then we found this place and it's awesome! Everything is pretty much straight forward here. It's a diner, and it's open 24 hours. What's not to love?  The first time I went I shared a works burger and some onion rings with my friend, and I have to say those onion rings were so good. They're beer battered, which I think makes them even better. I went back here yesterday and I had myself some steak and eggs, which was pretty filling. The hash browns were really good, even though I was iffy about it when I saw some carrots in it (good choice, good choice). Their chocolate shake: to die for. Better than Mel's, which is something I didn't think I would ever say. The chocolate shake at Sparky's is no joke. Believe that.   And of course, I had myself some onion rings. This place is so perfect to me, it's almost disgusting how much I love it.

vojI-RFIcVlgh0ADz9mD9g.review_text: About 2 years ago, Sparky's was my favorite place to go to after a night of drinking. The food was pretty good considering that it was the only restaurant open in that area.   But I have noticed that the last couple of times I've been there, the food quality has really gone down.   The mac and cheese was awful. The grilled cheese, soggy. Fries burnt.   Next time, I'm going to Orphan Andys!

_mkYk8ic1AW2uty_4GxVRw.review_text: I have been here many times whenever I am near Church St. and Market. The best selling point is it's open 24hrs. The service has been always either super nice or amusingly awkward. Never have I had a bad experience through and the food is all around tasty.  I always come in for the penne pasta with meatballs and a delicious milkshake. Yummy!

-x4rHBJtwFZw6KmPY7NOHA.review_text: It was 1:45 am when I strolled into this place. I ordered the WORKS burger after getting into a lengthy convo on the street with a homeless guy trying to sell me the Street Sheet. He was cordial and friendly as far as homeless people in SF go. The homeless guy gets 5 stars just for being cordial.   The server Illeana was busy because the place was packed yet she was very friendly and very attentive to my table. She deserves 5 stars!  The burger hit the spot and soaked up all of the cocktails that I had been drinking throughout the night. It was very good. They also have a full breakfast menu 24hrs a day.  The diner is set like a 50's style diner yet they were playing some awesome mash-ups for the patrons to listen to.   Sparky's is open 24hrs and has all American cuisine.   I have been here quite a few times over the years and I have always had a good experience. From the burgers and shakes to the onion rings and fresh brewed iced tea, it's all good. It is also great for people watching...especially at 1:45 in the morning!  I would highly recommend it.

zJZ2Y7RN0WvlagI9X8fNIQ.review_text: Ok...in the words of Shirley Bassy, "Where Do I Begin"....  I have lived in SF for a decade & a half. I have worked retail for two decades. Of all the collective systems that take money for a service or product, this place is horrible. Worse than BART even.  There have been many great experiences had for me here from 1997 to 2007, but after that it all went downhill. Either the business changed hands, or a new captain came to the helm and ran this business into a berg.  From poorly made food, to slow service on busy nights, this place should be given a half a star. Nothing is made or packaged consistently. The staff(of whom I have had many friends work here) has an over accomplished sense of power & entitlement. Its a 24 hour diner ladies, not the stage you work on weekends. Give the ego a break & serve. That is the role you play on Sparky's stage. Service starts with being interested in helping people, not being pissed off that you have to be there. Where do you think that negative energy goes? Into that bad coffee your pouring? It goes into every person who sees how you represent this business, your employer. Not everyone likes whom they work for. Less than half a percent actually love their employer. If you're unhappy, do something about it other than insisting that you are right & the only one whom can be. That attitude will trickle into other areas of your life, and that truly could be sad.  Most people say the first impression is the most important, but I say its the last one that is longer lasting. Until they change Sparky's into an stylish gay pool hall, biker bar or another Peet's Coffee, its unlikely that I will return to this business.

tVY4kDYqrgJQIJ519CnOHw.review_text: awful awful awful  everytime i have been to sparkys its been boring and bland  ive ordered delivery once and it took forever, the driver took forever and was going to the wrong house the whole time  i may be too lazy to go get it myself but it shouldnt take too long to take the food about 4 blocks.

8kRkFR0vYD1E0oMm8DsfGg.review_text: My partner and I go to Sparky's on occasion, the "occasion" typically going something like this: It's late at night. We're just getting back to our neighborhood from an event. And, nothing else is open. I always end up really disappointed by the food, the service, pretty much everything except the music (they have a killer jukebox). Not sure why we went to Sparky's tonight except that it was late...we didn't feel like cooking...nothing else was open (Oh yeah, that's the scenario.) I ordered the chili cheeseburger, imagining a nice burger, a couple of slices of cheese, all drowning in chili. What I got was an over-cooked piece of meat, on a dried bun, and about three tablespoons of chili. When the server brought it to the table, I almost sent it back because I didn't see the chili. I literally had to lift up the bun and look for the chili--really??? I ordered curly fries and got regular fries...no biggie...except they were not at all crispy...sort of soggy and cold. Best think about my meal--the Diet Coke and Ranch Dressing (I love it on my fries...damn the fries were terrible.)  Okay...so this is a 24-hour diner and the staff is pretty much all twenty-something hipster types. I probably shouldn't expect a whole lot. But what I find truly amazing is the fact that I saw about 15 to 20 framed Guardian and SF Weekly covers/articles touting this place as the best for late night "eats." For me, not so much...

7i8eF1PtuTa-GT3uguG-tw.review_text: I understand that it's one o'clock in the morning right now, and it's much too late for deliver food... But this is probably the worst take out I've ever had. I payed over thirty dollars to wait an hour for somebody to deliver diner food. I live in the haight, this place is on church. I find it hard to believe that my food turned luke warm on the way over. We got rubbery calamari as an appetizer. Not to mention they breaded the while god damn squid. I got a steak sandwich as my entree with stringy, over cooked steak. And my roomate got a soggy tuna melt. Every dish was sub par and nearly inedible. I can't stress how much you should skip this place. Perhaps their delivery is just bad, but this experience makes me never want to support such an establishment again.

Wgz7DB8-Z71s_-5VSZanrw.review_text: When you walk past the place on a beautiful sunny morning in January and the place is all but empty, it's a warning.  It's not the staff, they were lovely. Very chatty, but I think they're lonely and need someone to talk to.  Eggs over easy, 2 pancakes & bacon with coffee. Coffee: Strong and plentiful. Eggs: Eggs over easy should not have any overcooked yolk. And no crispy or browned edges. Fail. Pancakes: Good basic pancake, fluffy and perfectly cooked. No butter? Are you kidding me?  Syrup isn't pure maple (not unexpected) but not very mapley either. I get that maple syrup is expensive but the table syrup you're using kinda ruins the pancake. Half a fail. Bacon: More fat than meat but nice and smoky. No real personality, like store bought bacon. Please drain the excess fat ok?   It wasn't just my food that was disappointing.  Biscuits and gravy with poached eggs and sausage: The poached eggs came in a little bowl, swimming in water with broken overcooked yolks (yuk) and the order was SAUSAGE, you came back with bacon.  The burger with gorgonzola & basil was inspired, but when it's ordered medium rare and it arrives well done with an insipid bun that collapses the minute you pick it up, it's a failure.  We've all been to 24 hour diners with huge menus that pull it off much better than Sparky's. I can imagine that when you've been out late, you're drunk and need vittles, this place might be a candle in the darkness. In the full light of day, the candle goes out.

0MYOZyCFO0OFg3ZKzYXLDQ.review_text: BEWARE PEOPLE!  A server ran my card on the wrong bill 2 times. The transactions were NEVER refunded. The phone number on yelp doesn't reach anyone or go to a voicemail. Please get back to me asap.

sKIL7EY0ppdxIIHAZ2t5NA.review_text: Umm, so yeah.... The food is decent, but a bit overpriced for the quality. The service and waitstaff is absolutely horrendous! You'll easily wait 10-15 minutes before you're even asked what you'd like to drink, and this is when the restaurant is EMPTY!

scQGUKoZb8bEuzZcnYa7SQ.review_text: Sparky's, I've never really had a problem with you. However, last time I was there, I ordered a veggie burger and asked to ADD avocado ($1.00 or $2.00 extra, can't recall) and received a sad singular piece of avocado. I showed the waitress and she got me some more avocado, but that avocado was not ripe at all, to the point where I couldn't eat it (and that's pretty bad cause I love me some avocado). I usually wouldn't complain about something so minuscule, but it was a double whammy fail that shouldn't even fail in the first place, you know? She didn't end up charging me though and I appreciate that.

N9FST4pCuLOgUu9GMixZ7w.review_text: Eh. I went here once w/ a friend in the middle of a night, after leaving a party, to get some late-night foods in my tummy and to sober up before the long and harrowing (ha!) drive back to the East Bay. The food was okay. Nothing to write home about. But, I mean, you gotta love a place that ISN'T Denny's but will serve you pancakes at 2 in the morning.  The place was hipster central, but, then, if you're in San Francisco, you kinda have to pretty much expect that and deal with that. But if you have a strong hipster aversion, perhaps Sparky's isn't the diner for you...  I'd go back, but not if it required going out of my way...only if I were to again find myself doing some drunken late-night wandering in the Castro...

q2cGMOPz43FpEvFzhW2D9w.review_text: Went last week with a couple friends. It was around 11AM, so we all ordered breakfast. The food came quickly and the server was kind and attentive. The reason why it earned two lowly stars lies in the way my bagel was prepared and served....  I asked for a toasted bagel with cream cheese and tomato slices on top. I received a closed bagel containing a rock-hard rectangle of cream cheese and one solitary slice of tomato. And...it was served in a bowl. A goddam bowl!!  I would suggest not going to Sparky's and getting your morning bowl of bagel elsewhere.

uqRGAUG3f_c-GM77Q64e3Q.review_text: Ordered from Grubhub. They did a great job delivering in less than an hour. Only thing, I asked for was no tomatoes and no olives and still got it. I can pick it out, no biggie, but would've nice if they read my notes in case I had an allergies or whatnot. Could've been a waste of a delivery if it was more than just a preference. Overall, not bad at all. I enjoyed their Pecan Crusted Chicken Salad and Philly Chicken Sandwich. I'd recommend this to anyone on Grubhub or in the area that wants a quick bite on a Sunday afternoon where most places are closed. On a side note, the delivery man was extremely nice!

_-XfdeOZuMvOKmrCN6WotQ.review_text: No stars.  The food is ok.  However after waiting 35 minutes for food and there was a total of 4 other tables that all came in after us and all got thier food it was time to leave. Don't think I'll ever be back which is a shame since it was my best friends first choices of places to eat.   Not anymore!!

P6BJWFBDrIfb0A2b3JqeTw.review_text: Why do I hate myself so much? What have I ever done to me to deserve the pain I inflict upon myself?  Sparky's is disgusting. It makes me want to be like this guy that I once saw on Jerry Springer who was able vomit on demand. Then again, I'm not entirely sure I'd want to vomit this crap up and be forced to taste it a second time.  Three stars because, like an abusive boyfriend, Sparky's always lures me back with it's empty promises. I should know better by now.

JaHiGt9TIE3I_L-nL5xUHQ.review_text: Buttermilk pancakes at 3am? This is your place. It's drunk people's food. And the latest last call in the area. Enjoy.

REGjppkq2IkDLRQVmRj_Bg.review_text: Going to Sparky's was my first mistake and ordering the food was the second.  My chicken strips were a breaded disaster.  So much so that if chicken really had fingers, they'd look like what I ate 2 bites of.  Gross.  The business is there to serve the late-night crowd.  Imagine a Mel's dinner but for a different beast.  The food is edible but not delectable.  My advise would be to eat somewhere else and grab a shake to slurp the rest of the night away.

3eTG4_S_dedIvbnet_k1Pw.review_text: Ordered a Fiery Chicken sandwich with curly fries and mac and cheese.  Food was alright, hit the spot was was a good price.  Server was attentive and attractive, and I was tempted to leave him my number.

1DHobMk5g1Yrti_vPBi7sA.review_text: It has been a while, so this review can probably just be deleted, but Sparkys is a great spot. I used to go here with a regular group of friends after going to punks shows at the Cocodrie or Gilman. The staff always being really nice and helpful. I used to get the two egg breakfast, which is great and better than Dennys or  IHoP, or the Sparkys Cheeseburger, which is very good, especially after a good night of slam dancing. It was always a good place. one time, my car was overheating and instead of trying to get to a gas station, we went to Sparkys instead and let the car cool off while we ate.

7M_6FojGZNbT3ZJt_wrV-A.review_text: Definitely an after-hours, people-watching Castro establishment chalk full of   diners and hipsters who can slam ton's o grease, heaps of magic Mac N' Cheese, hordes of carbs, and then a Willy Wonka amount of pure sugar bliss in the form of molten chocolate volcanoes in milk shake mugs, or strawberry, or snozzleberry, et al.   This is a great 24 hr. cafe for an independent pig-out session, or a group excursion to explore the possible consumption (slamming) of a an entire recommended total daily caloric intake in one meal.  There's usually open tables and/or a very short wait for a table. The wait staff is chill, they know the best "comfort food" on the menu and can make recommendations that's boost your blood sugar level in a naughty comfy, way.

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: Uh-oh, the host is in a snit. With his Flock of Seagulls hairdo and Gary Numan eye-shadow, I'd be mad, too.  He spews venom in our direction..."How many?" I give my best Asian slave-trade smile and say diffidently, "Two, please."  We are led to the other side where he hurls the plastic menus onto the table with the force of an angry, pre-adolescent girl. We park ourselves into the spacious booth awaiting our instructions.  I order a $4.50 coffee shake, and my friend has the $2.95 double-scoop of strawberry ice cream. Delish...Mitchell's, y'know. That's it. Burgers and fries are for the overnight dipso-maniacal binges that I sacrificed many a fortnight ago. That's not to say the hot food isn't decent enough, but let's face it - its chief selling points are that you can get that stuff at 3AM..and the staff has some nice mix tapes from the 80's.  FOOD - 3 stars...what you want but don't need...but you can get it any time AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...and I ran...I ran so far away SERVICE - 2 stars...surly in a hip sort of way...or hip in a surly sort of way TOTAL - 3 stars....24/7...that's enough, isn't it?

mEBQe-OWY8rsW5q6A03YBw.review_text: They deliver until 3:45am. +1 star They have soysage and breakfast items! +1 star  Their delivery time said 30-60 minutes and it ended up being almost 90 minutes -1 star  The food was cold -1 star  The spinach in my omelet tasted gross like it had gone bad or was ..frozen? canned? idk but gross, and the cheese i paid a dollar extra for was non existant -1 star  my bf thought his veggie burger was okay guess that takes care of all the stars... nothing spectacular here at all  im usually a love it or hate it 5 stars or 1 star kind of girl  but im trying to give this place a little credit here you may have better luck dinning in at this place

1qywuO1jHt4Xg_JK6rBg9Q.review_text: The "owners daughter" slash hostess needs to eat a dirty diaper for her unconscionable service and talking shit on patrons in spanish to the guys in the kitchen.  Wassup girl, I can understand you.  If you're drunk and need some place to eat, drag your ass and tips up the block to Bagdad Cafe where they'll do you right.

MGiNuc2p089hX_Vy8JJQiw.review_text: Sparky's is easily my best choice for late night dining in San Francisco. Even if you spill out of a downtown theater at 1 AM, resist the gravitational field around Mel's Diner and come here instead. Oh stop complaining, it's only an extra 15 blocks toward the Castro.   There is an generous spread of healthy menu items at this American diner, and if you want something healthy, don't even look at the menu and just order "My Body is a Temple" with orange juice and a side salad or something. Though it's not particularly tasty, you'll feel twice as good by the end of the meal. The menu also offers plenty international fusion with notable influence from Mediterranean dishes, for some unknown reason.  If your cholesterol is in top shape, be a little more daring and try the omelettes and DEFINITELY a side order of the hash browns. Their hash browns include delicious slivered carrots and green onions tossed into the shredded potatoes. Yum.  If you're really young and don't care about your body a damn bit, then hell, order a milk shake while you're at it!   Why not try out this establishment once or twice. Management has created a late night oasis that is good any hour of the night at a moderate price, so take advantage of it.

bHvcNmUAZilq_uVcx9DlJQ.review_text: My wife and I try having breakfast here about once a year in the hopes it will get better. But every time we go, we're disappointed and vow to never go again. The food is not bad, but everything takes forever... to get menus, to have your order taken, for the food to arrive, for the check to come. Everything is a wait much longer than it needs to be. After the other two waiting tables received their food we were the only ones still waiting and it still took another 10 minutes for our food to arrive. It should not take 15 - 20 minutes for 2 orders of scrambled eggs to come out.   I'm writing this in the hopes that the manager will read some of these reviews and realize they're losing business and that this all seems easy to solve. But I think it will fall on deaf ears. The sign on the door says "Sparky's Diner - Breakfast" but I think their heart may be in the late night crowd and not the breakfast crowd. When we first moved to the hood and started trying it, there was a couple times when they staff just looked like they had been up all night too and were blasting heavy metal to try and stay awake. My recommendation is to go to Chow or Crepevine. Even if it Chow is packed, it will probably still be faster than the sparkless "Sparky's".

L6--JM83ZH0eoO1q2sryAA.review_text: Oh Sparky's, things just aren't working out so well for you lately, are they?  My last date with Sparky just really made me decide never to return his calls ever again. Yes, my drunk friends said it was a good idea, and I believed them, but, but . . . half my meal was inedible and undercooked, and the other half was definitely not tasty, and all I wanted was some halfway-decent blueberry pancakes and scrambled eggs.  I just need to remember that Bagdad is better, and it's only a short walk up Market; a stumble, even. So Sparky . . . the next time you come a-callin' . . . please don't be sad when I don't answer. I found me a better late-nite-dining lover.

MU_bppwgP03jfpTo6vtZ5w.review_text: For their delivery not dine in... Havent been inside in years..  I love that till the wee hours of the morning you can get Sparky's delivery. Last night we had clam chowder, a steak sand with avocado, and buffalo wings. All for $27..  The soup was hot and yummy, the steak was med-rare as requested on a soft roll with plenty of avocado and all fixings on the side and there was at least a dozen wings with more than enough ranch..   All delivered on time by a very nice delivery guy.. :)

8rcQA6BIGgzTmBsi-MbSog.review_text: I wanted some food at 2 o'clock in the morning so I decided to give Sparky's a try.   Their turkey burger was amazing. It was full of flavor and I know this may sound funny but I mistook it for a burger made from beef. I even asked the waiter to bring me an actual turkey burger. Then he looked at the burger and told me it was, in fact a turkey burger. It was so yummy!  I had no complaints about the server, he was very nice.

SOZnTwFFFKeSzIrL8Vl-6Q.review_text: Sparky's, a diner? Sparky's makes itself seem like a diner, with 24/7 food, cheap options (although not that cheap by diner standards), casual atmosphere. They have everything you could ever want to eat - I'm surprised they don't offer human flesh. Since it's San Francisco, that means lots of vegetarian / vegan and unusual options too.  But Sparky's isn't REALLY a diner, it merely tries to be one by creating an atmosphere that's diner like. It ends up being diner-LITE. The service is not nearly as friendly, the food as unhealthy, or the food quite greasy enough. And they are all too accommodating with delivery to be a real hole-in-the-wall.  Real diner or not, it's nice to know there's a place in the city where I can buy burgers, fries, and the kitchen sink at all hours of the day and night. Thank god a place exists where I can decide it's a great idea to break a semblance of a healthy diet at 3am.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: Not bad for drunk food....loud music to keep you party people going, dim lights so you don't look as drunk as you are, and attitude to keep you in check as you try to pass out at the table.  What I find funny about this place (which I ONLY eat at when drunk, if that is any indication of anything) is that, as I browse through the reviews of all of the yelpers who have given it one or two stars.........  I have seen half of you bitches in there at 2AM, long AFTER you wrote your scathing review.

yCpE2Mf8RKdKjkhNxL7MVQ.review_text: If your review is based on visiting Sparky's before 2am, please go find something to do with your life. Return at a more reasonable hour and then write about it.  At 3am on a Wednesday night, I am often awake (for better or for worse). Sparky's understands the complex nature of that situation and responds by serving me a wide variety of food. Who am I to argue with a quick, greasy meal at 3am? Who is anyone to argue, really?   These people deliver food until 4 in the morning. Until you're doing that, go back to your one star and click delete.

2l4heqFZRNa6Rd7Wloh2Hw.review_text: No matter how good it might sound at the time, remember:  You're never THIS drunk! It's never THIS late!  It's bound to happen though. And when it does, get ready for a morning full of regret followed by a day trying to figure out what you can possibly eat next that will make the burning in your gut go away.   By the way. Someone please tell them that guacamole and avocado aren't the same thing. A tuna melt with avocado came out with a barely visible shit stain of green hiding on one side of the bread. An omelette with avocado came out overflowing with green goo (the kind that comes from a gun you would find in the kitchen at Taco Bell) squishing from in-between the two flaps of egg. Yuck.

II3KTi59hzIcq_URbE2ZGQ.review_text: I'm giving Sparkeys one star because if you really are in a jam and need a late night snack they are pretty much one of the only delivery services open 24 hours.  I had an experience 2 nights ago that pretty much summed up how i have felt about Sparkys for the last 10 years. i ordered through grubhub and the food came on time. the delivery guy was courteous but was asking for payment. I explained to him that Ive already payed through grub hub. he brought his supervisor or someone up on the phone. The guy then continued to tell me that they took my order the phone and was lying. I kept hearing the girl in the background say" she got a malt right? I took her order over the phone shes lying." I was starting to get upset so I took my ipad out and said I would give them the grubhub confirmation number. I then put on hold without explanation. The poor delivery guy and I waited in my doorstep for at least 5 minutes then the phone operator came back on and said yeah its fine and hung up. No apology, nothing for calling me a liar and wasting my time and the delivery mans time. unfortunalty i will probably have to order from them again one late night and i will probably have a horrible experience with their phone staff. . . the price we pay for a milkshake and a burger at 2am.

cJEbTP-MLVA5Y489pCp4pQ.review_text: Went for Pride weekend and there was only one waitress serving a whole lot of people. We waited 30 minutes to get food served. It definitely was not the waitress' fault. It's more like the fault of the establishment for not ensuring the right amount of people are working during PRIDE weekend! How can a restaurant right next to the area of PRIDE celebration only have ONE SERVER?! HEELLLOOO... Too much pressure on one worker and patrons eager stomachs!  After 30 minutes of food arriving, only 1/4 of us enjoyed our food.  Side salad with fries - salad had no dressing in it. Since there was only one server, my friend did not want to add to the already-pressured waitress. So she just ate the salad without dressing. Fries were fries... nothing special. 2 of us ordered Chicken Pesto - I don't mind dry chicken breast so I actually was the 1/4 who actually enjoyed my food. My other friend did not enjoy hers at all.  Eggs benedict with hashbrowns - When did eggs benedict become eggs boiled?? My partner literally took the two eggs by the fork and dropped it on the plate and it made a big PLOP like a dense brick. Luckily, the waitress apologized and did not have us pay for that meal since she didn't really eat it.  Customer service (one waitress) was great and awesome! She did her best and worked harder than she should have on PRIDE weekend. I hope she got paid triple time for this.

dJIolRxRzKthKuKnrj4MvQ.review_text: Ordering from this restaurant was a huge mistake, we should have listened to the reviews on Yelp.com. Our hot food arrived cold and soggy, our desert arrived melted and they did not include the bacon we ordered extra (we were charged for it and they would not refund us for it). When we called to inform them that we were dissatisfied they were apathetic but offered us a $5 credit for the next time. There will not be a next time. When I asked to speak to the manager I kept getting the run around and apparently the manager is still parking his car as I type this. What a waste of time and money, as a former restaurant manager, I have to say that this is an absolute embarrassment. there are some serious health code violations here, what a shame: Scored 80 with 4 violations: 009 (CFR) Food Contact surfaces not clean/sanitized 033 (CFR) Foods not separated or protected 042 (CFR) Non Food Contact Surface Unclean 054 (CFR) Floors, Walls, Ceilings Improperly constructed, in disrepair, not clean The following is from the San Francisco of Public Health and is how the score system works, notice they scored an 80 (that's not a B in this system): sfdph.org/dph/EH/Food/Sc… High Risk: Violations that directly relate to the transmission of food borne illnesses, the adulteration of food products and the contamination of food-contact surfaces. Moderate Risk: Violations that are of a moderate risk to the public health and safety. Low Risk: Violations that are low risk or have no immediate risk to the public health and safety. Food Safety Score Categories and Interpretation Score Operating Condition Category Inspection Findings 90+ Good Typically, only lower-risk health and safety violations observed May have high-risk violations 86-90 Adequate Several violations observed May have high-risk violations 71-85 Needs Improvement Multiple violations observed Typically, several high-risk violations Less than or equal to 70 Poor Multiple violations observed Typically, several high-risk violations

3IOI9CtyMRZkgqnv6UyHLg.review_text: If I could give this place zero stars I'd do it in a heartbeat.  On top of our food taking a while to get to our table and tasting terrible, a (get ready) GIANT COCKROACH scurried across our table as we were eating.  We immediately told our waiter what happened.  He didn't seem interested at all, in fact, he almost made it seem like we were lying. My boyfriend asked to speak with the manager for a refund and the waiter snapped back with  "You will have to pay your bill or we will call the police.  My manager comes in at 10 (It was 4 PM), you can talk to him then, he might give you a refund, but probably not".  The police!?  WTF??  Don't eat here folks.  COCKROACHES, bad food,  terrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrible service.  We should have read the reviews :(

3ZVEQNJgat1HWzXHXKV3oA.review_text: Did you like your middle school cafeteria? Do you enjoy over paying for crap? Then come on down to sparkys!  Seriously I've eaten alot of bad food in alot of bad places and this is by far the worst. My quote "Philly cheesesteak" was a hot dog bun, a kraft slice, and ketchup marinated mince meat. All for 9 dollars! Your better off being impailed by a stalagmite.

D4IHMxZwxZRZMvkMEeSb1A.review_text: Good burgers, decent fries, not so great breakfast! I haven't been in a while but I totally agree with Jessica, they are great for that late night fix and they do have killer shakes!

vVQkn5yjfRUrye9Dv7uwZQ.review_text: DO NOT EAT HERE IF YOUR VEGAN!   I ordered the Sparky's Spectacular Salad (no cheese) for pick up and when I arrived home there was feta on it.  No big deal, it happens.   I call up and spoke to a young girl who arranged that I come and pick up another salad made correctly.   Went to pick up the salad two nights later and brought it home without checking it like I should of.  The salad was missing ingredients (the vegan patty) and there wasn't any dressing. $11 for Greens, a whole sliced onion (not sure why), artichoke, and croutons.  The cherry on top was the was a dime sized drop of 1000 island dressing on the bottom of the salad container, hidden. Not vegan!  For a business not only is it unprofessional to intentionally worsen a problem with the customer but to be spiteful as well says a lot about them.

9GfmLaX81bjMqB7-0cl9Rg.review_text: kitchen open 24hr and serves acceptable diner food.

d1VXeXMq67_QgdvWY1tcKQ.review_text: so i realize my standards for 24-hour places can't be the same as others. but if i'm going to choose to eat out at an ungodly hour, at least serve me food that's an improvement over me going to safeway and buying its frozen equivalent and heating it up at home in my microwave

LpRlZ58I3TGK71A7Urvf4A.review_text: What to say about Spark'ys...  Number 1 benefit is that it is open all night.  Gotta love that.  Who says that stoners are the only ones with munchies late at night.  I personally get hungry after a night of drinking and dancing.  Having a late night alternative to going all the way back home is excellent.  Plus, even in a recession, im more likely to open my wallet for food while im still swimming in jack & coke than sober.  Sparky's is fun and the food is good and decently priced.  It's typical American Diner fare with burgers, fries, sandwiches, and all day breakfasts.  Being a little tipsy aside, its not a bad place for food in general.  Service is good and pleasant and your order is ready in a good amount of time.  Basically think of Denny's with a gay twist and that it's, well... not Denny's.    So while i enjoy Sparky's a great deal, it's not really worth any more than three stars in my view because, when you come down to it, it's the type of place you go to late at night for snacks and not really where you go while sober and aware.  Kind of like Denny's.

dULjHuw2PYnd_qb-Fs8nTw.review_text: wow I ordered delivery thru grubhub.com and thought it would fine my last delivery went very well...I was emailed approx. arrival time(1 hour 15 mins) and thought ok enough time for 3 items and 2 cans of coke...after 1 hour and 45 mins I began to worry that the driver was lost or gotten in a crash...at 2 hours I called sparkys to find out...they said he was at my gate calling me just then and why wasn't I answering my phone then yelled the same response to me again so I said politely 'i can't answer cuz I'm talking to u and I haven't heard my call waiting beep so there is no other phone call...' then hung up and checked the gate...there was my food and the driver safe and sound...he handed me 2 full brown bags and said goodbye...no explanation...I went inside and checked my food...missing toast, condiments, utensils, and 2 cans of cokes(paid for)...now I can almost look past toast and condiments and utensils(easy to fix), but when I spend money and don't receive what I've paid for...that's a different story...don't go here!! don't pickup from here!! don't get delivery from here!! don't even think about this place!!!

JsCvr2CGKhOGv7PD3FVYnQ.review_text: Don't order from here.  Long story short:  The order was late, the shake was melted, the fries were cold, the burger was overcooked. I asked for extra mustard, but they gave me none.  You should pass. Maybe they are better in person.

B9ORKr6fmz-GeRtLSgANjg.review_text: With a name like "Sparky's" I truly expected a fine dining experience on par with Gary Danko.  I was disappointed to find out that a 24 hour diner served homestyle diner food, much like some of my favority truck spots across the nation.  For those of you who complained about the food.  Seriously, what did you expect from a 24 hour diner.  I am pretty sure that Alice Waters does not cook here.  Go eat and quit complaining.

MAbvtRQIJZAudR8nn6KEKg.review_text: Oh pls.  I really want to like this place as it's a 24 hour diner and there just are NOT that many places to eat late in SF. SO there I was ...midnight, and I need a place to feed 4 people thats not my house. Sparky's it is....  Waiter sat us at a nice table (cool cuz there are a bunch of crappy tables in that place.) He offered to adjust the heat (nice- kind of cold out) and I thought this is going to be an ok experience. Nope.   Some friends of the waiters came in...they had a nice experience I think.  We didnt.  It took forever to be able to place our order, then we WAITED like forever (think order wasnt put in) and when the food finally came (by now waiters friends have already finished their food) it didnt all come out at the same time.....forgot a burger for about 10 minutes and when he finally brought it it was cold.    Nobody wanted to complain (in retrospect kind of stupid so Im complaining here) We just chalked it up to another crappy restaurant experience to be avoided in the future. AND then, I got the bill.  It seemed really high.  And it was...an 18% gratuity was added BEFORE the line for the tip  Just sort of snuck in there.  No mention about why.
