Well, I guess thats easy enough to figure out.  I was clearly not going to give an 18 % tip.  I was going to give 15, and resent the hell out of it.  Oh and did I mention that  there was a spot for me to add even more money if I wanted?  You know, an extra tip?   SHADY!!!!  I read the entire menu...no warning/mention of this practice.  Kind of think it's what they do there when they know their service really sucked.  And no, I didnt complain because I was exhausted and didnt want to make a scene.  Im sure they count on that when they employ this sneaky little habit.  So I quietly paid, and I wont ever go back.    When you find a good late night place let me know.

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: FOOD: 1.) Apple pie a la mode = Yummm. Simple. Can't go wrong with warm apple pie, and ice cream. A little plus for presentation with whip cream flair  SERVICE: Not sure if their norm, but when I went it was kind of slow and disorganized...  ATMOSPHERE: They probably would get better ratings if it looked better. Kind of donut shop fast food, really dim, neony lights haha ... Oh well, it's opened 24 hours. Better to have character than the cookie cutter Carrow's, Denny's or ihop. Hum, oh and they have random music playing from a jukebox.

gbXAlSpZrygt0ecO3IA88g.review_text: Seriously I've read a lot of reviews on Sparky's, but I've never had a huge problem with them - until tonight.  My friend and I ordered off of Grub Hub to get an Eggs and Cakes breakfast and a California Omelette. For the California Omelette I was allowed to choose whether I wanted hash browns or home fries as my side. I chose hash browns. They then asked what toast I wanted, where they also listed "substitute for cottage cheese." I chose to substitute the toast cause who eats that anyway?  My order comes and the potatoes are no where to be found. The only reason that I get breakfast, pretty much ever, is so I can order hash browns. There is nothing better to me for breakfast - not bacon, not sausage, HASH BROWNS.  I called because I figured that it was just a mix up, since I didn't write their menu on Grub Hub and I'm pretty sure it's not my bad I didn't get those heavenly potatoes. But to no avail. Somehow I supposedly read the site wrong, and now I get to go potato-less.  Also, no syrup for pancakes? Seriously?! Who does that?  And they charge extra for tabasco, not that it matters since they didn't give me my potatoes anyway.

xTxryA9uJ5zAC_rclSiKYA.review_text: How do you screw up breakfast?  We wandered in here at 2am after last call and because we had the starves. Breakfast and a side of mac and cheese sounded awesome to me at the time. The eggs tasted like cardboard and the toast was cold when it got to our table. Next time I'll get some chips and a soda at the liquor store.

GWPaAUytox54XVcL5Dt7JA.review_text: I ordered delivery from Spary's 3-4 times per week.  No less than 80% of the time, they would delivery my order incorrectly.  They would delivery the wrong item, leave out some items, not pay attention to special requests for items, and the list goes on and on.  This truly happened at least 8 ouf 10 orders.  However, due to their being open late, I ordered from them.  Tonight I called to place an order and was told that thay will no longer accept orders from me.  So, to make it very simple, Roberto, the owner of this restaurant that serves crap food in the first place, is now refusing my orders simply because I expect to receive my orders correctly.  This is the worst of the worst when it comes to customer service.   So, if you are looking for food to be delivered, and you expect to receive what you ordered, look elsewhere, because Sparky's simply brings you what they have laying around it seems.  Seriously steer clear of this pitiful excuse of a "restaurant".  By the way, in case you were also wondering about their rating with the San Francisco Department of Environmental Health, it is pretty enlightening:  101g-xnet.sfdph.org:4443….  Not exactly stellar.

iuD0M_M_CUnqP2R5eYgRgw.review_text: Just called for delivery and the French sounding guy on phone literally just added 20 dollars to the bill - we called him back and asked to repeat order and asked about the 20 difference and he couldn't give a price per item... Times like this I wish they listed the manager phone # to figure out what's going on. Why advertise delivery if your gonna act like it's a pain to delivery and add frivolous charges to a delivery.

JEvUHDBSgfzTO9ysH4Jc4w.review_text: We came into Sparky's on a Saturday night around 9 pm because the menu was extensive, but halfway through our visit to this establishment the boy and I both went "we could have been in and out at the place across the street!" So, don't be fooled by the promise of fast and/or upbeat service implied in the name.  Even though the restaurant was half-empty, the waiter tried to seat us at the corner where the bathroom/kitchen entrance is. Maybe I'm just high-maintenance, but I really don't like sitting by the kitchen and hearing all the pots and pans get banged around (or watching people enter/exit the bathroom), so I asked to move. They let us move, but I did notice that the guy who had seated us didn't come back to our table after that, even though he served the tables adjacent to ours.  Instead a female waitress took our order. We tried to order the spinach omelet, which comes with salsa, cheese and sour cream ($8.25). She informs us that the menu is mis-printed and it's actually the "Spanish" omelet. No spinach included. We can, however, create our own omelet. The only problem is that it starts at $6.25 and it's an extra dollar for each thing. So a spinach, salsa, cheese and sour cream omelete is $10.25, not $8.25. It's not really my (or I guess the watress') fault the menu says the wrong thing and hadn't been corrected, and it annoys me that she couldn't just accommodate us. We ended up settling on some other omelet that has bacon, cheese and spinach. (I was trying to eat healthy-ish though so I really didn't want the bacon!)  Then we waited for 20 minutes for the omelet, which is the point at which we said "maybe we should have just greased out at Chilango."  When the food finally came it was decent, although the has browns weren't my favorite -- they didn't stick together well and just fell apart in their grease.  The verdict: this is probably a great greasy spoon if you're not in a hurry and don't mind waitstaff who could care less if your needs are actually met. Otherwise, I might as well go to Dennys...or my own kitchen. 2 stars, because "Meh, I've experienced better" is exactly how I feel.

WI9UJah3bVB258wzEIh34A.review_text: I'm really bummed writing this review.  I went to Sparky's with a bunch of friends following the Third Annual Bilicious.  One of my friends is handicapped and the staff at Sparky's was EXTREMELY rude to her about accommodating her and her scooter (read: motorized wheelchair).  I was sitting at the same table as she was and when the rest of us were assertive to the server and busboy about NOT taking her chair and parking it outside (WTF?!?!) they became extremely passive and slow about taking our order and serving us.  In fact: everyone else in our party (we were seated at five different tables) got their food before we even ordered drinks.  Now: I understand that Sparky's is small and they were maybe thinking of moving the chair to accommodate other guests -- EXCEPT the chair wasn't blocking anything except one side of our table.  It was a complete bummer and I'm wholly disappointed in Sparky's and I doubt that I'll choose to go there again any time soon -- Little Orphan Andy's is just up the street and Home is across the street and there are enough choices for late night dining in the Castro that I can boycott this place without worrying about limiting myself in choice.  Boo.

OWnYWg8L67W-moQJkjrXPQ.review_text: My personal opinion is that Sparky's is one of the better places to grab a late night "after the club" bite.  You have your hits and misses for late night grub but I think this is better than most of the others.  It's usually bustling in there too.    Based on the reviews though, I am assuming that it may depend on what you order to make it a hit or miss experience for you....

nNsDgAaEbxXw-fPOlIaP-Q.review_text: I need to add this to my list of spots open late night because when you're in the neighborhood after hours and Orphan Andy's is packed, it's still a better plan B than Bagdad Cafe. More of a 2 and a half stars, but not high enough to bump up to 3.  But it's overpriced mediocre food ($9.25 for a burger + $3.25 to add fries???) with mediocre service (waitstaff makes you feel like they either are too good to be waiting tables, or they just plain don't care) in a pretty nondescript and soulless location (surprising in the Castro!). In fact, if prices were more decent, I would give this place 3 stars.  I also want to mention that last time I went there, the hispanic busser/runner was very friendly and smile a lot which was a far better experience than I got from any of the wait staff. I hope they tip him out well.   The likelihood of eating there is very very low, and would only be the results of circumstances that leave me no choice.

RCKdmKDZRd-RovZVtNSCLA.review_text: The only 4-star-quality item would be the beverage I got, which was somewhat unique: a blackberry lemonade.  It was very worth having.  Everything else, though, was just "eh."  Not bad, but not great.  It was hot, and it was had; good enough.  Took a little long to get, though the service wasn't awful, like many of these other reviews claim.  Then again, my group went there around 1 a.m., and the "awful service" claims tend to be aimed at their daytime staff.  So yeah, bump up the quality of the food to the par of the unique beverage, and an extra star will be added.  Subtract time it takes to get the food, too, and mayyybe you'll get 5 stars.

PJj91SLdvvwcNixY6n-EPg.review_text: If I could give them less I would. I ordered from eat24 and my food came undercooked. When I called them they sent a driver back out and I thought all was good. When he showed up, he threw my money at me, kicked my food down my hallway and flipped me the bird. When I called them to complain about their "they messed up service" they tried to blame it on me and hung up on me. I called eat24 to resolve the issue and they told me that the driver claimed that I threw the food at the driver and was intoxicated. Little did they know is that my building has video cameras and are willing to show the video as proof. Yet, every time I call the restaurant to talk to a manager, they hang up on me. If you like your food undercooked for over $20 then go for it. If you're not into being treated like trash, this isn't the place. They obviously don't care about the people that pay their bills.

XYz3fu_1s2yRlpfw_Ucqdw.review_text: Meh. Not great. Not terrible. It's open in the middle of the night and sometimes that's important.  Waiters can be pretty funny, though, if you catch them in the right mood.

9jFb0if7fwamBRbqj8qn9A.review_text: Do not pass go! Do not collect $200. Do not eat here!

v0_RxOAC9gUJSx6j9BZaTQ.review_text: Great any time of day. Food is good, prices better. Decor is fun, the wait staff is friendly. IT's easy to get to. What's not to like!  Best of all? It's open24/7.

De8tuYPKZwpT-syR1sylOQ.review_text: Good News... They Deliver all over SF  Bad News... It still sucks, and the service is the same apathetic, I'm too good to work here crap you get when you eat at the restaurant.  I used to go here drunk when I was a kid.  Now when I'm drunk, I'm too old and cranky to put up with the crap that's going on there in the middle of the night.  Either way, I didn't realize how bad the food was until I ate it sober once.  Was working from home and had picked up a menu so ordered a burger and fries.   Even though I live like a mile from there, it came an hour and a half later, the burger was like a frozen hockey puck and I think they invented a new dish.  Boiled french fries.  This place will endure because there's never going to be a shortage of drunk kids that need some food before driving back across the bridge, but for you sober folks over 28... it sucks.

8NXgzVgRcku3yUTfGBuVMg.review_text: I've ordered from here a couple of times and it was okay but not tonight! I ordered (via Eat 24Hours) at 5:30; the food didn't arrive until nearly 7:00. I had specifically reminded them to remember to give me gravy with my hot turkey sandwich (they forgot it last time) and it was again naked. So I phoned, and was put on hold for 10 minutes.   Called back at 7:30 and asked for the manager; the same guy as before came to the phone. "What do you want me to do? Send you some gravy?" Well, yes, even though it will take an hour, that is what I wanted.  It's now 9:30pm; no gravy on that sandwich, that is drying out in the fridge. And ya know, I vote with my feet... no more Sparky's Diner meals. Next time I'll order Chinese food.

1SEQMxtqqVWjBfhXohJ8nQ.review_text: On those late night prowls when you just have to give in and splurge with guilt filled calories, this is the spot!!  The macaroni & cheese is MmmMmm Good!  There's a 3+ page menu with EVERYTHING on it from pancakes to Italian food!  Can't go wrong with this menu, even for those picky eaters!

PstMN4AN6OlpVp2sIfHkyQ.review_text: The first time I ever ordered from sparky's it was a 2-3 star experience. I had ordered a philly cheese and garlic bread, while my roommates had ordered pizza. We had ordered at 2am and our food took an hour and 15 minutes to get, despite being told it would be 45 minutes. We told the phone operator we were paying with cash and only had large bills so we would need change. He said no worries. The delivery person that showed up claimed to not have change and could not go back to get change. Given his demeanor it was almost as if he expected us to give him a $70 some odd dollar tip. We scrambled through our rooms and managed to come up with $20 in bills and change which was just under our tab. We did keep telling him if he went back to get change we could tip and pay in full. He reluctantly took the $20 we had mustered up and saved us a few bucks at least. At any rate... the pizza  was pretty bad but still edible. The philly cheese was disgusting and they definitely tried to save money by skimping out on the meat. The garlic bread was really hot dog buns with garlic over it. My guess is they ran out of rolls but I mean really?  That was a few months back. Then yesterday morning, me and my friend decided that previous bad service was probably due to it being 2am. So around 12:30pm, we decided to give their day crew a shot, and I mean, how can you mess up breakfast food? We ordered 2 orders of eggs and hasbrowns with toast and waffles. We were told it would be a 45 minutes. At 1:30 I called and politely inquired about the status of my food. I was told the food had left 20 minutes prior and should be there any minute (remember this place is less then 10 minutes from my house).  At 2 I called again and was told he was surprised the food wasn't there and he would call the driver while I stayed on the line. I was told right after that the driver wasn't picking up his phone but should be walking up any minute now. At 2:15 I called again and was told the driver was 15 minutes away. (okay can I mention again that it takes less then 10 minutes to drive there from my house?) At 2:45 my food finally showed up, 2 hours and 15 minutes after I had ordered it.   The eggs were absolutely repulsive and could not be eaten. Out of sheer hunger I tried to mask the taste in hot sauce but had no luck of covering up the awful taste. They had shipped it with an extra order of hashbrowns and thank god because that was the only edible thing (Although I later found I had been charged for those as well). The toast tasted a bit stale (only the part they had soaked in butter I could eat) and of course there was no syrup or butter packets so unless we wanted dry waffles we couldnt eat those.   I will never even consider getting a soda from this place ever again.

6hLqw3MA1W44p1S0YA-mgw.review_text: I went to Sparky's recently and I must say that I will never go again. You are probably wondering why?  Well, let me tell you presently. I went there after a softball fundraiser, which means I had a bit more than a few drinks in my system. I don't know about you, but normally when I have a few drinks, food tends to taste better. Not this time. My friend ordered to "buffalo wings" and the other a turkey sandwich and both were so nasty. The food was so terrible that I feel no need to even to mention, the opposite of wonderful, customer service.

YHV4HKDoVAear1EcH1F_GA.review_text: Sparky's holds a special place in my heart. Yeah, the food isn't really amazing, nor is the service, but this place has a certain special something about it, when it's 2 in the morning and it's either this or jack-in-the-box. My boyfriend and I actually came here after our very first date and ever since then, I occasionally will get a feeling of nostalgia and wander back here for an average-tasting egg breakfast.  Maybe I'm being a little too harsh on their food. It's not bad- really. It's just not the best diner food you'll ever experience. I'd say go for the patty melt or the mozzarella sticks. Their chai is actually surprisingly good here too. It's a definite go-to place after a concert or if I'm in the mood for a late-night snack, but I've never found myself eating here during the daytime. It must be past 1am to eat at Sparky's.

ZSretWXlve11q9hP6SrScQ.review_text: Some people have their go-to bar. I have my go-to diner because I can drink, eat and act ridiculous at 3 in the morning without judgement. So check it, Sparky's is a 24/hr diner with five-page food menu. They have bloodies and mimosas, breakfast served all day/night, cheap eats and a jukebox. Can it get any better? Did I mention some of the best drunken bathroom poetry in the city? (yes, it can.)

9e8zpxkGHudaXNTDpKt8ag.review_text: Never coming here again.  I've gone here only a few times and only received terrible service.  I'm going to start with the one good thing.  The young man who helped me today.  He wasn't rude, which was a change.  Past times I've gone, the people who have helped me have been nothing but downright MEAN to me.  The last time I went, they were playing dub-step pretty loud.  If you don't know what that is, please youtube it.  In the club I wouldn't mind it, though it is annoying.  When trying to eat, and you hear "WOB WOB WOB WUBWUBWUBWUB" blasting over the speakers, it starts to make one... not hungry.  When I asked to change the music, at least the volume, they were straight up rude about it.  Today, I was supposed to meet up with a friend who eventually flaked out on me.  Well, since I'm already there, I might as well try and cheer myself up with some blueberry pancakes.  The waiter took my order, and goes.  He comes back a few minutes after to tell me that they are out of blueberries, but that they can do another type.  So I chose strawberry.  No big deal, it's all good to me!  I get my food, and take a few bites... than I start to realize that the middle of my pancakes are completely undercooked.  Have you ever eaten pancake batter uncooked?  It's disgusting in texture, and it can actually make you pretty sick.  I mention it to him, and he offers to take it back to cook it more.    Honestly, I don't trust them to re-cook my food.  On top of that, I would NOT want pancakes recooked when they already have syrup and butter on them!  I just ask for my check.  What do I get back?  The receipt with only my drink taken off.  While I appreciate the kind gesture, I was still pretty shocked.  The drink was fine.  but why am I still paying $6.00 for a meal I couldn't eat because they couldn't cook something so simple properly?   Once again, I appreciate that the waiter was kind to me, but I felt like I got jipped not only by my friend who flaked, but also the establishment I was eating at.  I have been working in customer service for years, and if this was an establishment I owned, I would never let people like the ones who work there get away with these things.  It doesn't need to have 5 Star customer service for being a 24 Hour diner, but the customers themselves should never feel as insulted as I do.  I hope that Sparky's gets their act together, if not close down.

c211hWTJnoW2hh-pP2xIbg.review_text: Would go back because: Veggie friendly. Sometimes wandering into these places can be a real pain if you don't eat meat. Big menu 24 hours Great milkshakes Plenty big enough portions  I didn't expect the world and I was satisfied. Staff were friendly.

VJeELbzN2bS5Kw-tur4Oag.review_text: First visit to Sparky's?  1989.  Breakfast.  After a strange and late, late night and an even more bizarre morning.  I don't remember the food.  Subsequent visits to Sparky's... 1990 to 1992.  Typically in the middle of the night, after the bars/clubs closed.  For those times when we didn't end up at places like  Baghdad Cafe or Japantown Denny's or Zim's or Video Cafe (bleh) or Mel's.     I don't remember the food.  Which, considering the fact that I *do* remember how BAD the food was at Video Cafe, in my mind, I figured the food at Sparky's must be ok.  Flash forward to October 2013...  After 9pm, driving around SF with my nearly 20 year old daughter.  We're both hungry so we don't want to go anywhere too crowded (probably a mistake), but not really wanting fast food.  We're driving towards the Castro, and I noticed Sparky's IS STILL THERE *AND* THERE'S A PLACE TO PARK CLOSE BY!  So, Sparky's it is.  We walk in and there's hardly anyone there, so we're seated quickly.  My daughter ordered cheesy garlic bread and chicken tenders from the appetizers portion of the menu and I ordered a grilled turkey and cheese sandwich and side of fries.  Food took a while to arrive despite the fact that there still weren't many other people there.    We were thinking, oh, appetizers, it will be like 3 or 4 chicken tenders... Instead there were probably 30 chicken tenders (maybe more?  HUGE portion) and the cheesy garlic bread was literally a whole loaf of french bread.  It's just sort of overwhelming to be served (and waste) that much (blah) food.  My sandwich was all right, but the fries were warm-ish/not hot.  This time, I will remember the food.  Was it Video Cafe bad?  No, not really.  But I'd say it's only a very late night dining place.

fMEXZuj_mSTrxkGcAg4Hxw.review_text: Didn't think one could screw up scrambled eggs, guess I was wrong because Sparky's did just that along with the rest of my meal.  Overall pretty bad, everything on my plate tasted the same, like a greasy grill.  The meal sat in my stomach for the rest of the day.  Service was mediocre.  There are so many good places in SF to eat breakfast at, I would pass on Sparky's unless it's 3 AM in the morning after a night of drinking.

We19fTNDqsoKmbdIlo165A.review_text: This place USED to be awesome. What the f*ck happened!?!?  I came here on a Friday night before hitting up a Mark Farina show and I left here wanting to scream and stand outside telling people not to come in. Here's the night in list form:  Diner activity: Only 3 people were sitting when we walked in (THREE).  Waitress: Spaced out, not paying attention, not writing anything down, and slow.  Order taking time: She took our order maybe 10 minutes after seating us.  Food arrival time: I'd say 30 minutes...seriously. And we got our food AFTER two other tables that came in well after us.   Order accuracy: Completely f*cked up. Between the waitress and the kitchen...is the job THAT hard? My corned beef hash had no eggs; one friend said no cheese on her sandwich (lactose intolerant) and it had a nice thick slice of mozzarella; the other friend had to ask for aioli sauce because they didn't put any on the sandwich that has aioli sauce as the key ingredient.   With the number of good eateries in the Castro, Sparky's might as well fizzle out and open that space up to owners who care.  Peace!

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: 4 overgrown 5 year olds get wasted at Lucky 13 and then do a Shakira-style conga line down Market to Sparky's. We lost one on the way, but it was for her own good. Because after depositing her in a cab, it got professional. Really, what is more attractive than a grown man humping a tree while singing, "Hips Don't  Lie"? I'll tell  you  what: A grown man humping a waiter at  Sparky's while friends in the booth do naughty things with food. We were dubbed "Brad, Angelina, and Maddox" by our server, who exhibited the  patience of a saint while repeatedly reminding us to keep it down and keep our clothes on.  Sparky's is a diner- it's not classy but neither were we last night. I usually end up here after drinking heavily in the surrounding neighborhoods. They're open 24 hours, which I find reassuring in a city that rolls up and goes to bed long before I'm sleepy. This means I can have a double barbecue bacon cheese burger when I really need it: usually around 2 a.m. Their fries are near perfect, they have some very un-dinerlike salads and vegetarian options available, and I distinctly recall pounding mimosas at 1:30 this morning, so they must have those, too.  Food's cheap, the crowd and staff are great entertainment, and they're always open. Just remember to keep your voice down and your shirt on! Server from last night, you rocked our world!

cMHJdYmBLl8tOvBKLCXHvA.review_text: If I could I give this place 0 stars I would. The staff were rude, we waited an hour for our food. Screw this place.

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: I appreciate that it's open 24 hours.   I will never go here sober.

q5ZygaUpgQSDv2KBHsX7JQ.review_text: a 24 hour diner. fucking legit.  my homies and i just got done drinking after Fat-Tuesday and we surely had the drunchies!  Everything in walking distance was super packed because it was JUST about to closed.    very sad me, walked grumpy back to the car until my homie came upon this place!  Seriously, shiny like gold...I love you Sparkys for quenching my appetite :)  The menu had hella selections too.    "Do I want pizza or breakfast????"  Breakfast FTW  grub

UKsBKla6IjgOeKe_UC5Dbg.review_text: I can't fault Sparky's for anything. I only go there really late, usually after Halloween in the Castro (which is now defunct) or as a last resort, even though i always have the Best conversations with my booth neighbors, and usually do some table surfing.   But there is one dish here that is off the hook: The Tomar Pizza. Order it with exxtra cheese. It comes piping hot like a fondue. Outstanding.   One of the best late night dishes in the whole city.

WFYmCxClfy2CRM9agvnNiA.review_text: if people are whining about soarkys theyre way too fancy for their own good. this place is great. ive had some really fun nights in here. ive had some really trippy meals here after leaving a great SF party too. woah. anyway, i have simple tastes, and this place never disappoints me. one of my go-to dishes is huevos rancheros. 98% of places that serve this do it pretty much the same. sparkys huevos are excellent. better than the other diners for sure. wider range of options too.

lWA1G5bLoDtFE7fvWUxiDQ.review_text: Love the spicy fake chicken sandwich. And those curly fries :)

hsyELHmzrOBiffMc4uDO3g.review_text: WARNING: They are not open 24 hours like they say, only on weekends... between I love the milkshakes from there, you should try them

TDv_jpLhHUNnpWVUMCck5A.review_text: Rancid chicken tenders. Watered down ranch sauce. BBQ sauce tastes sour. Orange milkshake was decent (fresh squeezed orange juice).

-4YrC64hpNjif63Qu_TQhg.review_text: Ehh.  They're not terrible, but there are much better late-night options within easy walking distance.  Check out Little Orphan Andy's at Castro and Market, or It's Tops at Market and Octavia.

vg64AHoj5SIIdVdtDY_-Fw.review_text: Ahhh, another restaurant for me to review!  Let me think what I should write (as I squint my eyes and rub my chin).  In a nutshell, Sparky's offers horrible service but the food is decent.  I got a cheeseburger with avocado, which isn't too hard to make.  The food is definitely overpriced and the venue is not really clean.  The place is full of rockabillys who think they are the sh*t.  Ok, given I walked in dressed like a preppy guy (because I am), so I received some weird stares.  I'm not THAT preppy, yet they still gave me stares.    In a nutshell, they have bad service, overpriced food and the crowd is not too welcoming.  Maybe I went on a theme night or something, but I still feel as though I shouldn't be given weird looks.  I was about to go Kung Fu Asian on them.  *waaaaaaaaaaaaaah* (with an Asian accent)  Bruce Lee forever!

apEB2Sy_OaaD6HkGsxpg8g.review_text: i'm never ordering from Sparky's again! I would call this place all the time for late night deliveries on the weekend when no one else was open. I used to think they were great....but time and time again ordering from stupid counter guys and having to wait at least an hour for a really freaking stupid delivery guy has gotten to be too much and the countless times they have f**ked up my order and sent me the wrong things and food that is overpriced for that matter has made it hard to resist the urge to call back the person who took my order and verbally abuse them! You f**kin suck Sparky's!...i'm learning to cook!

5jLkKtE4HPlrbjw-0w9lvg.review_text: Even considering you're probably coming here after you get out of the bar, the food is pretty mediocre and the service terrible.  The vegan burger I got was extremely bland, despite all the condiments I had at my disposal. And the curly fries, which I normally love, were made up of all the little bits of the fries. What's the point of getting curly fries if you're not getting any curls?!  The waiter was completely clueless and the food took a while to come out. And the most god awful music was playing the whole time. It was 100% bad rock/pop remixes, straight out of the worst circle of hell. Yes, I know it's probably unrealistic to expect a lot of quality at 3 or 4 in the morning, but I've been to a lot of other places that provide a better experience than this.

BMI8iYCk3DxSsbxFTVoq4g.review_text: I usually come here when I'm headed to Lucky 13 and need to fill my stomach up.  I like their curly fries here, they are seasoned and crispy and oooooh so greasy...just they way they should be!    I came here Friday evening to meet my boyfriend up.  Since there is major traffic everywhere on Fridays...I knew that I would be waiting awhile.  But it's okay, because I was fine sipping on beer and eating my curly fries.  I don't come here because of great food.  The food is okay.  I like this place more out of convenience.  Also, you don't feel stupid walking in drunk because after 10 most people who come in to eat are helping their stomachs.  I was sad to see that they pained the bathroom walls, I liked looking at all of the crap people would write up there.

bYJq4gkKZFCzM2MtqOfDuQ.review_text: I ate at Sparky's last night for the first time. It exceeded my expectations. It's a very friendly atmosphere and the food is of pretty good quality - especially for a diner that serves 24 hours.  The ketchup and the jelly wasn't all organic, natural and Agave sweetened and what not, but it's ok. i wouldn't eat there all the time because there wasn't a very versatile selection of menu items for vegans. I was able to find a tofu burrito with vegan sausages on the side. The food was fresh and delicious and I was very content.  I cannot help but briefly talk about the waiter - I should've asked his name. He is the dopest waiter I ever saw!!. He's a like a good looking guy in his early 20's. His general demeanor and character was extra-ordinary in an entertaining way!! :) He looked very spacey very shy and introverted. He would not talk to you when you ask him a question but try to communicate with gestures, uncoordinated and vague head movements and quiet babbles!!!. As if he's living in an 11- dimensional world and we're just seeing a 3 dimensional projection of him in our tiny world..  He's the living proof of string theory !!

XUm4bJy5seRuG_OELvRGGQ.review_text: I must have been really drunk and it must have been late at night and long ago when I went here and had a good meal.  I have been sober for years so it was a damn long time ago.    I went in for late morning pancakes.  Ugh...  please clean the grill before you start making pancakes.  It was clear he/she had cooked sausage earlier on the same grill.  Being I am vegetarian eating sausage flavored pancakes is less then appealing.   The waiter was efficient yet not friendly.  The place was clean.    In describing the pancakes, Light and fluffy does not come to mind.

_BHTC7nyCBoZcfiiD5cOXg.review_text: I can understand someone with a severe case of the 4:00am munchies dragging himself in here for a greasy burger and salty fries, but there's no excuse for his returning stone cold sober at high noon for more of the same. As dreadful as the food is, the service is even worse. It's better than Orphan Andy's, but that's like saying three extractions are better than a root canal . . . in the end, you suffer just as much the day after. I know people who consider this place a shrine. I went once and became an atheist.

t0-AcuBeZryCloEIGQ7FxQ.review_text: Sparky's has been in the neighborhood for years.  Not great food, but serviceable fare with reasonably pleasant staff.  They've been slipping over the years, so we've been going there less and less often.  But today was my last visit.  Never again.  It was at least an hour for a simple BLT with fries and an iced tea. (I didn't time it because who on earth would have thought they should!)  A five year old could have done this in 5 minutes.  But somehow the kitchen didn't get the order when I placed it, so after an interminable wait the waitress brings the sandwich with a "Sorry it took so long, the kitchen didn't get your order."  And what was on the plate?  A BLT with bacon, lettuce, two small slices of tomato, served on bread that may have seen a toaster at some point in it's life but certainly never spent enough time with one to have made much of an impression, and 3 limp pickle slices.  And as if that's not bad enough, the fries are no where to be seen.  "Oh, you wanted fries."  They do appear in a few minutes, but by then I'm done.  She brings the bill, and I set the card on the table and wait.  You would think she'd be sensitive to time at this point, but she get's paid by the hour, apparently.  She certainly didn't make any extra money on my order - I couldn't even bring myself to leave a tip.  No, the place wasn't busy.  No, she wasn't swamped with orders.  The table behind me also had issues with their order (you mean the yolks on a poached egg shouldn't be hard like that?).    If I could give 0 stars I would.  From now on I'll save myself the extra 20 paces and go to Crepevine instead.

qmdFtYaQVsDDfgCpvumnnA.review_text: I came here for the first time when I visited San Francisco for the first time. The food was alright. Actually, I now wish I had ordered something else..because what I ordered, seems like I could've easily gotten it at Denny's or something in Socal. But yeah.. what my friends ordered looked good, so I'll say that the food was delicious. I don't remember the name of the waitress, but she didn't seem friendly or anything. Or that she just didn't seem like she wanted to be there...and this was for brunch! But yeah, other than that, the service was pretty good. I don't know if or when I'm ever coming back to SF, but if I do, I'd probably stop by this place if I'm around the corner.. if not, no big deal.

NS9avDS6mYaiW3gYB_5ejQ.review_text: Great Place for the late night munchies! - They deliver. Breakfast and burgers were always good. After they changed the menu a few years ago, I've hadn't had a real chance to try their food, but the soups are good, shakes, malts.   I tried their pastas and desserts... great food for the price. I think they have Pizza again, I know they did years and years ago. Worth checking out.

Dgx185t0xrXT8nboVCNBqA.review_text: A late night diner near the Mission district. Personally I think that they can do better. I had a Seattle omelette and my friend had a twos eggs with sausage and chili cheese fries. The whole meal was below average hence the rating. The omelet was quite flat and tasteless. The sausage was.... well kinda dry and again un flavorful. The chili cheese fries had hardly any chili (we did ask for more and they did give it to us) and the cheese was kinda like nacho cheese sauce.... yuk.  I know we were hungry, we ate everything...... really though if there was anywhere else open after 2am!!

Af3xEMFb1vYNeCVuP6uiNg.review_text: The line for lunch on the weekend at Crepevine and Thoroughbread were long so I thought it would be fine to eat at Sparky's since there were plenty of tables and we were starving. I highly regret putting my friends though this, failing to check yelp first, not taking all the empty table as an indication, etc.   First of all, we were seated at a table under the skylight. It would normally be nice to get some sun, except it was so bright that my friends seated at the far end of the table needed to wear sunglasses whilst inside. We requested to be moved to one of the many other available tables, but the waitress wanted to keep us in the same general area (unclear why as the place looks empty from the outside as the tables closer to the front window were kept empty). She did let us move though, but asked us to wait for them to clear the table immediately next to us.   My main complaint is how long everything took. It took at least half an hour before they took our orders, and it took probably another hour and a half before our food came. When we were about 40 minutes into our wait, we saw the table next to us get their food and I think they ordered before we even say down because I didn't see them order in the time we were there.   The food was standard dirty diner fare, I suppose. I ordered chili and it looked like for the cheese, they cut up a Kraft slice into even smaller squares and dumped it on top. It wasn't terrible... Maybe an apt description would be "very mediocre," or "the epitome of mediocre."  The diner was not at all busy while we were there, so I'm not clear on why everything took so long. Looking at the other reviews, I see that this is a common complaint about this place.   I mostly just feel bad for putting my friends through this. Poor decision-making on my part.   The waitress, who otherwise was pretty surly the whole time, did thank us for our patience when we were leaving. I did appreciate that and wonder whether she is used to having people get mad and yell at her for how long things take. We did recognize that she is not entirely to blame for the long wait.   As a whole, I think that it is a poorly run restaurant operation. Maybe it stays in business because late night people have few options. As for during the day, I recommend eating elsewhere... Unless you have about 2.5 hours to kill.

zkHqDiPAP9mfswnktudHmw.review_text: Wowza! The food is excellent and they deliver. Someone in there changed everything for good.   Well done, mates! Welcome back to the neighborhood.

BolnZgFqi9DN-RXrv8awvw.review_text: Okay... but why would you fry like 1 million tiny pieces of chicken till they're burnt and call them chicken tenders? They are seriously the type of little sliced chicken strips you'd find on top of a salad, and taste like rosemary (???) I found 1 fry in the mass chicken grave and it was the best part of the meal.  I gave them an extra star because I keep ordering from them and I'm not sure why. And that's on me.

WdNEuRv-zjqr15C2vHeVwQ.review_text: Let me put it this way: it's Saturday at noon and I feel gross and hungover, my stomach is rejecting me, and I'm making vows to "never ever do that again as long as I live."   And I didn't even drink last night. But I DID go to Sparky's at 1am.  Worst grilled cheese sandwich I've EVER had. How the hell can they fuck THAT up? I dunno but they should get some sort of award for it. Everything I've ever eaten here has, at best, slid down somewhat easily. And at worst, has been awful. Last night, my Sparky's-loving friend hit her limit too when she ordered a turkey sandwich and they brought her chicken. She too is vowing to never go back. And my other friend ordered a glass of white whine, they brought her the bottle to show her, and then returned with a glass of red, saying that they'd run out of white.   And their mac & cheese is an embarrassment to the mac & cheese loving community.  For subpar diner food, it's expensive. AT LEAST the shakes are delicious. I WILL grant them that. However,  remember in "Pulp Fiction" when Travolta says "A $5 shake? You don't put bourbon in it?" Yes, those were 1994 prices, but still, your shake here is going to cost $8 after tax and tip and there's no bourbon in it.  From everything my five senses tell me, there are only two reasons to go here: first, because they're open at the witching hour. And second, if you want people to see that you are more rock-hipster than they are (the amount of posturing that goes on here at 2am is unbelievable.) As for the first reason: there are other places open at this time. And as for the second reason, get it through your head that nobody gives a shit... especially at 2am.  One almost feels sorry for the waitstaff, but then you realize that they made their own bed that they're lying in, and it's probably (to them) some weird badge of coolness to work there.  After being dragged there many times and having the same experience there each and every time, I don't know why anybody gives this place a good rating. Yo emperor: I can see your junk.  Consider yourself very thoroughly warned.

LmOPsRrgP4z6TuFyQRnJmw.review_text: DO NOT!!! come here unless you are so drunk or high that you won't realize how horribly they're treating you. Seriously, only go here when you're wasted and desperate for food...and even then you should reconsider (try Little Orphan Andy's instead up the street).  Tonight's the last time I ever come here. I showed up 20 minutes after I placed my phone order, the time I was told to arrive. When I gave them my name, they looked with a mixture of confusion and panic. After a couple minutes of conversation between the frazzled people behind the counter, I was told that my to-go order had been accidentally picked up by the delivery guy. I said okay and they called the delivery guy to try to get him to come back. After 5 minutes, they gave up on the delivery guy and said they were going to have the kitchen re-make the order. It was explained to me that this was GREAT because then I'd be getting it "all fresh and hot." Really? What was my original order going to be? Old and cold?  Oh well, I try to be nice to customer service people cause I know it's a horrid job, so I just said okay and was nice about it. Another 15 minutes later and the delivery guy comes in with my order. For a second, they seemed to ponder trying to give me the cold order, soggy fries and all, but they reconsidered. Another couple minutes passed and they brought out the order from the kitchen and rung me up for the full amount. At this point, I'd been standing in the restaurant for nearly 30 minutes. I said, "aren't you going to give me a discount for my troubles?" The guy looked at me like I was crazy and said, "I'd have to ask my boss. I can't make that decision." I said, "Please do."  Wait another 5 minutes while he consults his supervisor in the back office.  "I'm sorry, my boss said we can't do that at this time."  I told him, "thank you" and walked out right there. It was the middle of the night and I was starving, but I wasn't going to be treated like crap, given mediocre food AND be expected to pay full price for the privilege.  Congrats Sparky's manager, in your attempt to save a couple bucks, you made the meal twice, got a grand total of $0 and lost me as a customer for good. Clearly the bad service and bad business decisions extend from the top on down. With any luck, this place will be out of business soon and be replaced by one that knows how to treat customers.

SnaU3TzpWlt4-VtMAWhaxA.review_text: Im sorry. Im not sure what everyone else is talking about, but maybe you guys were ordering the wrong things.. I ordered a Superb Burger, mozzarella sticks, and chicken wings. Their chicken wings are some of the best I've ever eaten.. I ordered them in the restaurant and I also had them delivered on a different day. Both times they were delicious... Also had an amazing Apple Pie milkshake. Definitely a spot to go to late at night after the party... Better than Denny's or IHOP in my opinion.    For what it's worth, it's a pretty bitchin' spot. Waiters were good to me... pretty speedy and prompt. Maybe y'all just went in on a bad night or something..

bzrNySmVDTcrgq9zMjdT2Q.review_text: When you tell someone that a pizza will be there in 45 min, that doesn't mean 1.5 hrs. Pizza was great but delivery was a joke. Also the "promised" ranch was never included.

WjVkzrNya82rYaTN-XYojQ.review_text: Sparky's is great drunk food.  Listen, I swear I don't have a problem.  I just love beer and breakfast.  Those are the two vital food groups.  Eventually (never,) I'm going to open a bar that serves breakfast foods with beer.  It will be a happy day.    Until then, I have to settle for beer first, breakfast later.  Such is life.  Sparky's is a great option for post-beer breakfast in the Castro.   Wait, did I mention that this place delivers?!?!  Amazing!

lsSiIjAKVl-QRxKjRErBeg.review_text: This is what happens when it's 3am and your stomach's screaming for food. Sparky's the perfect place to make bad decisions at. bit.ly/1tVWzH9 My stomach was on fire, the last shot of Jaeger did not sit well at all. This was all thanks to our kickass bartender at BlackBird (yelp.com/biz/blackbird-s…), who managed to get us drunk as hell in a matter of 20mins. Our punishment for walking in at last call, lol. Back to Sparky's... It's open 24hrs and the portion sizes are massive. Perfect place to carb up and stuff yourself silly before passing out after a long night of partying. 'Nuff said. CALIFORNIA OMELETTE ($8.75) A 3 eggs omelette with melted cheddar cheese, crispy smoked bacon and guacamole. It's served alongside a couple pieces of heavily buttered toast and a choice of either hash browns or home fries. - It seemed more of a scramble, with the way everything was folded/mixed into the eggs, but it was tasty. I ate some of the above omelette, but this heart-cloggging plate is my actual oder. bit.ly/1tVTA1p Out of all the things there were to order, I wanted CORNED BEEF HASH ($8.75). - Served w/toast, 2 eggs and choice of either hash browns or home fries. - They didn't ask me how I wanted my eggs. I guess I looked more scrambled than sunny-side-up to them that night.... I ordered a side of hot sausage links and requested that they cook the $hit out of my corned beef hash, because I prefer it crispy. - They ran out of hot links and my corned beef was still a pile of oily mush. It's all good, all that greasy food helped me immensely - woke up with no hangover! Woot!

ICnDcpKbx4VGOPTHZOLFxQ.review_text: Here are the objective facts:   The place was empty on a recent Sunday night around 1:00 a.m.   Three friends and I walked in and were promptly seated and given menus.   We ordered:   Blueberry pancakes w/ eggs over medium.  Biscuits and Gravy w/ eggs over easy.  Breakfast Burrito w/side of guacamole, side of hash browns and side of bacon.   The two women in my party were convinced by the waiter to share the breakfast burrito because, "It's huge."   We received:  Blueberry pancakes w/eggs over easy.  Two biscuits - no gravy/w eggs over medium, hash browns and guacamole.  Breakfast Burrito.   Here's the editorial: In case you didn't catch it, here's what was wrong:  Eggs were served with the wrong order.  Biscuits and Gravy served without Gravy but with Hash browns and guacamole. Why the hell would I want guacamole and biscuits? Who am I, Colonel Sanders vacationing in Havana?  Breakfast burrito served without hash browns or bacon. And too small to share between two people.   When we asked for the missing orders they were promptly delivered. We received our side of bacon, another side of hash browns and I happily scooped the guacamole away from my biscuits and onto the breakfast burrito. I also received a bowl of lumpy gravy for my biscuits. The kind of gravy that crazy Aunt Wanda makes with her dry pot roast on Sundays. She thinks it's fantastic and the family agrees while winking at each other and crushing lumps of par-cooked flour between their teeth.   I left the gravy in the bowl and ate the biscuits dry because, despite having biscuits and pancakes on the table, we never received the butter that we asked for. In Sparky's defense, and even though they were delivered with the wrong order, the eggs were cooked perfectly.   Before this month, the last time I ate here was about 7 years ago and I had a much better experience back then. In my opinion, the menu is too bloated and they would be better off doing a few things well than doing a lot of items poorly. In the future, I will skip Sparky's and grab a slice of pizza.

462cuUQXn5hkx12OyVq7dw.review_text: To that buzz kill hipster chick who I had happened to sit across tables from the other night, I'm sorry I was really into the music and that I wasn't wearing a v-neck t-shirt. But in case you hadn't figured it out, my city won the world series that night, so sorry I was emanating positive energy and made accidental eye contact with you,  k?   What is it with transplant hipsters though?  I'm not a nativist but what's wrong with enjoying a great atmosphere and the best one of a kind apple pie milkshake in the city like you really mean it?

n9j40NJNoehiV4DRN-z2QA.review_text: If "the staff is tragically hip," the food is just tragic.  I'll have to be mighty desperate to eat here again.

eWPRlsUbCT0UGj_cPSWmPg.review_text: Be honest. You're here because you've been out all night and nothing else around is open. A while back I went in and ordered some onion rings. The order was small and probably cost about a dollar an onion ring. Onions aren't expensive and it's not like they were using some special organic heirloom onions from a local farm. What the hell? Another time I was with friends and they lost my friend's order two or three times. I'll pass, thanks.

xyT5quT4iKsQydUK-bZr4A.review_text: I've honestly never had anything bad here. I've never had anything super great either, but nothing horrible.  I've definitely had a lot of "It's 1 am and I crave eggs and hash browns and using our kitchen at this hour will wake up our downstairs neighbor" adventures there, and it's always been exactly what I wanted. I usually get their eggs benedict 'cause even though the english muffins are kinda soggy most times, the eggs are always poached perfectly.   Sometimes the servers will make me honey mustard with the chicken tenders, sometimes they won't. That's a little weird.

88xAGT19XCZ9bnefAuInIA.review_text: I wanted something to eat on a Thursday night around midnight and it seemed like the perfect time to finally give this place a shot. My waitress seemed annoyed that I was there. My order got 'lost', even though it was incredibly slow and there were only 3-4 other tables. The food was OK. You could get better service at McDonald's and spend half as much money. I added a second star for the only positive part of my experience- the awesome 90's music playlist they had playing.

e_Cr4xSKD6VfqhxLsWo2dQ.review_text: Since time immemorial--as in, since the 1980s--the creatures of the night have steadily descended after dark upon a neon-lit greasy-spoon at Church and Market Streets to openly party, trip, come down, despair, and otherwise cop an attitude with fellow diners from all corners of society and the globe. Oh, and to eat as well. And the place is actually open even when the sun is up, not that it really matters to most patrons.  So much of what makes Sparky's a modern San Francisco landmark is unrelated to the food--sure, the menu is huge and the traditional American fare passable to good--which is why I'm not too concerned about the rumored transition to a more upscale pizza-bearing Sparky's.  But I'm reserving the right to overhaul this review if the newest incarnation of Sparky's somehow doesn't include all-day breakfast, greasy onion rings, and reserved seating for latter day 1980s death-rockers.

ZBPW5RoxD7eFE5OwVYlegQ.review_text: I love Sparky's Diner so much, and not just because it's walking distance for me. From to-die-for Chocolate-Peanut Butter Shakes, to salads to Chicken Marsala to mashed potatoes to the desserts, to omlettes to yummy steaks and cheesburgers with fixin's to a latte delivered during an intense all-nighter (on a project). The quality of the food is fabulous. As said, I love this place.

FVRGHTS_1T1pNtJO-mc02A.review_text: Admittedly not spectacular, but good for rainy day delivery comfort food.  We've tried quite a few things on the menu and found most everything to be nicely prepared and tasty--from the salads, to the Chicken Parmesan  sandwich, to the side of meatballs, to the elbow noodle Mac-n-Cheese.   The 2-stars comes from their apparent inability to get the order correct the first time. Whether ordering online or via the phone, inevitably something is missing or incorrect each time we've ordered. And while the manager Paulo has been accommodating in trying to remedy these situations (refunds, re-delivery & future credits), it's just gotten to be too frustrating. Maybe the secret is to cook at home more?....nah. But we're tapped out on Sparky's for now.

OaOFpAdUYAJ9vv2OHUmDXw.review_text: Great place!  Incredibly friendly waiter named Ben.  Wonderful place to work on off-hours when nobody's around.

jEekGB8GY5KHBVhF4Aoh2g.review_text: This is hands down one of my favorite places to eat in the city. I'm very particular about how I take my bloody marys, and I try and sample them at as many places as I can. Well, this place has the best bloody mary I've had in the city so far. Even balance of salt, heat, citrus, and tomato/vodka taste. Perfect.   The food here is also pretty rad. I'd give it a 4 if it weren't for the really nice service and awesome portion size (Which doesn't drag the quality down. These are huge portions of delicious stuff, not piles of crap.) but because of all that, this place gets a 5 from me. One of my favorite places in the city.

Z4-Avzo2HW8TSsrF740dsA.review_text: The only good thing about this place as they are open and deliver 24 hours. Against the advice of my boyfriend I decided to order from here. The menu looked good, but the food was disgusting....most of it was inedible. This is my first yelp review and it was so bad I felt I would be doing a disservice to everyone else if I didn't try to let people know.  The goat cheese salad was drenched in dressing, the lettuce was wilted and soggy and the olives were sour...as if they came from a expired batch. Two bites and I threw it away. The mac and cheese tasted like there was ground up aspirin in it. Also threw out after two bites. I never know you could make mac and cheese taste so bad. My boy friends chicken fingers were dry and tasteless, also not eaten. The chili was over salted...also not eaten.   They forgot our milkshake. We reported it to grub hub and they arranged for us to have another delivered...took another hour, but that was actually the only thing that tasted good.  All in all we paid $42 for a milkshake.  I have never been so disappointed.  Do not eat here. I wish I researched this first.

mgKf6Q-FxCA1rg6Vtd7GBw.review_text: I love that it's 24 hours, that's a big deal for young adults who get off work late or are just partying, I love that there's delivery and pickup, and I love that the menu has a ton of stuff on it so like whatever you're craving you can find. The milkshakes are great too.  However, the fact that service is crazy slow in the restaurant as well as delivery is a drawback. And most of the food is not remarkable. But my boyfriend is a big fan of the buffalo wings. Worth to have around, but maybe just once in awhile.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Open 24 hours. Bright orange walls. There's a lifesize version of Archie (of Archie comics) sitting at a barstool with a huge smile ready to greet you at the front door.    Came to Sparky's after I got off work at midnight.    Curly fries, not so good. But if you drown it in the ranch dressing that it comes with, it'll do.  I have no complaints with my blueberry pancakes; but they totally overcooked my boyfriend's eggs benedict.  They're supposed to be poached for only 3 minutes tops maybe.  This eggyolk was solid, man. Solid.  Our waitress was attentive. And didn't forget to refill our waters.

ZZJ-NpEeAw-01OLF_WCfWg.review_text: A little David Bowie. Some Marilyn Manson. A lot of Little Mermaid. But mostly, Harry Potter.  Sparky's is wild at 2am... and you really shouldn't experience it any other time. Food is average, but it's fun. You are sure to leave with a story.

1rgqs1dJolgDktIR9z6u4A.review_text: I don't plan on coming back to this place. I came with some friends and ordered nachos as a late-night snack. Then I woke up with food poisoning. Worst experience of my life. Don't make the same mistake.

BAYRxyOA85kURkjNBVtWnw.review_text: I'm automatically giving it 5 stars because it's open 24 hours.   I used to always go here whenever I ran out of condoms, because they have a bunch of free ones in the bathrooms. Thank you Sparky's for making sure S.F. stays sexually healthy.   The food isn't amazing, but it's open around the clock! What more can one ask for?

mDr8-1fjAk2TH9FRQSYT5Q.review_text: Sparky's gets cut a lot of slack for location, hours, and ok food, but there are other 24 hour diners in the Castro and you should go to one of them instead. One time I went there and saw multiple rats running around the dinning room. The last straw was when I placed an online order and they completely screwed it up and brought a meat burger that my veggie bf couldn't eat. When I call to complain the person on the phone was very very mean and rude and completely unapologetic. Never again Sparky's, never again.

i8L_pnkXcJQ8VyApK_3_mw.review_text: Intoxication overload.  Blurry vision.  Hunger setting in.  Its 2am...where to go?  SPARKY'S.  Sparky's is always a reliable lifesaver.  Open 24hrs. for those nights where you're in desperate need to soak up all that liquid sin, or nights where you've been so indecisive (this would be me) that every other restaurant has now closed.  I wouldnt say the food is the best in the city, but its decent enough diner food.  Plus they make a fantastic strawberry/chocolate milkshake (mitchell's ice cream, ohhh yeahhh).  Its my signature shake, so dont go stealing my shit!

Zl1fJNTzNULZiqBRShxUYA.review_text: I have trouble giving only three stars to a 24-hour restaurant, especially one that has interesting vegan options--well, at least one.  But hear me out.  So I have always thought the world of Sparky's because I mistakenly believed that It's Tops was Sparky's.  It turns out that I had never been to Sparky's, and I technically never have been.  I ordered delivery at around 3:30 a.m. (seriously) from work.  I was totally psyched to have something besides pizza or pasta delivered.  The guy who took my order was really nice, although he put me on hold for a long time and proceeded to do so a couple more times.  Technically, I was out of their delivery range, but they made an exception for me, which I appreciate.  When the food came, it was bland and cold.  It was definitely a two-star experience, but I give them mad props for delivering until four.  Mad props=one star.  UPDATE:  3/27/09 ==============  So I'm taking away a star for two reasons.  First, the last time I was in here, the service was atrocious.  I might be using too kind a word.  The server wasn't mean; he just didn't check on us, refill our water, or ever bring a drink that one of my companions had ordered.  Ever.  And it wasn't exactly busy.  The guy was literally spending his time brushing his James Iha hair and talking to a girl at another table.  The other reason I'm removing a star is that although this place now officially does deliver to my place of work (yea!), the food has been cold both times I've ordered, and the delivery takes forever.  UPDATE:  5/29/09 ==============  Late-night vegetarian options or not, it doesn't really matter if they never get your order right.  How difficult is it to remember an order of fries with a veggie burger?  And that breakfast comes with toast?  I'm not usually terribly picky when it comes to 24-hour delivery, but Sparky's has made me dread the delivery man's arrival.  So I'm done.  UPDATE:  9/12/10 ==============  In addition to its other inadequacies, Sparky's is wheelchair inaccessible.  It doesn't really help to have a ramp inside the restaurant when you need to climb a step to enter the restaurant.

H9FnhuwhThIk7-alE-FdwA.review_text: Destination for drunkies, since it's opened 24/7. Went here over the weekend after celebrating my boyfriend's birthday. Got to Sparkys around 3:30am and it was packed! However, got seated within minutes. Service was good, but food was was not.

CiJat5Up2jAO3B0qTbiN5Q.review_text: After going back and forth on where we should venture out for dinner, my husband suddenly decided on Sparky's.  I have never heard of this place.  It was quiet - including us, there were only two occupied tables.  They have a pretty extensive menu of simple diner fair.  Steak and eggs for me.  Chicken club sandwich for my hubby.  My meal was OK.  Large portions - I took have of it home.  The club sandwich was GOOD.  I was surprised.  I think it was the bacon that did it.  Not the usual sorry burnt bits that you usually get.  This was solid, meaty, crunchy bacon.  Yum.  I have to say, it's one the best I've ever tasted.  I give an extra point for the chicken club alone.  Friendly staff, quick food to table.  On of the few 24 hour eateries in the city - I can imagine this place filling up after clubbing hours.

P3usQcIegPCl-cdH4IDirg.review_text: Definitely a place to go when everything else is closed, and not when there are other decent options. I popped in at 8:30 on a Monday morning, and frankly, it scared me that I was the ONLY person there for a good half-hour chunk of time. I had a fruit-and-yogurt and a coffee, chilled, prepped for my interview. It was decent breakfast food, average price, no complaints really. But obviously there are other better options, and everyone but me was there.  Bathrooms are a bit scary, too.  Tried to go back today and give them a chance to prove themselves capable of more. Stood by the "please wait to be seated" sign five minutes and saw zero employees. I'm done.

DdfS2gJdh5QVtWCmL97LKA.review_text: Attempted to order twice via eat24.  They were too overwhelmed to complete the order.  Really?  Perhaps you need to get a better business model, or shut down. Foods honestly not that good, but the shakes are good.  Ahh well, time to find a replacement.

xaEqZbBe7yQcWvD9nbSK9A.review_text: Tough crowd!!   Was sparky's not there for every drunk post-redezvous meal?  Was sparky's waitor not filling your drink after every sip?  Was your meal not on your table within 5 minutes of ordering?  I rest my case.

ZJ3pqPyb5Y5lTLACdBV-lw.review_text: Struttin on a rainy day with ma leatha to end up finding a real greasy spoon diner really answered the prayers to my gloomy day blues. Had a original SF vibe to it, sweet eclectic tunes and had a comforting hum to it. Pretty down biscuits and gravy with soft yummy biscuits. Not too bad, Sparky's. I'll def be back. Maybe with the posse ;)

FYgvo8S25-6BSyACIE3hkg.review_text: The best thing about sparky's is that it's open 24 hours. You won't catch me there during the daytime but come late night it's an okay choice. Decent food, decent prices. No Internet , a few wall outlets for laptops.

FV4wF8XBAbO5Ucq8KO3tyA.review_text: The delivery hours are SO CONVENIENT.  But the first time I actually visited the place, we were served by an obviously methed-out waiter and given very very bad food.  Needless to say, we didn't tip.

6zgm4JX3gyWFWXFktXHMbQ.review_text: On my latest visit, I was enjoying an uber-delicious warm chocolate cake with chocolate Mitchell's ice cream when I noticed that someone had left the Sparky's Training Manual on one of the tables. I have to admit I peeked. Here's what I found:  Section 4: Ambiance In order to foster a pleasing atmosphere, employees should restrict the restaurant playlist to two genres of music: either pop music from 1980 to 1989, i.e. "the 80s", or amateur recordings obtained from friends or produced by independent bands labeling themselves as "punk". If the latter, music shall consist of one loudly distorted guitar, one screaming white woman, and one Sock-Em (tm) brand drum kit, available from  Wal-Mart. Said music shall be played at the loudest possible setting so that patrons must shout to communicate with one another. Excessive noise is essential to the Sparky's brand and employees should endeavor at all times to achieve maximum volume.  Section 9: Employee Attitude Remember, you are the face of Sparky's! In order to maintain our restaurant's unique image, employees should refrain from interacting with customers. Employees shall take every opportunity to remind the customer that the customer is not cool. Communication, when necessary for obtaining orders or payment, shall be delivered with a patina of resentment and bitterness. Under no circumstances is the employee to make a customer feel welcome as that will discourage our target demographic of mid-20, socially active, bellicose, preferably intoxicated men and women known collectively as "punk", "goth", or "emo". Any employee caught smiling, unless in an ironic manner, will be reprimanded and subject to disciplinary action.  That's as far as I got before the waiter snatched it out of my hands. He said something but I couldn't hear him because of my ear plugs.

gosNE62t1GQnbdITjC2bBg.review_text: I keep trying Sparky's because I want to like it so badly. They have a gigantic menu and they deliver until 4am, so they are quite the resource.  But their food is bland. I've eaten a late night dinner there once before, but this review is for delivery.   I ordered of a bowl of mac and cheese, along with chicken strips. The mac and cheese was almost flavorless, and arrived in a coffee cup. I don't really have an issue with the latter, but lack of flavor matched up with lack of presentation isn't a great combo. Made me kind of wish I spent 5 times less the amount and just went and picked up a box of Kraft.  I had a major craving for some legit chicken strips, but Sparky's version wasn't at all what most people would have in mind. I expected some meaty, deep friend pieces of chicken. But what I got was a very thin chicken breast, lightly breaded, and then cut into 1/2 pieces after the fact.  So it was only partially breaded, was extremely dry, and also had very little flavor.  Their mozzarella sticks and cheeseburgers seemed to be solid, but anything else I've ordered was pretty much cafeteria food. But hey, they deliver rather quickly. Maybe I'm just ordering the wrong stuff. Or maybe I should just reserve them for drunchies exclusively.

fBdhA2Q1Y_lTR7_nje4PyA.review_text: I am fan.  It is near my place and always hits the spot.  Especially when you want some greasy diner food- like when you are hungover.  It also helps that the staff is always very helpful and friendly.  I've had the veggie burrito, tuna salad (carrot ginger dressing is great), and eggplant parmasean.  They were all good.  Warning- my friend had the mac n' cheese and said it tasted funky.  She was also very hungover, so take my comment lightly.

qCBlnHPzhRGC6UZZrhVJog.review_text: So this was my first time ordering from sparky's  (2nd mistake) my first mistake was not reading the reviews ... We ordered garlic cheese bread ($4.50) expecting a basket of yummy bread...what we got was a sandwich size piece of microwaved bread with a slice of cheese on it...it looked like plastic or rubber sitting on top of the soggy bread...it was disgusting...we took a bite and had to spit it out!! Literally!!  We also ordered fettuccine Alfredo ($11.50) and they charged us ($5.50) extra to add chicken !! which would of been fine but they literally gave us 5 tiny pieces of chicken the size of a sugar cube..it was a joke ...why even bother?  We immediately asked for a refund ...which they kindly gave upon return of the food.    Moral of the story...read the reviews before agreeing to drop $30 on a meal!!

y1ym5ODAIe6cibsmah3C5g.review_text: Not saying that diner food is something to write home about compared to the various other cuisines we have in San Francisco... But a ROACH running across the table towards my plate? Running onto my fork and wrecking havoc until my little brother smashed it with a water glass?? Unacceptable. Why oh why did we miss the 280 exit to In-N-Out Daly City on the way home from SFO????

bjxHKIFpck-T-0z6CUAAxQ.review_text: We've been here a few times and i hadn't written a review.  Here goes... Last night we ordered: He: steak and cheese  She: the goat cheese salad The steak and cheese they make uses thicker strips of steak, which for true philadelphia cheesesteak folks, it doesn't cut it.  However, it was deemed delicious by a somewhat picky eater.  The salad was amazing. i added chicken and total for our order was less than $22.

4MpFtAkQ9wTk8Bvb66vPxA.review_text: Oooh Sparky's...the memories....drunken nights...needing something to help soak up all the alcohol you've consumed through the night!  They are great for delivery late at night...my bf only lived a couple of blocks away..and when we needed a quick, late night fix we'd dial em up..  I always got the tuna melt..yum..and my bf always got the heartstopper!  Great name huh?  That sucker looked like it could stop your heart too!

21-Jx9uKXPChF04aOd-z5Q.review_text: Boooooo!!!  This place sucks.  It is disgusting.  The people that work here always creep me out, they must be stoned or something 24 hours a day (what the 24 hours sign means).  Their pancakes taste like bacon... what is that about?  I know it's open late, but the people who are giving it good reviews probably ate here after a long night of drinking... otherwise I don't see how they could give this place even 2 stars.  DISGUSTING.

5JBUr02Eemexu4f3nVIRvA.review_text: This place is pretty awesome. I eat here with friends almost every time I visit San Francisco. It's got decently priced food for the district of the city that it's in and it's pretty damned good. I'm a big fan of the fire chicken sandwich, the bloody mary and the grilled cheese. Damn the grilled cheese is good. Three kinds of cheese. Add a tomato for $1 more, ham for $2 more.  The atmosphere is cool, it's open late, it generally seems to be packed (more so late at night) and in general it's just a good time. I wish I had one within walking distance of my apartment.

CsguIDuWWwsy58seF52RoQ.review_text: Wow, I have to say I was very surprised to see that the menu has undergone some reconstruction.   New items such as pizza, pasta and new chicken burger selections have been added (hmm.. we'll see about pizza and pasta... but at least they have more variety in their food selections)!   They used to only have one chicken sandwich was real chicken (others were the fake chick variety) - the fiery chicken sandwich which sometimes was too fiery!! Recently tried the grilled chicken burger with basil and garlic mayo (I believe it was garlic mayo..) and it was pretty good!   And of course, they still have their traditional 24 hour breakfast items and signature shakes! I like getting plain ol' vanilla or the My Chai shake.   I think I won't be as apprehensive about coming here anymore... since they've upped their menu and food game.  But be forewarned, they can get busy late weekend nights. Expect large, drunken crowds.

LdyVNZyPl6vR0THDPw5zIQ.review_text: I went there at 11 pm last night craving starch. Chili cheese  fries and macaroni cheese. I have bad taste from time to time. The macaroni and cheese was really good for the first few bites but further into the bowl the pasta was really wet and dry; so the mac and cheese went from decent to  gross. The service wasn't very good. The girl asked if we needed anything  right after serving the food, and then just left. We finally got another (far too small) glass of water as we finished our meals.  I'd probably go here again but probably just end up annoyed as I did last night.

Iy2CsyDCqsE8_wPEx66UZQ.review_text: now that I've come down off my jack daniel's "the world is a beautiful place where everything is great" high, i must say that this place is probably just alright. Come here at 3 am, get some decent food, say hello to the cute waitress, sing some songs on a jukebox and enjoy yourself.   I hope no one is expecting anything more.

0lDl1Jg1Qz2KhvkfJKk6fw.review_text: If you're the parent of a fourth grader, and I'll bet you're not, you know that fourth grade is when all California kids must do a California Mission report. This is a custom that I'm sure dates back to when Father Junipero Serra's illegitimate children were in the fourth grade. The whole thing with Serra started when he was in Spain or Mexico or something and got word of indigenous people living happy, disease-free lives so he headed north to straighten that shit out. The usual story...white man swoops in and fixes everything and everyone lives happily ever after. Well, except everyone who's not white.   Final Score: Father Serra       1 Miwok Indians    0  I guess I digress from the point of this review which of course is Sparky's.   Sparky's is not far from Mission San Francisco de Asis which is where I took my fourth grader. Since this is a major project (I believe it goes on his permanent record...Flash forward 20 years. He's on an important job interview. The second interview actually. The conversations had been going well to that point. In this interview, however, my son senses an chill in the room. "Son," the interviewer says, "We love your work history, Great grades at Cal and all that but we just got word of the shabby job you did on your papier mache model of the San Francisco Mission. We're very sorry.") After a triumphant couple of hours at the mission, you can't just go home. A celebration was in order. So of course, we headed to Sparky's. I was surprised to find that we were the only father and son there with a bag from the Mission giftshop but we were.  We were warmly greeted even though I told the host that we were just there for a hot chocolate and a coffee. I augmented my coffee with an order of huevos rancheros and my son ordered a cheeseburger and fries. The huevos were out of this world. Seriously. I was in heaven. I even ate the first few bites without my beloved Tapatio since anything tastes good bathed in Tapatio. I wanted to see if these huevos could stand on their own two feet, so to speak. Fantastic.  The burger was good. Not great. The fries were a bit better than that. I think the burger would have been better at 3 am for some reason.  Sparky's was a great way for me to close the final chapter on California Mission reports. As Missions go, I'd rate my experience with Mission San Juan Capistrano and even Mission San Juan Bautista to be superior to San Francisco but Sparky's provided the best post-Mission meal.

CqC6NR_8YXn77szaOqfw3w.review_text: Horrible service! Paid for our food and the server commented on us to another server: "I don't know what these guys are about"  while waiting for our order. Also asked for a bottle of water which came to us 20 minutes later. Also, don't order nachos. They microwave them.

XUN-R1MmL1h1reMapexuLA.review_text: hey, don't judge me. it was 1224am and we were hungry and all the good stuff closed or about to close (nopa, home, katanaya......), so we went to Sparky's tonight. yup. Havent been there in over a year, and usually i avoid it like the plague bc it just gets too cool for school with all the drunk hip kids being rowdy on latter weekday/weekend nights. but this mellow wednesday night was calm and NOT crackin'.. my fave. just a few tables of hungry folk wanting diner foods that WASN'T mel's diner. and ya know what? it was pretty good. in the mood for fettucine alfredo con clams. tasted hardy and loaded w/ clams. surprise surprise for sure. bf got corned beef hash. solid breakfast.   all right!

QBgKo-REQCVZBQXT6of6Wg.review_text: So this was my ish back when I still lived in the city. Nothing is quite like getting a Fiery Chicken sandwich, fries, and a chocolate shake at 2 in the morning.   Fast forward 10 years. I haven't set foot in SF since then, and I'm salivating at the thought of making my way back. Of course, Yelp didn't exist back then. Decided to peruse the reviews, to see if everyone agreed with my appraisal of the place. Color me surprised to see not everyone was exactly feeling Sparky's.  But you know what, I can't really disagree with the reviews. Service, well, could be better. I'm glad I'm not a fussy eater, as their disconnected waitstaff would piss me the eff off. I guess I don't really remember that aspect of Sparky's since I most frequently did takeout or delivery.  That said, the food was still exactly how I remember it. Nothing spectacular, but man does it ever hit the spot when you're starving at 2 am. The wife and I hit up Sparky's as we were meandering back from Berkeley, and with it being sorta late, and nothing else that I wanted was still open. So when you're in that spot, Sparky's is the place for you.

SIE7Kcl2C12x1lYWHklOEg.review_text: this just about sums up my experience at Sparky's every time i go:  last night my party ordered a burger, chicken sandwich, and a cheesesteak.   the waiter returned with a burger, chicken sandwich, and a cheeseCAKE.  no, i didn't return the cheesecake. i ate it. and it was delicious.

GHZdMggvuYk1fsVWcyy0JQ.review_text: Nice, friendly staff - one star They're open 24-hours - one star They're food is infinitely better than Mel's or Lori's Diner - priceless, but giving them one star.  The food here is basic diner food. Not particularly ground-breaking, but good and done well. I ordered the grilled cheese sandwich on sourdough, and my date ordered a cheeseburger. Both were good and the fries were also delicious. The blueberry coke was also good.

Rcmcf6UMXPNp7eNbLFEJ8Q.review_text: I have been coming to sparkys restaurant for a couple of weeks now and I love it here! The service is amazing! I always get the same server and he always has a diet coke ready for me when he sits me... The food always comes fast and is always hot and full of flavor! I like to try something new every-time I come but I find myself ordering the turkey burgers! Lol! I would rather come here and fell welcome and leave happy then goin to another place and feel like I'm just an " order" thanks sparkys I will always come back and eat here late night!

6ZpfGwq-raI2CmM69_aqng.review_text: Their peanut butter cup milkshake gets 4 stars, but everything else was pretty lame. I got biscuits and gravy, and it was not tasty.
