My date got pancakes with strawberries. I believe that if you pay extra for the fruit, you should get more than 2 sliced strawberries, that is simply a joke.  I guess this place is useful because it is open 24 hours, but if anything else is open, you should probably go there over this place.

GB-_2RcqhIuWrQ0ofkkCnA.review_text: Thanks to the late night partiers this place is able to stay afloat -- I've not heard one good thing about this place, and judging from my own experiences, these complaints are justified.  Once this place was teeming with despicable hipsters for servers, but now that they're mostly gone, it hasn't gotten any better. If anything, without them giving the place some hip, "happening" ambiance, this place has descended to a-leg-up-Happy Donuts stature. The place looks squalid and run-down, at least Happy Donuts employees are quick with their feet.  Their ho-hum, slop-house, greasy concoctions are exorbitantly priced, which can be excusable when on a drunken stupor, but even then the selection is poor and not very well-thought-out.  And how about their online delivery service? DREADFUL! They take their sweet time! I waited for an hour and a half only for the delivery person to miss a number on my phone and the entire transaction was shot to hell! I don't know about you, but: though the instructions say to call instead of ringing the bell, and I get one digit of that number off, I would have rung the bell anyway just to complete a transaction. Not only would I have not lost a customer, but I'd have not squandered the time of travel, not to mention, the gas money. I suggest you take off your online/delivery service since you're no good at it.  As I said, Sparky's Diner, you're lucky people go out on the weekends, otherwise you'd have no one to peddle your mediocre (at best!) food to. I, for one (although I'm sure of the many!), will stay away for good, there are plenty of other places around much like Sparky's, and with some virtue and potential.

QYUdOyXau5rfGFdyGF5f0g.review_text: best diner in sf!  if you are having the late night munchies don't hesitate to show up here. it's not the healthiest food and probably not the best diner food in the world but for what it is and where its located i have absolutely no complaints. reading over other reviews i notice that many people hate the service here and i can't blame them, the people here aren't always the kindest crowd but don't take it personal. if you bring a group of chill friends and an appetite and it's 3am then you shouldn't have any complaints either, unless you're that kind of person (in that case, too bad).

CM1SVXJ1kiH5uztj_Vg7XA.review_text: Meh.   The food here isn't great, but not horrible. However, always expensive. The service is almost always slow, and not overly friendly. The portions on anything but breakfast items are usually skimpy.   The last few times I ordered desserts, they were old/stale.   I used to come often, but I probably won't be back for a while.

MkM2EKWEz4Ki0rPTMHTs0w.review_text: After a fairly long night out, some dessert and Chai Tea sounded sooo bomb. 3am, where to go for sweets and tea? Our quest was not as adventure-filled as Harold and Kumar's but still a bit of a journey. And alas! Sparky's is open!!  Technically I've never went inside Sparky's but my friends got food to-go while I waited in the car. So my experience is curbside but still a good experience nonetheless.   We opted for the cheesecake and mixed berry pie (wound up with pecan pie somehow but was not disappointed with the mix up). It was good and satisfing but it was the tea that did me over.  HANDS DOWN THE BEST CHAI TEA I'VE HAD THUS FAR!!  I got so excited and couldn't wait for it to cool that I burned my tongue drinking it. We all know how a fuzzy tongue is incredibly obnoxious but it was worth it.  I couldn't finish the tea that night b/c I was so tired and my tongue hurt. I still craved it in the morning so.... don't judge me, but I reheated it in the microwave. Tossing it would have been such a waste of good tea!

e1yxZOZpJn566TjRjN0H8g.review_text: Seriously, the rudest employees I've ever had the displeasure of dealing with.  They were working the graveyard shift. My boyfriend and I stopped by around 3 AM and, granted, that sucks to be working that late but it's your JOB.   The waitor was EXTREMELY rude to me, and when I asked if they had vegan pancakes he thought I was insane and asked how someone could possibly make them. Not only that but he sat down next to me and got a little too close to my face which made me more than uncomfortable.  AND: Even though there were 2 other people in the whole place - we waited around 25 minutes and never got our food, so we asked nicely if we could get it in a to-go box.  Here's the kicker: When we got our stuff to go, we got home and looked in the bag, and IT WASN'T IN IT. They didn't even give us what we paid for. Probably $5 down the drain plus terrible, terrible service.  Screw this place. I'm never going evaaaaaaar again.

NSqM-xlb4mdsOtdEbvTX9A.review_text: Fast delivery for a Friday night after bar hours. Pizza was good. Hot wings were really bad. Left a horrible taste in my mouth. Forced down 3. Couldn't handle anymore after that

vlUyN6g2_AQKhWOxAe3FgA.review_text: Just mediocre food that you really need after a good night out. Servings are huge too!

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: Any place that can deliver a caramel vanilla blended shake to your door at 4 in the morning has my full support.  And I mean full support.  Sparky's has decent food. Not superb food by any means - but decent. Most late night diner spots - often sacrifice quality to dish out standard diner food to the drunk masses. Sparky's does just this. It's by no means a sober destination spot - but come some crazy often drama filled hour - when even MUNI is nowhere to be seen - Sparky's has your back.  Delivery has always been my friend - so I say  -save yourself the trip, put some horrible TV on - and order up some food and a shake. By all means don't forget that shake.  Check out their shake menu below. And in between shake slurps - you can thank me :)  Trust. (and despite this wave of sugary reviews - I am by all means sticking to my healthy eating plan. Promise :) )  Caramel Kiss Shake Rich vanilla meets homemade caramel sauce My Chai Shake Vanilla ice cream blended with chai tea Berry Blast Shake Strawberry ice cream with blackberry and raspberry syrup Apple Pie Shake Peanut Butter Cup Shake Chocolate ice creamwith peanut butter Mocha Mint Marvel Shake Chocolate syrup, espresso, mint syrup Orange Dreamsicle Shake  Lemon Chiffon Shake Smooth vanilla meets tangy lemon Nutty Professor Shake Coffee ice cream with hazlenut syrup Root Beer Freeze  The King Shake Elvis` Favorite! Peanut butter and banana

K8TChgjNRvEqaVfbQvAPKw.review_text: This place was amazing! When you are looking for some good breakfast on a late night tip, this is that spot.  I had the bacon milkshake.... wowzers!!   I'm coming back! And I am telling everyone how awesome it was, service and food.

T84QbLCPNQtQIlWS9cr_hw.review_text: Thoroughly satisfied with my trip here around dinner time tonight. I don't typically write reviews but was overwhelmed with the amazing speed and care from our server Benjamin. Even heard the table across from us commending him for his "immaculate" service. Great guy, bomb food. Definitely coming back!  And for what it's worth, my boyfriend needs me to note: "Ben's a boss."

y9ugLJW_WlmO7r80R66YRQ.review_text: I adore sparkys. I first went there to meet my 11th grade teacher for some late night grub(shhh). I LOVE their onion rings and chocolate and peanut butter shakes. I swear i lived off them while I was pregnant. I'm taking 1 star off for the mac and cheese. I always get it and am always bummed and because their service SUCKS! I've had one good server in the 5 or so years I've been going there. Other than that I'm a happy, full girl.

9CcPdDMQtkuLwhOIUIVBVw.review_text: Sparky's is down right AWESOME!!!  If you're craving, a burger with cheddar cheese and a side of curly fries, downing it with a thick and creamy chocolate shake at 1am, like I did the other night or should I say, morning; this is the place to feed your hunger.  Sparky's Diner on Church Street has been here forever (at least, 10yrs); and by the taste of it, they'll be around for another 10yrs.

NGMQ6UVcKx13YiRea9lqrA.review_text: We went here on Christmas evening out of desperation to find a place that was open. Unfortunately, I didn't take the time to read any reviews before we went. When we arrived, there were two or three other tables seated. There was only one server working, but this seemed easy enough to handle. The place started to fill up and the server, although friendly enough, began running around like a chicken with his head cut off. It wasn't all his fault- there were about 4 other people working (delivery guys, possibly?) who were sitting down at the cash register while he was taking care of about 12 tables by this time, not offering him any help whatsoever! We should've taken it as a cue to cut our losses when the table next to us, that was already there when we arrived still didn't have their food about 20 minutes after we'd ordered. Not to mention the table of two parents and a toddler on the other side of us, who sat down before us, but still had not even had their order taken at this point! So we finally received our food after about a 30 minute wait. I ordered a turkey burger and chili cheese fries and my fiancé ordered the heart-stopper burger (medium rare). He began setting down our plates and reciting back to us what they were- first, disco fries. Nope, I ordered chili cheese fries. His response..."Oh, you did order those. But the thing is, I put the order in as disco fries. But I can bring you a side of chili if you want. These have gravy and cheese on them" No thanks. Next on the table, veggie burger. Nope, I ordered a turkey burger. "Oh yes, a turkey burger. This is a turkey burger." (Bless his heart). The burger was horribly overcooked. I would have liked some mustard, but I actually felt bad asking him for anything else at this point, so I slathered it with ketchup and dipped it in the cheese/gravy mixture from the unwanted disco fries. Completely inedible. So I settled for just eating the fries, which were cold, but I was starving and it was the least disgusting thing on the table. Now onto my fiancé's burger, which was overcooked and chewy. Ew. Let's just say that his stomach is not feeling all that great, so we are holding out hope that he doesn't get a last minute gift of food poisoning. After we were finished, I knew it would be ages if I asked the server for the check, waited for him to bring it, gave him our credit card, and waited for him to run it. So as soon as I got his attention, I handed him our card, and since he didn't seem bothered by the fact that there was an almost completely uneaten turkey burger left on my plate, I told him it was inedible and asked him to take it off the bill, which he did. We signed the check and ran out of there as fast as possible. The poor couple with the toddler still had not received any food at this point, even though they'd asked him to bring the kid's pancake out as soon as possible. On the way out, we walked by the other employees chillin' at the register on their cell phones, with zero acknowledgment, or even a glance from any of them. Merry Christmas!

x-8MamivBk3ZXMPUca1fMw.review_text: Terrible terrible experience!  I came here with a group of 8. There was no one in the restaurant besides us, and yet, it took 20 minutes just to have a waiter get our drink order. Then it took 30 minutes, yes, 30 minutes just to get us our drinks- and most people just had water. I had a mimosa, which was basically orange juice with a splash of champagne! I'm pretty sure its suppose to be the other way around! Only a few of us ate, but no one seemed to like their food. Either way, almost an hour just to get drinks? You kidding me?

hcGgZ4PbKcM3K1clw7tEGA.review_text: A lawyer, a secretary and a vampire walk into a bar...  The lawyer says to the secretary, "How'd you get those bruises on your knees?"  The secretary points to the vampire.  The vampire shrugs, "Anything below her neck is on her."  **Sparky's puts up with some crazy shit in the second half of those 24 hours.**  And much props to the waiter who wasn't fazed when our party of six became fixated by him filling bottles with a bag of ketchup.

fhQR3XE9LLWePT7J2FnFnw.review_text: Food took 2 hours to get delivered using the eat24 app!!! Can't believe this could even happen!!!

W92JhDpo4uVyo08hsLKieg.review_text: I love this place. I have loved this place for many years. The food is always decent and the prices are good. It is a fun place.

2BG2vSIkOR3CPgAiT-Cf8g.review_text: Usually a solid bet. Stay away from the menu items that will probably not be very good at the hour you're dining. The salads have always worked well for me at wee hours.

W-vL2khTwnh2YMbbwOAB6g.review_text: Delivery blows. Asked for combo steak and eggs Benedict . Incompetent girl took forever to take the order, even put me on hold. Then called me 20 minutes later saying they don't know how to make that. U f'n kidding me you clown. Had to explain it prolonging my delivery.  And food sucked.  Horrible food and service

obNr-PYGTFaBFngNulGxBg.review_text: Ny steak sandwhich sucks ...it was like a little piece of beef jerkey on a big roll  not very appealing or appetizing..but sparkys is real hit or miss so chose wisely.

FVpmdLX54yddltwpr4PxQA.review_text: All I can tell you this restaurant is overcharging me 36.70 $ , overcharging me, no way.... you don't do that to the costumers.  when the guy arrived with the food 20 minutes late. we paid the right amount of money, no more nor less.... and I didn't complaint to the guy because he was 20 minutes late, with saggy food. !! BTW! My house is 10 minutes away! driving... can you believe the guy came back to my door to tell me it's not 36:70 but 37:70 dollars ?? what wait. if you want tips you don't deserve a penny.  this restaurant sucks. hey don't order food from here they're crazy. and the guy say fuck you when I closed my door... bad food and horrible people! !!!    ¡KARMA IS A BAD BITCH...!

dpbgW2GUpaE6nuC_7eDAxg.review_text: Upon walking into this place, I could swear that I had been here before when I was younger, but I wasn't too sure.  Let's just say this was my first time, since I couldn't remember the other time I had went.   I came here for breakfast/lunch one day and from what I can remember, we weren't greeted right away when we first walked in.  I found this to be a little strange because there was only one table in the restaurant.  Eventually we got greeted and seated.  I picked a table by the window.  Maybe not such a good choice, I would later find out.  In my efforts to be healthy, I ordered a breakfast plate that had scrambled egg substitute, two soy sausage patties, fruit and toast.  My friend got a burger.  I ordered a coffee, and he ordered a beer.   I remember the food taking a little while, which (once again) I found to be a little strange because we were the only customers in the restaurant for a good minute.  I needed a refill on my coffee but our server didn't check on us for a while.  There was only one guy working, but still, we were the only customers he had.  When our food was finally delivered, it was ok.  Nothing too spectacular.  It was my first time having soy sausage patties and I found them to be pretty good seeing as how I am a carnivore and I love meat. My friend wasn't too impressed with his burger but he ate it anyway.  I remember waiting a while to get our check and cash out.  Things just seemed to take a little too long at this place.  All in all this place was just a little "eh."  A-OK is definitely a suitable rating for Sparky's.  Sorry.

1U6dhYD2gdoB4SgrqXwexA.review_text: I was cautious after reading a bunch of bad reviews here, but given that there aren't a whole lot of 24/7 options in SF, I decided to try my luck here when I had to kill 5 hours between midnight and 5 a.m. before my flight home would leave in the morning. I was pleasantly surprised, service was nice throughout the whole 5 hours, kept refilling my coffee and the eggplant sandwich I had was decent too  (decent, mind you, not gourmet). What else do you want?  Only thing, the music was not exactly my taste, too loud, would have preferred something more chill, but ok...

5Bljk1tVq8RKSEUxsWBQ7Q.review_text: If I could give it 0 stars I would.  Being open 24 hours is not good enough to earn one star because there's a 24Hr Safeway across the street where you can get infinitely better food.  I've eaten at Sparkys many times over the years just because it's about the only place around at 3-4am, but tonight was the last time. I'm done being a Sparkys' apologist. The food is not just mediocre, it's horrible and indefensible. Every other late-night diner in the City is worlds better, and when those other diners are Mel's and Lori's that's saying a lot, because those places aren't so hot. Even Denny's is far far superior to Sparkys, because it's a large corporation and there are standards to maintain. Sparkys has no such standards, and it shows.  If you're hungry at 4am and have the ability to reach the intersection of Church and Market, just go to Safeway and buy anything at all, at random. Whatever you choose will be better than what Sparkys serves.

ANJ-jY5M8k-FKd7kr7x93w.review_text: Late night, decent, diner food.  Typical late night, eclectic, gay-straight crowd.  It's a change of scene from Bagdad Cafe and such.  I only come here when I'm craving food after having a couple drinks and don't want to wait to eat until I get home.

gMwwQif7RMqBdPUrmbaqyQ.review_text: Three stars seems about right. At 2 am the food is good enough to help soak up the booze after a night 'o fun and there is great people watching. Last time we were there, saw a guy pass out on his feet and faceplant into the floor. The busboys carried him to the curb and we had a show as his friends tried to get a cab. Apparently this happens alot there.

dniyMgz75aFbp0uREyB6jw.review_text: There are good things & there are bad things here. The staff are hit or miss but I love their apple pie milkshake & it's a must have if you go here.   I've been to sparky's twice now.  The first time my boyfriend and I went (around 8pm)we had a really great experience & delicious food. Cheese fries, Apple Pie milkshake, I had the chicken parmesan  & he had fettuccine carbonara. The waitress was nice but not intrusive which was great for us. All the staff was having a good time it seemed & the other patrons were happy as well. We both left full & happy!    The second time we both went again (this time earlier, around 6pm) not as great as the first time. The waitress seemed like she didnt really want to be there/wanted to be doing other things besides waiting on people. We both had the fetticini alfredo with prawns which was really creamy (which we both loved, hate that thin sauce other places use) the prawns were alright though mine were overcooked & tasted a little too fishy for my liking. The music sucked this time (staff chooses music I guess? but it wasnt fun stuff like the first time we went) We had to ask our waitress to do things that should just be done in the first place I thought like bringing ketchup for fries. Maybe I'm being too picky with it? I dunno, I really want to be nice to the staff because waitressing can be crappy sometimes but it just wasnt a great experience when the waitress seemed to not want to be there.    Next time we might try to go later again to see if that's the issue. If we have a waitress that's blah again we'll just hit them up for milkshakes on the go :)

olEYaQziRperfA9b5HhOuA.review_text: this is a delivery specific review.   Don't bother, a recent order was scheduled for 75 minute delivery, ended up at 90 minutes, in either case, the food (that's barely edible fried junk on a good day) was stone cold.    Not even worth a call back to complain, I should have known better from the moment I heard they offered delivery.  I'll never order from them again.

QLgU6EDbQITAZdploxj0tg.review_text: Ok. let me start by saying I grew up here and have always been fond of this place.  So a few years ago, an old co-worker of mine was beat up by two Sparkys employees outside of the restaraunt for knocking over a pitcher of water and being too loud (I feel like I should also note that the victim was a female and the employees male). I avoided this place for a while on principle.  But last week in the middle of the night I got hungry and ordered delivery from them. They over-charged me for something I didn't order. It took me a week to finally get in touch with someone who could help me, and they gave me store credit instead of money back (the amount of which was actually less than what I was overcharged). SInce I had store credit I decided to order from them again, and got a cold burger with the bun ripped in half.  Disappointment :(

ula2xOcTOs1j0xmLobKyvw.review_text: Went in at 6pm Sunday, with a party 5, a toddler, a senior, a blind guy and a very pregnant momma.  They were unwilling to seat us, in a table that would work for our group even though there were only 2 occupied tables in the entire place....I am reminded why I haven't been inside for years we ended up going to another restaurant....

8O6-LTfWGsyDBSXpMSFdgA.review_text: I thought this place was awesome! never thought a bacon milkshake would be good but I was up for trying new things and hey it hit the spot! I called in to order while with a group of friends  roaming the city and this girl Gisselle on the phone was super sweet! She was very helpful in recommending food choices for my friends and while I'm assuming we sounded a tad obnoxious she was patient and laughed along with us. Good late night snacking and an awesome employee. kudos.

tUKpixy4c24_2W0PngxooA.review_text: There is a great comfort in knowing there is a place willing to deliver food at 4am, that is not a sweaty soggy pizza from Mr Pizza Man.  I have ordered from Sparky's before to get breakfast delivered to me to cure my hangover. The eggs benedict was good, hashbrowns ok, and the side of bacon came in this little bag full of several slices of bacon. No skimming on the bacon, thank you!  With these kinds of places, I try to pick the menu item least likely to be botched. After last night's jaiger/redbull sprint, at 3am I decided to order the garlic fries, side of bacon (because why not), and wings.  I was very surprised that the fries were actually crispy, they used real minced garlic to season, and they were still hot. No weird sogginess. The wings were pretty good, and the ranch was ok - a touch watery but manageable.   I don't know if this was a fluke, and I'm almost too afraid to order again, but I know I have to try it again, because any place that can serve ok food at 4am or bring you breakfast at 1pm is a keeper.   There was absolutely nothing that disappointed me last night, I got exactly what I expected, but even a touch better - because the fries weren't soggy.  So for purely scientific reasons, I will try this again.

khx_6jheK6vXPQOUmUWAMA.review_text: They have the best biscuits and gravy. Only 3.75. Great after a long night! I will definitely be coming back here!

KPOU2LBJqKtqOyT3pX_TAQ.review_text: Im guilty of eating here twice. The first time I had chilli cheese fries, the second time, a cheeseburger. Both were ok. I can't say I look forward to coming here again. Its nice that they are open 24 hours though.

PO35eUKYCf1kAoVctJ4H1g.review_text: 24 Hour diner ? Dang! I live for late night eats. Especially after a little bit of too much fun with your choice of poison. ....That being said, I can only review on what I REMEMBER. Anyways- I picked up my darling from a late shift from work and headed to this place cause I knew he was super hungry. Surprisingly he was able to guide me here while being smack faced drunk. Regardless, we found our way perfectly fine thanks to his city savvyness. Parking wasn't as bad as I thought- but that just might have been luck. There wasn't any wait either- so that was probably luck too! We were seated right away, in a nice kinda dim neon lit place. I loved the ambiance. Call me sleazy but I  feel relaxed in neon lights, sitting next to a juke box. Not to mention that they also played some awesome music- (I heard a lot of old school Q-Tip and ATCQ). I wasn't too starving, but my dude was. He got some kind of spicy sandwich and was loving it. I ordered the chicken caesar salad and thought it was pretty good for a diner- a lil too generous with the dressing but no complaints here cause they gave me a fat piece of grilled chicken to go along with! Definitely coming back here if I'm in the city in the wee hours of the morning all poisoned out. Yeee!

vFzcphGFydg26hJ4UJ3CEQ.review_text: Worst customer service ever!!!  I ordered a sandwich and 2 milkshakes for delivery. I normally LOVE their shakes. Tonight they had nasty white chunks (maybe curdled milk?)   I called to tell them and he said he would send 2 new shakes and it would take 20-25 mins.   An hour later I didn't hear from them.  I called and they put me on hold for 10 minutes and then someone hung up on me.  Then I called and tried to explain the situation and they hung up again. Then I talked to a different lady and she seemed sweet but put me on hold for another 10 minutes. I called for the last time and they said my driver should have delivered my shakes a long time ago.   I officially give up.... I will be shocked if I ever get those shakes.   Even if I do get those shakes I probably shouldn't drink them..... Apparently I really pissed them off.

4uK5t5phlNMMTWLXqAJdLg.review_text: The bread on my sandwich was moldy. Really, guys?  Chefs, inspect your ingredients!  Servers, check your plates before you send them out!  Service was extremely slow. I understand that it is a 24hrs joint, and it was in the middle of the morning. However, as a server myself, I believed it could have been run more effectively.  The food itself was standard diner fare, but, I think sending out spoiled food is unacceptable. How do you miss that?

pPCZ0tEVQUrYFn5MhezmIw.review_text: Don't go here. The food is disgusting and takes forever. The service is rude and very slow.   I ordered blueberry pancakes thinking that was a pretty safe vegetarian option. The blueberries were STILL FROZEN in the pancakes and super gritty. This was all aside from the fact that my pancakes had a very distinct flavor of bacon to them. Maybe some people are into bacon flavored pancakes but as a veggie...this was a major downside for me.   Try Crepevine or Bagdad cafe instead if you want edible food and a decent atmosphere

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: how has sparky's 24 flown under the radar for this long? my #1 qualm with SF is it's lack of 24hr diners! alas, perhaps it's not you SF, it's me (and my inability to find 24hr diners).  food, service, ambiance are all worth just what you pay for... $12.00 ha! but you can pay for it at 3:00am!

aLr5Zq8XXVWZgJWYmD-rXQ.review_text: We had been ordering delivery  from Sparky's for a couple of years and until recently, the customer service was friendly, courteous, pleasant and prompt.  I don't know if there is new management in place, but the service is really awful!  The phone service is rude and obnoxious.  I received a wrong order pizza and when I called, the female order taker responded, "Didn't I repeat the order twice to you?"  -- NO.  The manager, "Robert" was just as rude and obnoxious.  Do NOT bother with this place!!

tNsid135DeTOBdJgK29giQ.review_text: i remember back in the day this place was amazing...great diner food.  About a year ago...i ate there and ordered the hamburger.  Was totally grossed out...vowed to never eat there again....  cut to a week or so ago...i was hungry..it was there...i thought to myself..."Gee..why havent I eaten here for so long, this place used to be so awesome."  I took one bite into my burger and the memories flooded back into my mind like piecing together the events after someone slips you a roofie...  I am not sure why they call it a hamburger...its spiced with something not of this world.  I havent seen a lot of stray cats around church street and this may very well be the reason why...  I would love to rewind the scenario like a vhs tape...me ordering the burger....zubzuzuzzbub (sound effects of what it sounds like to rewind a vhs tape..say it outloud!)...the waiter walks backwards the kitchen...zubzubzzububu...the days events start.....zubzuuzuzuzb..the prep cook is making hamburger patties....zubzzubzuzub the delivery man delivers the meat....zubbzub.....STOP THE TAPE.!!!!!!...what is the meat....where did it come from?  Is it feline?  bovine?  swine?  Canine? Extraterrestrial-ine?  Anway...i am too afraid to order anything else off the menu...if they fuck up a burger, i wouldn't imagine they would do anything right...

98jzgVIShOvB2ngHwiNbPA.review_text: The only good thing I can say is the table didn't have crumbs on it when we sat down.  Oh, and when our server came around, keyword being WHEN, she was speaking in complete sentences.  Sparkys, nobody was there on a Saturday night at 11PM, yet you still managed to serve the coldest food ever.  My friend's poor eggs benedict hard hardened yolks.   When I order a burger mid rare, this does not mean solidly red throughout (though that would explain the temperature of the dish).  The cheese had re-congealed for gawd sakes!  And cold curly fries - unacceptable.  Refilling our waters once after being asked to do so was cool.  And maybe had you made it around to ask how our food was before our plates were empty, you would have noticed that we needed things.  Alas, that didn't happen.  Orphan Andys, you are definitely worth the walk.

CHhy_Tw78SUtMDMQZJxygg.review_text: A friend brought me here for a late-night burger on a Thursday.  We split a bacon cheeseburger and an order of curly fries, and I had a lemonade.  Service was so-so; we never got offered refills on our drinks, not even water.  But the food was nice enough.  At the end of the meal, the waiter brought our tab, which I paid with my check card.  I was a little stunned to sign off on a $24 bill for just a burger and fries, but I quietly paid up.  When I sat down to do my finances for the past couple of weeks, I sorted all my receipts out and noticed I had two from Sparky's - the itemized one, and the one I'd signed.  Lo and behold, they were different.  The original bill?  $17.  Looking closer, the table numbers didn't match up.  They ran my card for the wrong tab!  I wrote the restaurant and enclosed a photocopy of the two receipts.  A week later, I got a check for the $6 and change difference.  OK, fine.  A classy joint might have refunded the whole tab or sent along a gift certificate to make up for their error and entice me back, but whatever.  My problem was with the scolding letter that accompanied the check.  After a brief apology, the sender wrote "Mistakes happen and [the waiter] was probably very busy, so please always check your bill."  The place wasn't particularly busy - lots of open tables.  Others have complained about slow service, and I certainly didn't see our waiter putting on much hustle.  I have had tabs at all kinds of bars and restaurants that were far busier than Sparky's, and have never had my card charged for the wrong tab.  And when the card is in the little pleather folder with the tab it's supposed to be run for?  There is NO excuse, NONE.  The subtle blaming of "you should always check your bill" plus the excuse-making is totally inappropriate for a business communication.  You screw up?  You fix it and apologize, period.  I won't be going back to Sparky's, because I don't want to have to worry that some inattentive wait staff is going to overcharge my card, get my order wrong, forget to bring my card back at all, who knows what?  If the attitude the management takes is "mistakes happen," they can forget about my business.

Icpf2k5JDH7wTlEZcybcEg.review_text: Standard diner fare, but 4 stars because SF has few 24 hour establishments (I mean, seriously? Mel's? Ugh!). Love going here on Saturday nights, preferably around 3 am!

Zhs0hBatjm8rG7TbvD6Hew.review_text: People, this is a 24 hour greasy spoon in the castro. It is everything it's supposed to be. They provide food for the drunken puking people roaming the streets at 2am after leaving all the bars.  I have read on here that people are accusing Sparky's of food poison... No, that was probably yr hang over the next morning, and after spending a night drinking in the Castro and watching people get sick on the sidewalk on the walk home... it proves my point.   The Service, yeah it's a bit on the slow side, but eh, who cares.  I had Mac and Cheese, grilled cheese and tomato, and fries.  My girlfriend had a tuna melt, everything tasted fine and we went about our evening.  The bathrooms, yes small, filled with graffiti and not the cleanest... BUT AGAIN it's a 24 hour greasy soon in the castro. WHAT DO YOU EXPECT? Drunken people peeing and  doing whatever else in there at all hours of the night...   my point. Stop being so snotty and just enjoy that you have an option of a 24 hour eatery for yr drunk asses lol.

K0zrsXqu55JPwT4dnvNUDg.review_text: Sorry, but for chili cheese fries and a california omelette, it was just not that good.  I think I should go in there and teach em how to make a decent omelette.  Understandably, its 1:30 am and all the drunkees are out there to eat all the greasy foods they can get but not know what they put in their mouth.  I, dear sir, am no ordinary drunkee.  I still taste, criticize, and analyze what is there to eat even in a drunken state.  Some might even say I'm more harsh when so, but so be it.  If i can't come to a place drunk, I may never even come here sober.

0WAudDj_HpMtJKngK1aTPA.review_text: I ordered delivery from here and the guy went to the wrong address despite my leaving detailed instructions on how to get to my place. He didn't speak a word of English so his repeated phone calls were fruitless. Sorry, you need to hire delivery people who can at least understand, "Where are you?" and similar rudimentary English otherwise what the hell is the point.

58ZGUbmRpf8_lEHdE47upQ.review_text: My disdain for mediocre diners died here when a very enthusiastic man (who wanted to impress me with his knowledge of late night city food) introduced me to Sparky's after a night of dancing and drinking.  Hesitant that I would indeed hate myself for eating so late (or early) in the day I ordered the milk shake while my gentlemen ordered his usual loaded nachos.  It's hard to mess up a milkshake, but DAMN the Carmel Kiss smacked me hard on the lips and left a lasting impression of love.  From there I have such discovered gems as the garlic fries (to diiiiie for) and the wings that, still to my hestiation, I have found to satisfy the after gaming  urge to binge....and actually doesn't leave myself filled with too much self hatred.   But it's not just the food.  The entire experience of Sparky's is the late night company that hangs out  and the faces you tend to recognize if you go on the same night of the week.  The staff is friendly, and while yes, it DOES depend on who is cooking---the food will fill you up and leave a smile on your face to cap off the exhaustion from partying it up in San Francisco.

HshIhF76Uea0-2ht_KUisw.review_text: 24 hours, huh?  It's 3:35am.  I call Sparky's.  They answer on the first ring:  "Sparky's, can I ask you to hold?" "Sure!"  14 minutes and 55 seconds later...  Doesn't seem like they're coming back.  I call back and wait for several rings until someone answers.  I ask politely to place an order for delivery, which their website states they offer.  Rude gentleman from Sparky's responds:  "We stop delivering at 3:50am."  It's 3:52am.  I kindly mention that I originally called at 3:35 and they put me on hold for almost 15 minutes.  Surly gentleman tells me I should have called back sooner.

mNfnPm15d9cDCJJoBWtpUQ.review_text: Went here on a recommendation from a bartender at Rickhouse.  Food took FOREVER to come, and it wasn't very busy but there was a ton of staff there which just shows they don't give a rip about attentiveness.  Waitress was not very helpful.  When food did come it came out one at a time (we had 4 in our party), and mine was first and it was cold (omlette and potatoes)..    Don't waste your time going there, read the other reviews of people who have had the same experience.  As for the people who think this place is great, they must be recently homelss or something, not sure how one could think so highly of this joint, unless their level of expecation is far lower than what a regular person thinks is reasonable.

iIwZQxwAwM4HCMbdzghi5w.review_text: When I first walked into Sparky's, I turned to my friend and remarked how I felt like I was going to get stabbed by the person in the next booth. However, that was part of the charm. Considering it was 11 at night on a week day, it was nice that a place with such a wide selection was open.  We were seated by a guy who was nice and chatty, the way I like my waiters. After about ten minutes of talking, I indulged myself in a cornucopia of drunk food, getting a three stack of buttermilk pancakes, french fries, and a soda. The beer and wine selection was small but respectable, from which I had the merlot.   The food came right at that time where you are about to get impatient, but then it comes so you're satisfied. The sizes were great and the food was delicious. In the interest of full disclosure, my friend's greek salad had a hair in it. However, I did not dock Sparky's because it was not my meal. Merely don't order the salad and you won't get hairs. My flawless logic at work again.  The once-daunting atmosphere turned into an interesting collection of drunken drag queens, unhappy couples, and tourists out late. At one point my friend made a joke at which point this boisterous flamboyantly gay guy at the next table started laughing hysterically. All in all, these are my kind of people for a late night drunk run.  The meal ended up costing my about $20 with tip and some of the selections were pricey enough to dissuade me from purchase (the $5 grilled cheese line was crossed, if I remember correctly). Still, if you know what you are getting into, Sparky's is a perfect throwback to those late night college diners with interesting characters and tasty food.

1m4Hmm7IbgGjVupM7CQSMw.review_text: Sparky's was always an awesome standby for college kids living near Dolores Park who wanted to skip pizza and burritos and get something else. I LOVE that you'd bring me a chocolate shake and an open faced turkey sandwhich right to my door so I could continue to read about the empty chair technique.  Dining in is rather like any diner experience. It's a little messy and a little crazy, but when you gotta get your grease on, you are among the top choices.  Came here again recently after a concert with a bunch of friends. The place was packed and there were dishes everywhere, water spilled and music playing. You were obviously short staffed and totally overwhelmed with drunk people (us included) at 1am. The thing was, our cute waiter was AWESOME and got us the food we needed promptly and even allowed us to have bacon in our mac and cheese. For mozzarella sticks, shakes, and delicious sober-up foods, I highly recommend you.  Oh and thanks for enjoying it while we danced around the tables to your donna summer jukebox. We loved when my friend left his card there and came back the next day that you remember us calling us "the best table ever." You have our hearts.

gWK5S6W83uHB0_xIPeaWfg.review_text: We have been sitting here for 30 minutes and there are only three tables. No food. No appetizer. I only got an iced tea. It's Monday night! Totally unacceptable. Come here if you want to wait and starve.

jlyLOhoykL-qKkl5ltbKZA.review_text: Good food. But not 24 hours as they advertise. Only at the diner do they post their real hours...they're not even open in the morning on the weekdays.  Pretty lame diner.

E0EKSw5jsY_fde_W9Lbf1g.user_location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

MhVvtOGpFbJ1w-fIWB7z7w.review_text: Oh, Sparky's let me count the ways . . . breakfast for two Lunch for a few brunch for a bunch after hours face cramming ahhhhh! Sparky's 24 Hour diner has served me well in true diner fashion, never blowing me away with beautiful gourmet just gettin' me belly full when needed. The lighting isn't very bright even in the middle of the day and at night it seems to lend it's self to dark room activities (and I don't mean developing film). To be clear I've never seen illicit things go down, it's just that dimly lit. Sometimes you get a good server, sometimes you don't, it's not really the reason to come here. I wish i could pull one of my visits here out of the dozens as an example but the brain, the little gray cells they don't work too good sometimes n' shit.  Oh, and it's close to the MUNI, K,L, M or the J Church

YOvHgywXbL35kw-yHGQgPQ.review_text: Mediocre food Horrible service Ghetto bathrooms  Pie here is not as fresh as they claim. And the side of spaghetti is bland. Prices are too high for food that's not that great. Won't be coming here again unless I'm drunk & everywhere else is closed. LOL

DYyD1OUCZj3Lo4zW-coeZg.review_text: I'm was tempted to avoid this place after reading all the reviews but I'm glad I didn't.   Sparkys delivers everything from breakfast to shakes to steaks and it was all good. It wasn't "OMG the best ever' but it was better than most of the delivery I've had and the deliveryman was polite and very fast (50 mins to SOMA on a Saturday).   A very good experience overall.

xXZfQ5aUMNbXCWJpZnH0YA.review_text: It was the first few wee hours of the morning on January 1st, 2008 and my friend and I were STARVING after having lived off of champagne for the past 12 hours.  We went to Sparky's and had the worst service I have ever witnessed.  Granted, these poor servers had to work on New Year's Eve but we literally waiting an hour and a half for our food.  The people next to us were served waaay before us and they got there fifteen minutes after us.   While I was in line for the bathroom, I peeked into the kitchen and saw our server chugging from a bottle of tequila.  I would normally have gotten a kick out of all of this but I was beyond hungry and very very cranky.  I can't even remember what I got, it was probably so-so.  On a positive note: I'm sure it's much better on a less stressful night.

0HaHgC8F9pzTNOeKWD-qeA.review_text: It was 3 am, we had been driving all day and were looking for a place to find some tasty treats. After hours places nearby were jam packed, every taqueria had lines out the door. This place was packed too but with only two people we were seated right away. Ordered curly fries, vegan sandwhich and mashed potatos to share. Service was pretty mediocre. Forgot my mashed potatos. Figured oh well i probably wouldnt have finished them anyway so i let it slide. Sandwhich is pretty good, tastes like a salad inbetween two pieces of bread. When we left to pay the waiter noticed we never got our mashed potatos so he took the fries off the bill and only charged us for the sandwhich. yay.

tSUQVGXYtxA_7NCA6uUgrw.review_text: If I were to describe Sparky's in 2 words I'd say: decent and convenient. Decent because the food was definitely nothing out of the ordinary. They also sadly served my mac & cheese with some real stale crackers. But convenient because they're open 24 hours.  I had to dock off a couple stars because some items on the menu were overpriced (my tiny cup of side order mac & cheese was $3 when it should have been way lesser than that) and not to mention their mummy with the staring problem chillen in the back room gave me the heebie geebiez.

37_9qGJ-8x4ZGiYGD5u8ig.review_text: Alright, as an employee I was going to hold off on writing a review, until I read someone else's review calling Barbara a "classless troll" and I HAD to defend her. Barbara had worked at Sparky's since the early 80's, and she is in no way classless, nor a troll. She is no longer employed with us,  and is still the backbone of Sparky's. She is AWESOME, and you have no idea what you're talking about.  Anyways. We're doing lots of remodeling, and it's looking nice. You should check it out, just be careful on the new wood floor, it's not drunk friendly. We're expanding our menu to include pizza and pasta soon. Come by before 3pm and I'll personally make you the best damn milkshake ever.

C9ijJDnBaaWNQD5tLcNBFQ.review_text: Last weekend, after viewing one of the SF Jewish Film Festival titles, we were very hungry for some good eats, and I suggested to my movie companion that we go and snag dinner at Sparky's. This was one of the 24hr establishments that I had yet to try; I believe this was also true for my friend. I feel horrible that I don't remember what my friend ordered, but I know we both had mimosas--seriously refreshing and yummy, on both accounts! I did also have a pesto pasta dish with scallops--the scallops were a bit on the small side, but held a mild flavor. Great attentive service, that wasn't overly obtrusive. I so want to try more yummy bites, even desserts, at this Castro neighborhood mainstay.

s0hoioBLwQVdd1tlcdlPbg.review_text: Sparkys - Where the mice play. And should've cooked instead.

6TBYRdA26VgitScNHRZCyA.review_text: 24 hours....that's how this place stays in business.  They offer all of you drunk late nighters an opportunity to eat.  Diner food...which I find disgusting in general.    I had the bacon cheese burger... Hey, if I am gonna go to a place like this, may as well go all out.  The patty was WEAK!  Not enough meat.  Otherwise this was what it was...a drunken experience I will never forget!  Loved that dummy sitting in the front.........elbow tap!

suuIf6JWTZFjSu55k7zTBA.review_text: I've only been here late at night ~ good place to fuel up before hitting the sack.  Fried egg sandwich is like home made, nothing special.  Watch out for the Fiery Chicken sandwich.  I love spicy, but this one was 5-alarm caliber, I recall smoke coming out of my ears having a bite of this one!  PS:  Beware of the lil' step on the way out the door.  I totally ate it.

jHHTMfunSBNIPSzqgSEFHA.review_text: Sparky's has been a mainstay for me ever since I was a teenager coming back from raves needing early morning replenishment. Now as a 30-something, the late night deliveries when I'm too lazy to walk to the burrito joint, are where it's at. The food has always been decent. I ain't mad atcha, Sparky's! Keep on keepin' on.

VmlShd8k2tq7-O4TVx5R1Q.review_text: FABULOUS! This is one of the best  "after the bar closes where do we go now?" places. i prefer sparky's over mel's, ihop and denny's! It is basic diner food open 24 hours. They have a great cheap lunch menu with tons of great comfort food. Mac n cheese, spicy chicken sandwiches and chili are some of my favorites.   Friendly laidback staff. It's an experience going in after 2am.   Hey, they even have free condoms in the bathroom!

3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w.review_text: I am bumping up their rating from my original 4-star rating because I realize now that when you are STARVING at 4am in the morning, and NOTHING is open, the fact that a place like SPARKY's is serving great diner food, in a sit-down establishment, at REASONABLE prices and actually HAS Onion Rings!  Well......they will get my 5-Star 4am in the morning rating.

tguqrRnNTqqsJQtBsbGHAw.review_text: hamburger  with a stale roll, ruben but they have no sauerkraut!!   portions were tiny for the price !!   wait service  was good  but it took a long time to get the food and the place was empty !!   The food was  barely passable !!   never again !!

qPGhjScyxtuHrWXN4A8VXg.review_text: Hello. My name is Loli and I'm a cheater.  I'm in a committed relationship with a few area diners. Sparky's is my diner-on-the-side. When it's late and I'm experiencing a wait that I can no longer deal with elsewhere, and am quite unsure as to what exactly I want to eat, I know that Sparky's will be there with open doors, ready to accept me no matter what. Burgers, breakfast, pizza, and other diner-food at reasonable prices.   Sadly, I feel like I'm short-changing you Sparky's, but if it makes you feel better, allow me to apologize. I'm sorry, Sparky's, it's not you, it's me...... I'll see you later, though.

hmavGmZmigwyii6PnPEA4A.review_text: This is when you go to Sparky's: when it is late at night, you have been drinking, and are in the general vicinity of the Castro.  Follow this formula and the grumpy hipster servers, "cheesy fries [that] come in a bowl for some reason" (seriously, Unnamed Yelper?), and the general mediocrity of the food will be totally irrelevant.   Why? It's food. At 3 AM. Specifically diner food, which is traditionally served mediocre with a side of grease by a person not thrilled to be taking orders from drunk people in the middle of the night.  Fair enough, in my opinion. Just eat your hangover-preventing french fries and take advantage of the fact that alcohol makes annoyances tolerable, if not funny. If you can't do that, you're probably a mean drunk and shouldn't be out in public anyway.   If you must go to Sparky's without following the late + drunk + in-general-proximity rule, order a milkshake. They are really yummy, come in a ton of flavors, and the food coma that follows will erase all memories of cranky waitstaff.

_P_7oqfBAoaS-vn32iQnGQ.review_text: Great place to eat, very popular place, great location.  however this past Saturday morning, during the last call hours, service was a little slow. Over 50 minutes waiting on Our Order, and when the food arrived presentation was okay however my hamburger wasn't cooked all the way.  totaly Nasty.  I like this restaurant. ... I think they're cool!  I'm going to give them the benefit of a doubt and just say that maybe this was just 1 bad night.  We shall see ..  3 Stars!

kR3qRNdv6LkOAux5Zsxv8w.review_text: Just hangin' out, waiting for the delivery of my food a good 1.5 hours after I ordered it. To be shuttled from Church St. to the middle of SOMA. Why didn't you just take MUNI?   It's okay - maybe you guys were tired. Rain makes me like that, too. Sometimes when people pay me to do something, I just take their cash and watch the drizzle go by. I think about the other times I've gone to Sparky's - the bad fries, the lazy staff, the largely unappealing greaseboats at 2 AM.   They say that a culture is measured by its institutions - but if Sparky's is one of SF's, then I gladly welcome the mallification of this city. This place doesn't need a fresh coat of paint - it needs a wrecking ball.

N6PyaaAJbkAIAKT0BiZG1g.review_text: Worst. Waffles. Ever.  I would maybe give this place 1.5 stars if I could, but since I couldn't...downgrade!  I had high hopes for Sparky's ability to satisfy my Sunday night waffle craving. I searched high and low on the internet for a place that serves Belgium waffles at 8:30pm and Sparky's was the only place I came across. My previous experiences with Sparky's had been decent, but I had only ordered breakfast once there (about 4 years ago) and the rest of my meals had been hamburgers.  The place had probably 10 other patrons besides myself, my boyfriend, my brother, and our friend, Nika. We seated ourselves and were brought menu's quickly (but that's where the promptness ended). The menu had a full selection - pizza, breakfast, burgers, sandwiches, salads, milkshakes. My favorite item on the menu, name-wise, has to be the Paris Hilton pizza - clams, shrimp, and garlic. Gross. The Elton John is another good one - a pizza with all different types of meat, haha (1 star)!  The server took 10-15 minutes to come around to take our orders (even though all the other tables had been handled). My boyfriend ordered a pizza, I got my Belgium waffle (no whip cream, but berries and powdered sugar, please) and a side of eggs and bacon, my brother had a chicken Ceaser salad, and Nika had some type of omelette.   The food took FOREVER to arrive. I'm talking 15 or 20 minutes when the place is empty. Once it arrived, I was definitely disappointed. First off, it had no whipped cream, but it didn't have the berries and powdered sugar on it like the menu stated. Second, it was super thin and burnt! Now, I've never been to Belgium, but I know what a Belgium waffle is supposed to look like - BIG, thick, and NOT BURNT. The eggs were ok, but the bacon was awful. It tasted like it had been cooked in the wrong substance. The bacon tasted sour and left a horrible taste in my mouth. The whole meal was a huge disappointment and the service sucked! Everyone else fared a little better - it was "decent" (word used by all three people). Nothing to write home about, but curbed the hunger just fine. The only thing that was really good was my boyfriend's espresso/mint shake (.5 star).  As you can imagine, it took our server another 10-15 minutes to bring us our bill, even after clearing plates away. I was so upset by the waffle fiasco, I forced everyone to go with me to Mel's right after our meals so I could order a waffle to get the taste of Sparky's out of my mouth. Now Mel's doesn't do a fantastic job on just about anything, but their waffles were at least plump, not burnt, and had fruit on them. Oh, and Mel's has crayons, but that's for another review...  The point of the story is I will not go back to Sparky's except under extreme circumstances of life or death hunger and I will stick what they can do decently.

waT2erAel5Kkq1uFh4h2vg.review_text: I placed an order through GrubHub from Sparky's Diner for delivery. The order arrived completely wrong and the delivery guy told me, "You have to call my boss. I don't take orders" and then walked away. I had to call GrubHub to report the issue and have my order redone.  Sparky's manager called me to apologize and to tell me the delivery guy was at my door to pick up the incorrect order. I guess he couldn't ring the doorbell himself. When I answered the door, he wouldn't look at me and muttered, "Sorry about that" as he took the order and walked away. The manager told me the correct order would be here in 20 minutes. Actually, it took 1 hour.  They will never get my business again.

f7LZMIrLhmEj2oXdYDB-wg.review_text: A milk shake that tastes like an apple pie is like a gift from baby Jesus- it would be a sin to return it. Next time I'm going to try  the one with "Elvis" in it's name. Because if it's good enough for the King (or named after him) how bad could it be? And the Spicy Cajun chicken sandwich was pretty good.  Stop by the bathroom- really. The reading material is on the wall, and constantly changing...

920SZSvECa2tmGW8W5byyg.review_text: OMG thank the lord for Sparky's, and feeding our drunk asses at 3 am.  MMM I had the most delicious Tuna Melt EVER! with french fries,   heinz+tabasco= YUM.  I am soooo coming back here to get a chocolate milkshake.  All my homies loved what they ordered. Parking was easy. I loved the total diner atmosphere. The Juke Box was a plus! The waiter was sooooo patient with us! Kudos to the dude in the red sweater skinny black pants and long hair.  Yay for Sparky's! Eat Here!

IMOOyjf3UbcExgm_hyCCpg.review_text: This place is a scam!! i order 2 burgers and french fries and they only delivered me the burgers and no french fries. They charged me for the fries. When i called, i told them i am missing the fries and never called me back. I ordered my meat Medium RAre and it was well done and dry. Don't waste your $$$ at this place

0VAQlfAitQjpM-qyb0vYvg.review_text: The food is good, but my relationship with Sparky's is coming to an end (or perhaps a long, long hiatus) because I just can't with the delivery service.   I fully understand that their busiest time is during the late hours of the weekend -- I do! This is why I always assume it will take longer than the 45-60 minute delivery timeframe. Earlier this summer, I called to follow up after about an hour and 45 minutes passed. The woman who answered the phone (the same person who had taken my order) seemed very confused and put me on hold. When she came back, she offered "Oh...uh...yes. the driver, his car broke down...but he'll be right there." That's fine. Notice would have been nice, or I could have walked to Church and 18th in less time than this, but I know they're busy. The food appeared 30 minutes later (...two hours after the initial order), miraculously still hot. Things happen, though, and it was the weekend -- so I wasn't really annoyed.   Some time after that, I called and placed an order and the person seemed a-ok! An hour and a half went by; I gave it a few more minutes then called (given my past experiences) just to make sure that everthing was okay. The person who answered the phone said she would have to get back to me. She called back a half hour later and, to make a long story short, they totally lost the order. As two hours had passed by that point, I just said to forget it, but my card had been charged (I knew this from looking; she had no record of anything). She couldn't find the transaction, so I gave my card # to her so that she could void it. As an apology, she offered $5 off my next order; she told me it was already noted with my phone number so whoever took the call the next time would know to deduct it.  In a recent (weak) moment of hunger, I thought, '''Perhaps I have misjudged Sparky's!" -- I placed an order and mentioned the $5 off. I explained that this was offered because they lost my order the last time, it should be under my phone number, etc. Even though I was by no means insistent (...it's $5), the person accused me of trying to scam them ("How do I know you're not making this up?") and told me that they never do this, she had no idea what I was talking about, and that I'd have to speak with the person who made the offer. While I did actually remember the person's name, she didn't work until the following week, so it was a moot point. She grudgingly offered a "piece of cake, on me" which I think I declined (it was included, anyway, which was nice). I didn't really care about the $5 -- it's $5! -- it's just the point.   After this last experience -- not to mention all the previous ones -- I just don't think it's worth the hassle. 1 star for service, 3 for food = 2 stars.   The Apple Pie milkshake = amazing, though, I will say.

lm0pGKm-HJEegS17bJRoAg.review_text: Standard late night diner food. Nothing too special, other than the coffee is pretty good (and I'm a coffee snob)... or perhaps it was the late hour and the need for caffeine to keep me up.  Anyway, I had their awesome breakfast food, which is pretty good (and decently priced). The portion sizes are pretty huge, but I found the food to be a bit too oily for my taste. They advertise they are the "healthy" choice, but, all in all, a bit oily.   My original rating is 3*, but i'll give it a +1* for accepting credit cards and being open 24 hours! We need more places like this!

OyzlE56JLfzCnbcsgChxuw.review_text: Service was way too slow and my chili cheese fries were disgusting. I mean, I even enjoy the chili from Wienerschnitzel so I'm no fancy girl or anything. The chili cheese fries here were just inedible.

2nn7CyYHUPbK-Op8bO3iDA.review_text: This is the only restaurant where I have cancelled an order after waiting unsuccessfully for over 45 minutes for my order to show up, and walked away hungry. To make matters worse, the server didn't seem too interested in checking in on the order status or updating the group on how much longer our order would take. Seriously, how long does it take for a diner to put together an order of blueberry pancakes, fries, a bagel, and a burger?

6-jjR5S2iZ9L1nrs6EbFHg.review_text: i used to come here all the damn time... then one day i ended up working there.  I love the staff!  but as far as the food goes, its pretty gross.  Especially if you walk to the bathroom and SEE the kitchen.  I would only recommend the orange dreamsicle milkshake.  and the vegan items are TOTALLY not vegan.

LobFejJYssgMwZlo4r86tA.review_text: Listen, four stars for being open 24 hours and $15 minimum for delivery. Are you kidding me, how come they don't have more stars?! Sure, it's not cordon bleu food but it's a SF diner that is open 24 hours. How many places in the city are open 24 hours!? I'm down. And they serve Everything.   Bacon blue cheese burger, what up. chilli fries. Any sandwich, fries, salad, burger, etc. you could want to satisfy your late night craving or sloppy 4th meal.   Thanks, Sparky's. See you real soon.

sN6XqrVCINH-_fBbLiPleg.review_text: Absolutely one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had. They were very understaffed during pride at dinner time. I'm talkin' two people serving and bussing the entire restaurant. The wait for our waters, food, and check was very very long. Other people in the restaurant were raising their hands like schoolchildren to get service. The server was grumpy. Put all our silverwear down on the table for us to divide out amongst ourselves. My partner's sandwhich was put on a sad, flat dinner roll. My lasagna had a gross, firm slab of cheese on top. Other people had mistakes with their orders. No one wanted to order or say anything because the wait was so long for every little thing. The bathroom was soaked in urine. Disgusting. Never again.

_HTjUGAotXNQZXda15ToPw.review_text: Been here many times in the college days during late night searches for some basic fill my belly substances and decided last night with similar needs in mind to revisit those memories with some friends.  I'm not sure how the rate the food. It is diner food, it isn't bad and it doesn't blow your mind (or your wallet).  Best thing about Sparky's...the music and the tolerance of staff and other diners when ridiculous people (are you lookin' at me) show up and decide to sing along. This is not an official karaoke spot...but after midnight strange things can happen.  Time After Time, just Like A Prayer you'll find Wild Horses at Sparky's enjoying some basic balance-out-the-liquor type cuisine. If you're lucky they might even que up a little Dolly for ya.

ce5aiZyL4LJ7xknxUhvgQA.review_text: Boooooooo  So went here last night for pride weekend shenanegans. We were so hungry and were happy to find something open. We were seated immediately and ready to order. We sat and watched 3 other parties get seated around us and their orders got taken before us. We had to ask repeatedly for our waitress to come take our order, since she obviously forgot about us. She finally takes our order and then the waiting game continues... FOR ANOTHER 45 MINUTES. We were there for OVER AN HOUR waiting for 2 burgers and a breakfast burrito.... I MEAN COME ON when we asked the waitress what happened to our food, she said they lost the ticket or it was hidden so the kitchen didnt start making our food until 45 after we ordered.... we watched the parties around us get their food, finish eating, pay and leave. and we were STILL waiting. at that point it was a matter of principle, we werent leaving until we got our food. My roommate and i had to ask the manager where our food was, finally it comes out. He offered us free drinks, we asked for free food. They took the burrito off the bill, we still had to pay for the burgers and fries. MY ORDER WAS WRONG, i orded the vegan sandwich "guacamole, olives, artichoke, onions" i got the vegan BURGER. but i didnt feel like reporting the mistake, i didnt want to wait for another hour.... The food is nothing special, just diner food. not worth the wait awful experience ruined our night wish we hadnt left tip wish we hadnt paid period  1 star for the hard working host boy person who sat us so quickly. he was wearing a red shirt and literally sprinting back and forth all night, for the entire 1.5 hours we were there he was working so hard running around. my roommate said "thats how he stays skinny." Cute kid, should have given him tip instead.  we will never go back

Gh7a3aAOlB2zMRocFzGEZg.review_text: Booo! Disappointment...  Came here last night, mostly because I couldn't think of any options that didn't involve a drive-through...or cooking. I checked out their menu online and quickly realized they serve EVERYTHING, so since I was being indecisive, I figured that "everything" was a good option.  Got there, walked in, looked around for a signal of whether I should seat myself or...??? Hmm. No one was paying attention. So I just picked a table and sat down. It was semi-crowded for a Monday night (mostly college aged folks) but I suppose since there was only server waiting on those 8 or so tables, it took her a while to get around to us to take our order. I kinda felt bad for her. She seemed tired.  I ordered the turkey club with a side salad and my hubby got a bacon cheeeburger with fries and a banana shake. Sides are extra add-ons here, but they're only around $1.50 - $2.50, depending on what you're adding. The shake was a whopping 5 bucks, but it was the most delicious thing we ordered - big chunks of fresh banana, creamy vanilla bean ice cream with a neat little mountain of whipped cream on top. I asked my husband if I could have a sip and I ended up drinking the whole thing. He should've known better :)  The rest of the meal was just "meh". The bacon in the turkey club was the best part of it - thick and crispy. But the turkey itself had an odd taste to it. Come to think of it, I know why the turkey tasted funny. It's the way turkey tastes when it's close to or past expiration. It took me a few bites to realize it, and by then I was kinda grossed out. My husband ate half his burger and there was a little pink in the middle of the meat patty even though he ordered it well done. Undercooked meat grosses him out, so that was another fail.  I doubt I'll be back, unless it's to grab a milkshake. Those things are like crack.

n4iI6JX1bpEq3E_f9f-0Ww.review_text: 24hour good diner food!!!   I went here last night after karaoke at the Mint. I can't remember what the bf ate, but my burger was good. The curly fries to go were very tasty as well.   SF is really lucky to have a place like this. If only I lived in the city!

CA-Rn_Od2FrCpn654PjV2A.review_text: I imagine my pitiful review will be mired in the sea of six hundred-plus other reviews, but whatever--it does mean I can procrastinate at work for another minute or two.  Sparky's is nothing special. I've had very good experiences where I received good, hot, fresh-tasting food, and other experiences where the ingredients tasted old, the bread was soggy, and the service was just slow.  The only real thing that Sparky's has going for it is that it's open all the time. This is not to be undervalued! Need a shake or some nachos or something after a long night on the town? Here's your place. Otherwise, if you want a good lunch, Crepevine may be a better bet.

3m2gZtPlkQBe7U7MRn4sHw.review_text: Awesome place to get your hunger kicks when all the bars have closed. Peanut butter milkshakes, yes! Onion rings, delicious! Mac n cheese/ Mashed potatoes and gravy. I am getting hungry just thinking about this place.  Non-stop entertainment all hours of the day. This place never closes making it even more awesome.

9nuv3DsQJFjApI3UgHvgxQ.review_text: I ordered from Sparky's via Eat24hours.com before I checked out all the reviews on Yelp.  While I was waiting for my food I had a sinking feeling in my stomach that a) it'll be 2 hours before I get it b) if so, I'd have to call to either check on my food or ask to void my meal and then I'd have to deal with some incompetent worker c) my food (if/ when delivered) will be cold, wrong, gross or all three. Luckily it was only a little bit of 'C'. My meal was delivered in about an hour by a quick and efficient dude.  At first glance my meal was wrapped up pretty nicely. I got everything I ordered:  cheese fries with cheese on the side, hamburger with cheese AND extra mayo (on the side), and a meatloaf sandwich. The fries were a little cold and came out either chewy or really crunchy. The meatloaf sandwich was TINY and it LOOKED like meatloaf but didn't really TASTE like meatloaf and my cheeseburger was a little soggy on the bottom bun but whatever; both sandwiches came with a pickle, tomatoes, onions, and lettuce. Even though I expected a lot worse and was fairly surprised when I didn't get it, I probably won't order from Sparky's again.  I may venture out there if I'm dancing the night away in the Castro and I'm up for some late night eats or if I'm craving really good milkshake, which seems to be what Sparky's all about. P.S Quick question, Sparky:  what's type of cheese do you guy's use for your cheese fries.  Why is it so sour?

CRIJ0Np6NsQUXSoMAi8WIg.review_text: I order Sparky burger medium rare. Food delivery guy come in 40 minutes which is fast. When I ate my burger it was hard like a rock. It was more like well-done.

sDzSmRS_XbjZDtOQCWQTYA.review_text: Sparky's Diner is one of the worst places to get your late night grub on. Although the service isn't so bad, the cleanliness of the diner and timeliness of receiving your order are unacceptable. I've been going to Sparky's for about 5 or 6 years now and have noticed major changes since the new management. The worst part is that not only will you pay to eat s***y food (because it is pretty much SF's only 24/hr diner) you will pay to see the manager yell at his employees right in front of your table. Maybe it's their idea of dinner and show? Whatever it is...Sparky's is solely still in business because  unfortunate San Francisco dwellers have no where else to eat, s***, or sleep (only plus is I get to check out the hapa server). Anyone for Denny's?  [IF ANYONE WANTS TO ATTEST THIS REVIEW I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU EAT AT A 24/HR DINER IN NY OR SOMEWHERE OTHER THAN SF BECAUSE FOR GREASY SPOON LOVERS- WE KNOW WHAT'S UP]

uma4cpwE9iA2mZTKCkf6PA.review_text: The food ranges from 3 to 5 stars. The service ranges from 4 to 5 stars, depending on how much shit the wait staff has had to deal with that night. The customers range from -4 to 5 stars. Everything from eye candy to questionable crackheads that can be horrifyingly comedic until they snap.... While working on a contract in San Francisco, my partner and I ate there every night we could justify it.

_Kt01zAkzGDjSphy7W3qOA.review_text: I definitely sleep-ordered Sparky's last night. That's right, and imagine my surprise when at 12 AM I was abruptly woken up by my buzzer, and happily met with my Sparky's.  The mac n cheese was tepid. The mango salad was ok- the mango was AWESOME but the olives were incredibly salty and sort of took over the rest of the salad.    I dunno. I'm happy to have a place like this that delivers so late, but the food really isn't that impressive.

IPVGScq1zk8MeasWDAQWmQ.review_text: Horrible, horrible, horrible service!  The people always sound like it's a bother when you call to order and throw in a little attitude with it!  They have forgotten part of our order on more than one occasion!  The last time the missed curly fries, said they were going to resend them with free mac and cheese.  2 hours later (after several follow up calls) they still had not brought it!  They said the delivery boy came and called us numerous times and we didn't answer.  Lie!  We work in a 24 hour establishment with someone constantly on the phones!  They were very rude and said it was our fault for not answering (a phantom) phone call and were unapologetic!  Never will order again and we'll make sure no one else at our large workplace won't either!

ta1sgX3A79D8FfojR-WvJQ.review_text: Sparky's, and the strip on which it is located on Church Street, is awesome! Newest discovery about this diner: $1.50 beers during Happy Hour! Monday-Friday, 4pm-9pm, New Castle, Hefeweizen, and Sierra Nevadas are $1.50 each, $1.79 each with tax. Could this get any better? Oh it can, cause the food at Sparky's, though classic diner fare, is exceptional. I recommend the Eggplant Parmesan sandwich with fries. Example:  Me and two of my pals visited Sparky's last week, and each enjoyed several beers, and I a sandwich and fries.  The total bill was $20 and some change. PERFECTO! Sparky's also offers a great alternative to the ever popular, and always crammed, Orphan Andy's, after a night out in the Castro. Personally, I prefer Sparky's.

eZQC4Ng7NMKkOvBAdenbrw.review_text: I often come to Sparky's when I am on my way home from a show or something.  I do love a chocolate shake at midnight.  I don't think they are the best diner in the city.  They are OK but there are somethings they do that I don't care for (the carrots in the hash browns....ew).    Let's face it, at 2 AM I want something fast, filling and with good parking and Sparky's fits that.  They will have my biz for a while.

Lwr2o4El3bVXinkZ2qJQzg.review_text: Upon starting my shift at 2:00AM this morning, I suddenly realized I was famished. As I was assigned to work in The Castro, I decided to get a hot meal in the neighborhood. Sparky's to the rescue!  Nothing about Sparky's merits anything above a 3 star rating from me. Both customer service and food proved to be decent, as evidenced by my lack of a scowl while exiting the restaurant and the fact that, 9 hours later, I don't have a tummy ache.  I had the biscuits and gravy with scrambled eggs and sausages. Not bad, and I actually liked the country gravy that was served. The biscuits were a little on the hard side and a bit over-cooked, but that gravy saved the day AND hit the spot.   I'll definitely be back the next time I'm hungry and working in that area at all hours of the night.

p1pyOPRp9TVW5C4sihKUIw.review_text: Meh. Good for late night drunk food when you really can't taste/comprehend anything anyway, but wouldn't eat there regularly. Food just ok, nothing special.

ikt9qlgVp5CgR7FhX4F2RQ.review_text: I had order the California omelets, my friend had the ham and cheese omelets and his friend had pancakes with two sunny side up eggs.  The basket part tasted good little bit expensive but good service .  It wasn't crowded too.The breakfast was a big order all most couldn't finish because I'm not a heavy weight  or maybe it had alot of fiber.  This was all after the Loveevolution after party.

HcPcr0hwCEbKrliyN7Cy0g.review_text: I went on a Thursday, early evening. It was not overly crowded, and that is important after having had a long day.    Someone named Shelly had helped me tremendously.  I had a pretty long day, and was gearing up for an even longer evening.  Shelley was pretty easy to talk to even outside of the restaurant, while taking a break.  Very, very sweet, but not cloyingly so.  I requested Shelley to tell me what to get.  Got a great milkshake (something between an orchata and chai) and chicken tenders.  Chicken tenders were excellent, which I really can't say I had that way before.  Ask her what to get.  Then get it.  Don't debate.  Don't doubt.  Just do it.  Oh and one more thing to add, I convinced a friend to live in San Francisco after taking them here.  Fresh squeezed orange juice can work wonders, especially after a club.

UE-rXhA8njNnADFkDA3EuA.review_text: Peanut butter-chocoloate-shake and curly-fries just right.

URZ55SnOMfCvZeG0c7Kzmw.review_text: I always like the servers here, they are warm and friendly.. but the food is not good, gah.. got a vege burger, came with lettuce and tomato, no sauce, nothing all dry and tasteless meh. A flat not that cold beer, meh. I was desperate it was late.. I might drive the extra couple of miles to king of thai noodle.. This place is just so not worth it.

0pbeMcY7MSdkgB2Y7bRMww.review_text: Well, where else would you go for 24 hour food service if you don't want to go to Nations in Daly City or the Lucky Penny in SF?  Sparky's of course.    Food is decent, nothing spectacular.  It was quick service and I was satisfied at 3a after hitting the clubs nearby.

pdkC61eKal1LInEFigmXWw.review_text: A co-worker and I were having breakfast. I had hasbrowns, eggs and sausage. My breakfast was gross. My co-worker said her seattle omelette was good. A few minutes later she said "look" a 1/2 inch piece of glass. The waitress named Alexa, apologized 4 times, and took care of the meal. I still had to pay for mine. We appreciated the apology. Nevertheless there was glass in the food. I was telling her, how I got hooked on yelp. She said for justice we must use yelp. I think the quality of Sparkys has gone down hill, since the good old days back in the 90's... It's one of those places, some like it, some don't. I'm a don't.

0Tv2dl2O0TEQD-VGbPqwug.review_text: I ate here after the bars closed one night. I had a California omelet and a berry blast shake. The food was good and the shake was fruity and unique. They also deliver 24 hours a day. That's unheard of. It takes about an hour for a pizza order to get there when ordered after hours.

51qWMULK-VlF9c5DzYtlMA.review_text: Ugh, this place.  Don't order the delivery. Just don't. Believe me, I know how tempting it is looking at their menu at 2am when the only other delivery option is pizza so bad even I wouldn't eat it. But that burger or entree that sounds so appetizing will be a cold, inedible mess of congealed grease when it arrives two and a half hours later.

39xs6uccltWsX7XdrJWChw.review_text: Late Night, Drunk Food :-)  MUST HAVE: "THE KING" (Peanut Butter / Banana Milkshake)

GZPQhvrgPffGTVMOpP-QOg.review_text: "Crappy" To be sung to Pharell Williams's "Happy"  It might seem crazy what I'm about to say An SF diner, causes belly aches I'm a grossed out patron that is sad I ate Spot on Church, good locale, needs to go away  [Chorus:] Because its crappy Clap along if you feel like frozen food is not too cool Because its crappy Clap along if you feel the decor should be something new Because its crappy Clap along if you know that fries should be crispy fool Because its crappy Clap along if you feel that this diner gave up too

YWsArVWpHptn4Y39W67KMA.review_text: Such a great place to end off the already fun night!  Its a cute diner, and they have a huge menu!  I got the Works Burger and macaroni.  They hit the spot!  The blueberry pancakes are to die for.  Great attentive service and plenty of seating for our group.  Nicely decorated..

mP90mtrnkmnZCA_pioVFEg.review_text: Waiter was a sweet heart but after waiting for 1hour and 17 minutes For a burger and a pasta we had to leave and never come back! The kitchen was busy taking delivery orders and  didn't care about who was actually there! Terrible service

pehdkxwE_uW-Bdf2ZxWsug.review_text: Menu is all over the place. From Mexican, to fast food, to Italian. Make up yo' mind! Their only good thing on their menu was the pesto gnocchi which is now officially off the menu... GREAT!  If you are overly intoxicated, just stumbled out of Trigger or Cafe on a Friday of boybar night and your sense of taste, smell, and vision are out the window than this is the place to go...  PROS: open 24hours, mediocre food for being a diner, mediocre service  CONS: 90% of the time I've ordered delivery there was something missing in the order and took hours for it to be retrieved and redelivered.
