Also,  unisex bathroom is dump. It looks and smells like a crack house shithole. Nasty! And the overly claustrophobic amount of graffiti and chewing gum glued to the wall do not help.  FINAL RECCOMENDATION: Sober? STAY AWAY!

pkQMZfTnd8O0kP4FA-wogA.review_text: All I remember about this place was throwing up, the rest of the time I was blacked out. I think I ordered some pasta dish, something with garlic, my morning hangover told me that. And the waitress forced me into coffee, I also remember that. But I remember taking a bite, than running to the bathroom to wait in line to puke, I remember looking back and forth between lines, glaring thoughtfully at a garbage can, the acid rising in my throat until finally some dude let me cut and I finally got the relief I was looking for. I then ate the rest of my food, tasting nothing but the fifth of vodka and garlic I just tossed up in the bathroom. I also remember it was WAY too expensive for diner food, and somehow I paid the tab?!?!  you may think less of this review due to the fact I was blacked out and it's all bits and pieces... but let me tell you, the morning after that food wouldn't stay down either. And my hangover ended the moment that food got out of my stomach.

U7HOJtDHUWuTNh8YyL9V_A.review_text: I went here after seeing the Faint at the Fillmore last night and it was past midnight so both Home restaurant and Baghdad Cafe were closed. I ordered a vegan burger with mushrooms, guacamole, and a side of fries. The other two people in my party ordered a vegan burger and a hamburger. It took us at least a half hour to get our food. I'd never been to Sparky's so I thought "Maybe they make the veggie burgers by hand." If by hand that means opening up a box of garden burgers and sticking it in a microwave, then yes. Upon ordering our food, everything was lukewarm, bordering on cold. It was late and I was starving, so I didn't care. Another person in my party ordered macaroni and cheese and didn't eat it because he said the cheese tasted like "melted plastic" Our server did as much as he could, so nothing was wrong there.  One thing that is unjustified here is the pricing. It was like $7.35 or something just for a veggie burger that came with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and a pickle. it was an extra dollar for mushrooms and guacamole, and another $1.85 for fries. I could get the same thing at Herbivore, with a real veggie burger, for less than that, and it would have been way better.  Sparky's, if I can avoid you when I'm looking for a late-night meal, then I most definitely will.

omA8E9OVn4w3lBBmnYmMJQ.review_text: Here's their most recent health inspection- 59, who get's a 59?  Read all about the rodents and more here- dph-extranet2.sfdph.org:… 3 high risk violations, 4 moderate risk, and 2 low risk.

Eafw2mRd_qTIMYLHISP-Fw.review_text: Late Friday night, empty.  Dimly lit, I had to walk around the place to find a light bulb so I could see my menu.  I did see a mummy in the corner of the room, a sign of things to come.  Our server was best described as a zombie, I mean really creepy.  My dining companion opened up his sandwich after he was half way into it.  He turned pale and got up to use the same light bulb I used to  see the menu.  He said it didn't look like food, so he stopped eating.  My food was glue, I mean it really stuck to my tongue.  I suppose the taste was okay, but the texture was scary.    Ambiance, dirty and worn Service, slow and creepy Food, as bad as I've eaten The exit was conveniently located and we made avail of it.

CItMwJUX0Dv8wwugxWVUPQ.review_text: I gotta say I only end up here after a night of drinking in the city.  Isn't that the story for most of the patron though?  I went in earlier last time about 10 PM, after an afternoon of drinking in the city, and it was eeriely quiet.  I'm glad Sparky's is there when I need some greasy food to soak up the booze, and I'm sure the fact I have eaten there has saved me from getting sick on more than one night.  The food is pretty mediocre though, not bad but just not that good.  I always order different stuff hoping I will find something I really like there but it hasn't happened yet.  I'll be back though, where else am I going to eat after going to "the club".

v7AkhbgYKX2e2N3suNc2pg.review_text: TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!! I ordered a burger (no fries) and a salad at 8:53 and it is now 11:34 and I'm still waiting. When I called to check they claimed that I did not answer my phone. I gave my house number just in case there was a bad signal. No one called. I am now sitting on my front steps writing this review and awaiting my "re-deliver." Let's see how long this will take. I might also add that I live .8 miles away. I will update if I ever get my order.

i4F4I6ESSQFqWrhPoxhGSw.review_text: Every time I visit SF, I come to Sparky's. The food is always good and I always enjoy the atmosphere.  Also, they are open 24 hours.. How can you beat that?

s_GRv1tdJXIU9N08HzeDbA.review_text: I've been here plenty of times and had an ok time. But today I went sober. Yikes.  My waitress was a sweetheart. The food was dis-gus-ting.   You know how if you leave bread or cheese in the fridge for too long and it gets that weird, stale, fridge-y taste? Everything I ate tasted exactly like that. I feel like everything I bit into had been waiting months for me to show up. I had the "superb burger" (ha!)- the bun was stale and weird-tasting, the hamburger was rubbery, and the guacamole was clearly store-bought, over-lemoned grossness. They even jacked up the bacon somehow. BACON!  Same story with my milkshake. It was full of ice chunks and tasted off. Yuck yuck yuck. Will not go back.

jvdWFMcZiiGiHrblVJsg4Q.review_text: Now I understand the terrible reviews. Because, I previously wrote a glowing review. I discovered Sparkys on May 9th of this year, and was thrilled to get good food delivered at 3:30 in the morning when I'm ready for dinner. Never had a problem. Till tonight.  It started out as just an error...I ordered a pizza, and two hours later called to see if it was still coming. The gal said no, I said fine, just process the credit card refund. She told me I needed the manager, I went on hold. After ten minutes, I hung up and called back. This time I was given the manager who didn't apologize about the missed delivery, which I noted but didn't really care about, but when I asked for my refund he gave me attitude, said he needed me to call back the next day cause he was apparently unable to figure out a refund. When I said Hey, you messed up my order, can't you at least help me get my money back? He told me to fuck off, and hung up on me.  Check it out...I added my credit card receipts since May 9th from Sparkys. $827. Imagine that, I spent $827 in just 6 weeks, can you imagine a better customer? And now they will never get another dime.

h9RgxgZrdmHmbBUvBhn8fg.review_text: the food isnt top notch, but it isnt bad either. I am always working and they deliver except for bfast. I usually get a custom salad and a custom breakfast and the people on the other end of the phone are friendly and energetic, especially Gisselle. I definitely reccomend for late night delivery.

gTxigDuZ9BIKmkRsjQ5vMA.review_text: This place has been around my whole partying career which is in cooling off mode right now.  But, lets not go off on that tangent. Thank you Sparky's for being there when I was drunk in the early nineties. I was basically a jock kid.., drinking 40s and jack and cokes, etc. After partying at the Night Break, or Justice League, etc., we would head to Sparky's to chill and grub. Thanks for being there when I turned a touch 90's bohemian with an alternative rock vibe.  Yeah, that's what we used to call it back then, "alternative."  Always a good solution to a common problem.  Damn, where can we get some food at 3am that's decent and avoid the tourists on Lombard.  Sparky's, your late night burgers, and breakfasts are decent enough at 3am.  You're always there when I need you.  Plus you serve beers late night as well.  I'm not sure how you pull that off, but it's definitely a bonus.  The last time I went there, I noticed all the 22 year olds trying to be punk like it was 1985 all over again..... Nice.

0H45akEGkl-aF5iQ2PJiIA.review_text: The best way to sober up is to have one of their  (Mitchell's ice cream made) milkshakes. The food is okay - but I won't hate on diner food at 2 in the morning! It's your basic fair - burgers, eggs, sandwiches, etc. If it hits the spot in those wee hours (and I don't feel sick afterwards), I'm satisfied.

Us_9GNwgcfdCHN4bqgwxTg.review_text: Honestly, the food is atrocious. The sauteed mushrooms in my omelette tasted like trout.  But look. It's extra late on a school night. This hot chick shows up at your doorstep unannounced. Five hours later you need calories. Where are you going to go?   0 stars for food, 5 stars for being open. Split the difference: 3 stars.

DL_0lsGbnwynSF7T5az0iw.review_text: this place was dope!  great place!  good food! great prices and good service aaanndd open 24 hours! what more could you want??

dI8AUggsaPaiv07h4vcdCQ.review_text: Earth would be a better place w/o Sparky's  - Ordered a Turkey Club on wheat with guac on the side, got a chicken club on sour dough with guac inside - Ordered at precisely 2:06AM, got my food at precisely 3:28AM - Even after I waited 1 hour and 22 min for my food, I still tipped the driver 10% and he didn't even say thank you - told them the last 4 digits of my phone number was 6329, they called 6328 - Ordered a sandwich, fishnchips, and bruschetta, charged me $33.00 - Food tasted like shit - Person was unpleasant on the phone - I hate this place with a passion - I sincerely hope the restaurant gets bombed with no one inside

sulmEWFVWQLVqNMJmb3HRQ.review_text: Me and my boyfriend come here quite often for breakfast and the food is always good and the prices are reasonable.  The only thing I don't like about it is when my boyfriend checks out the hot waiter as if I don't see him doing it.

3Kb1oQL8QixWm0p-UrLtSg.review_text: No stars at all. This place lacks every aspect of customer service. I made the deliver order at 11:45 and waited and hour and a half for my burgers, fries, and milkshakes only to find an order that was wrongly made, cold, and soggy.  I called the place and let the girl who answered the phone know about the situation.  She responded with, "...honestly, its a lost cause." What kind of customer service is that?! My receipt was for $38.90 and i tipped the driver 5 dollars. I never asked for my money back, but i wanted my corrected order.  After being on hold for 20 minutes, I gave up  and threw the crap in the trash.  Very unpleasant experience... Would definitely not recommend or try again.

fqhk1VoHE-RDxNwBu9hdmg.review_text: When you wind up in a place where you can order a few things you know they make right, and then they stop making it right...that's when it's time to call it quits.

rlnWz8Tm_bnp5IBwnpcjcA.review_text: Ok so this place is pretty much popular for being open 24 hours, its one of the only 24 hour spots in SF. now this would be a big deal to me but i am originally from LA and there are 24 hour diners everywhere, so san francisco needs to get on the ball and open some more especially considering how many late night drinkers would love to chow down on some greasy food at 3 in the morning.  Ok now on to my review. this place is really mediocre. There is nothing outstanding about the food at all. The portions are way smaller than most diners and the dishes are more expensive. I have ordered everything from tuna melts to eggs to pastrami sandwiches and shakes, it's all pretty average. so for food you could do better before all the other restaurants in the area close.   Now for the wait staff....ANNOYING. i dont need some coked up ass getting all "fun" and in my face when i am ordering, sparky's thinks this is cute and cutting edge, i just think it sucks. If the wait staff isnt hyped up and obnoxious then they are feigning this apathetic vibe that just crawls under my skin. just take my order and be chill and leave me alone is pretty much what i want.   so yeah i am giving this place a 2 stars because there food isnt god awful and they are open 24 hours, but all that needs to happen for that extra star to go away is any decent place also opening up its doors all night long.   thanks sparkys but no thanks i'll order seniores instead.

kyG14FyCWmVW3Uefs_GE_Q.review_text: This is a great place to go when you're coming out of the clubs late at night.  Last time I was here I had the B.L.A.T. (bacon, lettuce, avocado, and tomato) with mac and cheese and it was pretty decent.  I've also eaten burgers here which are decent and their shakes are very tasty.  Apparently service here can be spotty although the several times I've been here I haven't had a problem.  This place is A-OK!

cTq63sAKSiprV7ojppL-kA.review_text: If I could give this place 0 stars, that'd be the rating.   The service was so terrible that a 30 minute quick meal turned into a 2 hour meal, where most of the time was waiting to be served or given the check. Our waiter was quite rude and disregarded us several times due to our age (18).   Do not get me started on the food. Almost nobody within my table finished their plate because it was simply disgusting. I got the chicken strips thinking, "you can't ruin chicken strips" but boy, they proved me wrong. Their biscuits and gravy are just sad.  This was probably the worst restaurant I've dined in.

5Smt9sSlAKx0E4bpqc2z-w.review_text: Nicest people working there, dynamic crowd (expect the unexpected), and the food is edible (read: delicious) which is not something that can be said about other 24 hour diners

xzgPEBJ_NoxPGtE1_7HfBg.review_text: I can't speak for the rest of the offerings at Sparky's, but I've come here on more than a few weekends to get their French Toast platter.  The french toast is great - nothing too fancy, but a perfect portion and tasty.  The platter comes with meat and eggs cooked to order.  I've had good service experiences there, but haven't been there when it's been very busy, either.  My coffee cup never seemed to get empty.  The platter, coffee, and tip go for about $13 - haven't been in the city too long, but this feels reasonable to me.  The interior isn't anything to write home about but you get the sense that this place has been a part of the neighborhood for a while.  I'm trying to keep myself from doing this too often on weekends (I mean, spending money on food that's probably not too good for me), but I'll be happy to pop in to Sparky's again soon.

iquCZU8tjmRQrnDgci5YpQ.review_text: They're called Sparky's 24 Hour Diner.  They have a sign outside advertising that they're open 24 hours.  But they aren't open 24 hours.  I went on a Tuesday morning and they were closed.

OP7Dhj5lM0gaDC4AipAiDg.review_text: This place is good for when you're drunk or high. It was the only place by our hotel that was open at 1 AM on a Thursday that had everything we wanted. The cheese ravioli wasn't that great, but it was hot to my surprise. The ice melted almost completely in our drinks. Dreamsicle was yummy. And the pizza was like a 3 on a scale of 1 to 5. I liked that they delivered.. Just a little pricier than I liked but the delivery guy did come to our hotel room up 4 flights of stairs cuz the elevator was broken. Oh and I dislike whoever answered the phones and ended up ordering from the cell's browser instead. They said "Sparky's.. Please hold," the first time, then hung up. And the second time, they said "Hello?" "Hi, I'd like to order...." click! Hung up.  Kinda felt like that was on purpose cuz they were busy or whatever but still pretty rude.

3ra8Sf_V4Fzr2k10Zh5N_Q.review_text: I think Sparky's is the best at night, dining with the late night crowd is always fun with the juke box goin...  Their burgers are the best after a night out...and their shakes are tasty too. i like the cappuchino mint, so good. Their breakfast food is pretty good too, a little greasy, as it should be.

SWSuTGJLc8TcfRsyRZoGLw.review_text: Sparkys gets my praise! Yummy and reliable! I haven't tried everything on the list, but here's some suggestions: Salads: Avocado and Mango... Yum yum! Nice size portions, the are blessed for picking the best ripe avocado's! I usually remove the bean sprouts and lime dressing and substitute it! They really do read the special instructions and follow through! I have severe health issues and can't eat most things! Thank God for Sparkys especially late night! Their fettuccine hope I spelled that right is great with chicken, my daughter loves their chili cheese fries and berry blast shakes! Oh their turkey club, tuna melt and BLAT bacon, lettuce, avocado and tomato... Excellent! You want something local, great and can order up to 3:30 am, great service! This is your place! Try it for yourself! Blessings

qMyX4a0uNP3MjKkhrgkh3g.review_text: The one star is because 0 stars in not allowed and i guess they get a point for being open 24hours.  My friends and I stumbled in here sat night after pride festivities.. we were drunk/hungover and really just needed some nice comfort food.   Service was slow but to be expected that weekend. But over and hour for 4 items was just ridiculous. What was even more ridiculous was that the frys were soggy and old and the turkey club sandwich i ordered came out as  turkey burger instead. I wasnt about to send it back and wait any longer. It was cold and gross. We threw half the food out and choked down the rest.  But it's no wonder the service and food were shitty..what did they care.. The get an automatic 18% gratuity on ALL checks. Ridiculous.  And someone needs to alert the police because there has to be a dead body in their bathrooms. We sat and watched everyone gag as they walked out of the bathrooms.   gross

djcJw7FB9GsDXtbcqXGwjg.review_text: Sparky's used to be a favorite of mine. They have lowered the bar beyond forgivable and the last three times I have ordered "vegetarian" items from them they have put HAM in my fake chick sandwich, HAM in my Eggs Florentine, and BACON on my veggie burger. I tried to chock it up to an accident the first two times but this is unforgivable. If you are a vegetarian you should seriously reconsider ordering from them or look over your food before you take a bite out of it.

w8RSBoMYx9488QX-nXA4Wg.review_text: I used to like Sparkys before they changed their fake chicken to a different brand (gag me!)  So the other night (monday), the gf and I go to have a late dinner after work. (2am). They're by no means as busy as usual and they seat us in this area that smelled like horrible BO. We asked to move and they obliged. We wait 5 minutes to get a menu. Notice I said "A" menu. One. There's two of us... But okay whatever. We wait another 10 minutes to attempt to order our food. Keep in mind, they are not busy AT ALL. So the waiter (bald guy maybe in his late 30's) walks over and tells us "Hey guys Im sorry but we switched to a new ordering system and we're all having problems with it. so the food is taking a little longer, your food will be out in like 30-45 minutes."   WHAT. For diner food? Have you ever heard of maybe walking 10 steps to the kitchen and hand delivering the orders since you're obviously not saavy enough to use the new system. My gf then says "It's okay, sorry we're just gonna go." To which the waiter responds "Oh you just came for the free water." Did we unknowingly enter a used car or retail shop? I've never encountered a waiter trying to pressure someone to buy food nor have I ever had a waiter make snide comments like that.   Is it too much to ask to have a Good late night eatery in a city as big as SF?

zD1rSeKrGnVx57uznaahcA.review_text: DONT DO IT!    Ok,... if your drunk out of your mind and happen to be in their neighborhood, sure you can get a crappy burger at 3am but buyer beware.   Delivery, read the other reviews, usually ice cold, food medicore at the very best and and a good number of times they no show.   See the amount of times of no shows on other reviews.   AND refusal to refund.  I wanted a burger, made the mistake of ordering delivery and hoping for the best...  3 hours later and 2 calls, no food and refused to refund my credit card.     If you want to order from this place be prepared to donate money to their drug fund.   Clearly no one sober person is running the restaurant.

fTtoCkErsYGW5rZ3m_7uQg.review_text: delivering to the hospital until 4am!!!  Noc shifters need not be hungry until 0730 anymore!

I_XzAL0oGQ1MdOxNxNl7Cg.review_text: Grumpy servers.  Mediocre food.  Dismal selection of vegan options.  And yet, I love Sparky's so frickin' much and go there at least once a week, usually either in the wee hours of the morning or for happy hour ($1.50 pints!!).   I really don't understand why I love this place as much as I do, but I suppose it does have its charm, and the food tastes fine when you're drunk.  They've catered to some of my friend's pretty crazy requests, like when he asked for "turkey cheese fries,"  and they took french fries and put a bunch of turkey lunch meat and nacho cheese on top. Sometimes they even give us happy-hour-priced beer when its well after 9pm!  Oh, Sparky's :3

k6Mpbv0ousx5c_q6ekBExg.review_text: Excuse me for eating.  Chicken sandwich. Flame broiled over dried feces. That's what it tasted like.

PWMRXCXdOG6B_FXe-Lj-JA.review_text: There seems to be a love/hate thing going on with this place, but come on whiny ppl, you are lucky to have anything that's open 24 hours in this city, it ain't NYC or New Orleans after all. Food was ok, but after drinking heavily, does it really matter? It sure beats nuked 7-11 type of food

ZkLBvzCFzx1dW9s2fvvLZg.review_text: Ok, I was surprised to see that there were some not so favorable reviews on this place? Cause this kitty's experience was nothing like that of which I saw other speaking of.  Came here with a large ish group and not being familiar with the area too well, we looked and saw that they had seating, so we took the chance and went in.  We were seated quite promptly and ordered from a truly vast array of items on the menu. I LOVE the fact that you can order breakfast at anytime. There are sometimes where this cheetah will be craving some eggs in the late night, so the fact that this is available kind of makes my day ^ ^  Our group split into two tables and our table decided to split the checks. I always hate doing that cause I feel it makes things complicated for the waiter, but he took our request with no problem. I have to say, the waiter was an absolute sweetheart. He was busy and had some tough stuff happen prior, but he was super nice to all of us in our group and was very genuine. Perfect service.  So now the food! Me and my other friend in the group decided to cater to our dinner time breakfasty desires and went for an omelette. The portions here are BIG, and the omelette was served with toast and hash browns. Everything was cooked perfectly and was full of flavor. Definitely satisfied.   I am so happy to have found this restaurant and for sure I'll be checkin it out again when I'm in the area. Great food, wonderful service, heck, the meal ended with some small talk with the waiter and a cook. It was a great experience for us all, and this is definitely a place I would highly recommend to others.  Loved it.  *Chirp!*

T69RnHiG3WsJzcIIZCsrCQ.review_text: Sparkies has been my late night spot to eat at. My return has been because of some of the servers; friendly. Today just surprised me; bad service and bland garlic fries!

Epe59CnqFVM88UiBLry1Tw.review_text: Well that was extremely disappointing. Our order went through at 1:30 (via Eat24). By 3:15 we called and used the Eat24 chat feature and both said that the order was out for delivery and would arrive in 10 minutes. I called back at 3:45 to check in again to have them say the same thing. The food finally arrived at 3:50. I'm not sure how it can take 2 hours and 20 minutes to cook and deliver. When it did arrive the chicken tenders were soggy and burned black, the fries had all gone soggy, and the burgers were cold and unappetizing.  Sorry Sparky, I won't be coming back.

Lg2Bdk4VdFsj0zynl6wNVQ.review_text: One of the first rules I learned about clubbin' in San Francisco is this:  Bridge and tunnel folk of Ruby Skye, Beauty Bar and the Marina go to Denny's and take the Fremont St. exit  Real San Franciscans eat at Sparky's.   It's up to you. Their curly fries are bomb as are their omelettes and the service isn't bad, not the best but not the worst either.

YDRG5DNvF8boYBP_P2DtZg.review_text: I was once kicked out of sparky's for Talking to a rather amusing homeless person before entering their "haute cuisine" noisy sack of offal. The guy was walking down the street making chicken noises for christ's sake! Now, maybe I have a bias, because I have a friend who took a wee sugarcube of liquid sunshine and ended up making chicken noises for two weeks to hilarious results, but I have found that individuals engaging in such avian behavior our not to be trifled with, and may indeed be high ranking aliens sent to earth to judge our tolerance or maybe just for our drunken amusement. Point being, anyone who Doesn't talk to a homeless guy walking down the street bawking and rawking is a poser and a douchebag and should probably move back to whatever shit-smeared corn-hole state they came from.   So anyway, the server/waitperson/manager/tool (who really shouldn't have been judging as he was clearly emulating the fashion sense of the much more friendly and genuinely shit smeared fellow outside) asks me: "Are you friends with that guy?" To which I respond cheerfully: "Yeah, I guess... Maybe as of 5 minutes ago." To which this intolerant turd termite has the temerity to say: "Get out." I tried to belligerently argue with him for the greater part of two minutes (much to my girl friend's mortification), at which point he smugly informs me he's going to call the cops. (!!!!) So... yeah. Despite their best intentions at looking cool, the wait staff here are just a bunch of slimy capitalist tools (and vegans too?! I had no idea really, but it totally figures)...  Oh yeah, and they also kicked me out for nursing the same cup of coffee over my sketch pad for eight hours (which is a wee bit more understandable, but still serves as further corroboration to their over-all tool-ieness)  And they don't serve those radtacular espresso shakes with real espresso grounds in them anymore either, as far as I can tell. Tools.  But I digress. The food is decent, if overpriced, and they are open 24 hours, in one convenient location, so what are you going to do?  Actually, they should just print that over the window and be done with it.

OXYtOFX9xXukagW5Ku5dfg.review_text: I've passed by this place many times but I was never particularly interested in dining here. The other night, my friends were getting really hungry and it was super late so we decided to go here because it's 24 hours.   The place is spacious but nothing special. Kind of grimy. We were seated right away but overall service was sub par.   We were a pretty big group. 6 people total. We took a while to decide what to order, but it took even longer for us to get our waiter to come over and take out order.   I ordered a tuna melt. My friends ordered chili cheese fries/patty melt, vegetarian burger/mac and cheese/mocha mint shake, personal pepperoni pizza, and onion rings/cheesy fries respectively. It took maybe a little less than 20 minutes to get our food.  When the food arrived, I wasn't impressed. Flipped my tuna melt to see that it was blackened on the other side meaning they tried to hide it. I ate it anyway. It was okay.   I split that tuna melt with my friend for half of his patty melt. I liked that one better because it was heartier, but it was also just okay. Chili cheese fries were okay. Canned chili and processed cheese.   I tried the onion rings, the mocha shake, and the mac and cheese. Mac and cheese was okay, not a lot of flavor. Onion rings were good. Mocha shake was delicious.   Tried to get our server's attention for the check. It took ten minutes because he wasn't paying attention to us. He was watching TV.   Got our check to find that gratuity was added without us being informed about it. Apparently groups of 6 automatically adds gratuity. I understand this, but I don't like that he didn't tell us about it and I don't like that the gratuity was 18%. The service we received was not worth 18%.   The friend who eats here the most tells me that the service is not usually as piss poor as it was that night. We all assume that this is because it was past midnight but still.   I don't plan to eat here again unless I have to.

U4zJNBTaWiJp3iQBQpLUFA.review_text: Damn, WTF was I thinking when I ordered huevos ranchero's here? With the Mission only being two skips away... arrrghh.   This place does drunken / greasy hangover cure food as good as can be expected, but my huevos ranchero's were straight out of a weird junkie movie, where "charlie" from Lost is making breakfast after doing an 8-ball of coke in some crappy London apartment... everything was just wrong, including the camera angle. First off, beans  tasted like they came straight from a can (that can easily be remedied with a little seasonings and a bit more cooking... mr stoner chef), the salsa was tasteless, the eggs came fried and sandwiched already between two tortillas. Wrong. Wrong. Wrong. Buzz!  I'm all for creativity and personal expression - but ordering huevos ranchero's from Sparky's is kinda like when some lame band totally bollixes up one of your favorite songs when trying to cover it.   What made it more irritating was that my friends spinach and mushroom omelette was not only perfectly serviceable, but it was actually pretty darn good. If only I picked the correct menu item my breakfast may have turned out fine... do yourself a favor - when ordering from Sparky's menu - keep it simple, don't order "foreign" exotic things like huevo's ranchero's

__8GaZVjxvWHm1Hip5dH8w.review_text: I like this place.  After having some drinks, you tend to get hungry, and as a vegetarian, this place is great.  I do get practically the same thing though which is the Fake Chicken sandwich.  Yea, that's what they call it.  I had to ask initially if it was really "fake" so that I do not eat real chicken.  Whack I know, but I've been to places that have "Soy Chicken" on the menu, but it turned out that they mean soy sauce chicken.  And yes, this is a place with some vegetarian items, so you can see my confusion.  You live you learn.  Anyway, Sparky's is usually packed after the club lets out.  It's a bit away from the clubs I usually go to, but other than here, I would go to Orphan Andy's.  Their lines are usually super long though, so as Sparky's tend to be a faster wait, we go.... and yes fake chicken is good!

RIZUxKz-5lEWPJfvEU-EYA.review_text: They have gotten worse. Food was ok but lately every order they get is wrong or something is seriously wrong with it. Example: I order a chocolate cake with my food. He asked if i want al a mode and I said no. when the driver gets here it is soggy cake swimming in melted ice cream. Last time they charged me for an item I didn't order and have yet to refund it to my credit card (they also double charged me) and time before the food wasn't completely cooked.  I am done with them.

ORx7Hic3VkAg58jTdHpjVQ.review_text: Dear Sparkey's,  I used to love you so much. Once upon a time I would rant and rave about the deliciousness of your mashed potatoes, especially after a long evening in Dolores Park. I took my mother here for my birthday one year. Oh, Sparkey's you used to be so great, now, WHAT THE F*CK HAPPENED?  Sometime around when you changed your menu everything fell apart. The service went to sh¡t, the prices all went up, I wouldn't be surprised if you decided to cut your hours soon. I mean, really, is it that hard for your waiters to put menus on my table? To repeat my order so they don't mess it up (which at 3 in the morning you seem to be doing a lot now)? How about asking me if I want whipped cream on my mocha? Is 2 seconds just 2 seconds more than you can bother with?  I miss the old days a lot, Sparkey's. When that waiter with the red hair would laugh his way through the day, make sure we had everything we wanted and even accommodate a rambunctious group of *possibly* intoxicated high school sophomores at two nearby booths because there were too many to fit into one. Those where the days when I didn't mind rounding up to the nearest dollar, even if it meant a 30% tip.  You've changed, Sparkey's, you've really changed. It breaks my heart every time I pass by and decide I'm not quite as hungry as I thought I was. Now, come 3 am, I think I'll just visit the Safeway kitty-corner from you  for a microwave dinner or some eggs and frozen fries so I can go home and feed myself -- at least that way I can be sure that my water glass will always be full.  With what was one true love, Elena C.

Kx4RtLVvwFuH2F4hWKB0ig.review_text: I came here after raving around 2 or 3am. It was packed! But we got a seat right away.  The food here isn't bad. I had the eggs benedict, but i think because i was tired and buzzed, that I didn't get to fully enjoy my food. I picked at my benedict and some of the hashbrowns.   Prices were good and service was ok. It has dim lighting too.  I would come back if I weren't too buzzed. I want to enjoy my food sober next time.

cTrlhfni7C3xFlyIL3x1bQ.review_text: Not bad for drunken late night dinner....just don't come here sober because you will be dissapointed!!!

4oCddb2KNi14bPNPjPZJKg.review_text: If I remember correctly, the girls name was Gisselle and let me tell you, she was the definition of great customer service.  She was the only girl and I couldn't help but notice that all the men employees around her were either on their cell phones, or doing something completely irrelevant to work. When Gisselle asked one of the boys to get an order from the back for her, he completely ignored her and brushed her off. And they rest standing around him didnt help out either. Very rude.   At the time I was there and I'm sure it gets worse, there were plenty of "creepy" and very strange people in the area. As well as some other inconsiderate employees. Seems to me that regardless of the jerks she has to put up with she still continues trying to multitask and is very polite as well as actually maintaining great customer service.  Ive walked in a few times and she is the one and only person I can ever get takeout from because unlike anyone else, she actually tries to suggest various things that would fit what I'm craving at the moment. She is of great help to the customers and such a joy to see when you walk in. Plus her eyeliner and makeup is always perfect and well done.    Overall I think she provides the best customer satisfaction and she is always focused on her work and doing what she is supposed to be doing. Extremely hard worker with an outstanding personality. 5 stars to Gisselle!

pQMbjcDfr7A1aKtU_ls00w.review_text: Many drunken nights have ended up here with a nice plate of grilled cheese, fries, and a strawberry milkshake in front of me.  It's all good... until I wake up... and really feel like $hit.   Why oh why do you have to be so drunkenly good only for me to wake up feeling like a big giant grease ball.  ps. You have also contributed to many weird weird dreams. And when I say weird...I mean fun.

CfV_axQI2rK0eHB9FfG_GQ.review_text: Bland food. Overpriced, have to pay for fries separately? Seriously? Shitty service, even during the day with minimal tables.  Only good thing was the milkshakes, but come on, its f*cking milkshake! Not even good for 24 hour dinner food. Uck. Avoid this place.

mvZnbQ9XcMcBMCTASry-Aw.review_text: Ahhhh, good old Sparky's.  This is where I always dine after a show in the city.  I have a love/hate relationship with this place.  The hate comes from the fact that most of the food is only so-so, that it's quite pricey and to top it off, most of the wait staff are complete douches who lack personality.  The love part, though, stems from the fact that their cheese items are quite delicious and reasonably priced.  Their mac 'n cheese varies from month to month and is a hit or miss, usually a hit though, especially for the price.  Last I checked, they were making it spicy with some sort of jalapeno flavor in it.  Their cheese fries and grilled cheese, however, have stayed consistently delicious over the years.  Mmmmm, cheese galore!  This is also one of the many places in the Castro area where you can find a group of 50-60 somethin' year old leather daddies dining at 3 AM in leather chaps with leather thongs complete with studded leather bondage harnesses and matching leather berets.  Beer gut hanging out and all.  Rubbing their bare asses all over the booths.  Ah, it's always good times at Sparky's!

-YhyHROsNY5p-B5vdCp1tA.review_text: I'm not drunk or high enough to deal with these people.   I came in here with 5 of my coworkers for lunch, and although the grubby little diner was fairly empty we had to seat and grab the sticky menus for ourselves. no big deal.   We're a fairly indecisive bunch, so it took a while for all of us to decide what to order. After all that time, however, we noticed that not once had the waitress attempted to take our order or check up on us. She spent all her time running to the kitchen (even though no one in the restaurant had their food), or looking preplexed in front of the cashier machine.   We finally flagged her down just to take our order, but instead of coming over and spending one minute writing down our order she turned around and stared.  "I'm really busy right now."   I'm sorry, I didn't realized I'd distracted you from your highly important kitchen wandering. I should have considered how difficult it must be to put down five orders. My bad.   Maybe they should hire people who can function in the daylight.

hFdA22K2we44wAypRF2kYw.review_text: I have a special place in my heart for Sparky's. They've always done a GREAT job of satisfying my late night hunger and my wallet.   Out of all the Diners that i've been to in san francisco, Sparky's is numero uno!!    ....Why?  -delcious food (from vegan to regular diner food) -CHEAP beer! (good for a pre bar drink) -awesome juke box selection  -good pricing  but one bad thing....   WHO EVER decided to remodel Sparky's was a mistake. Any one would agree with me that it looked WAAY better before!!!

C3bKmm6yQNYlxojqSAPzWg.review_text: Ok, so I used to eat here a lot but I haven't in a while. However, I ordered from them last night and was not happy. My friend ordered the deluxe nachos, he got sick from the meat, literally. I ordered disco fries, biscuits and gravy, and hash browns. The disco fries were made differently then before and I couldn't eat them, the biscuits and gravy had onions in the white gravy (weird, couldn't eat them either due to allergies with onions), and the hash browns had onions and carrots in them but I asked for no onion and told them I am allergic but somehow everything I ordered contained onions and/or was made differently than usual. I called last night about the hash browns and they did refund my money for the hash browns, then I realized that everything I ordered had something wrong with it, I was really upset because I couldn't eat any of it due to my allergy (which sucks), I just took it as a loss.  However, I would eat here again, the place and their food has potential and could be really good. The only way I would try them again is if they made this order right.

vpsk8SYhS7d3DtuocD9yRQ.review_text: To eat at Sparky's is just what I expect.  I used to be a short-order cook in a diner back east, so I know the drill front and back.  But I fucking hate this place with a hot passion, even 2 years after having the worst delivery experience in my life. I mean what the fucking fuck?  If you aren't willing to deliver good food, and follow standard fucking delivery practices, then Don't. Fucking. Deliver.  You hear me, Mr. and/or Mrs. Sparky???  Don't fucking do it. I ordered from them off Eat24Hour.com (san-francisco.eat24hours…).  I submitted a debit card payment, and the driver would not take anything but a CA ID card to verify. Even though I had my picture on my debit card, and showed him my motherfucking passport to boot! And this is after being 30 minutes late. [Protip - diner food does NOT age well.  It should be eaten as soon as it's cooked.  Requires FAST deliver, and not this bullshit]. So they went away with rancid food because the asshole driver wouldn't take my card. THEN THEY REFUSED TO REFUND MY DEBIT CARD.  THEY WOULDN'T TAKE MY FUCKING ID, BUT THEY CHARGED MY CARD NONETHELESS.  WHAT FUCKING RAFT OF ASSHOLES DOES THIS SHIT!!!?!   I'll tell you who.  Assholes.  No food, less in my bank, and a lifelong grudge.  Dickheads! Fuck you Sparky's.  You are one of only a few legit diner experiences in San Francisco, and you fucked yourself right off my list.  Go to hell.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: "Woah, there Sparky," is a phrase my friend Megan often says to me when she thinks I'm out of line. I hate it. The name Sparky just really gets under my skin and she knows it - which is why she enjoys saying it to me all the time!  After having dined at Sparky's for the first time on Friday night, though, I'm starting to soften on good ol' Sparky. Maybe it was the huge booth that seated 6 of us, or the doughy pizza's that soaked up happy hours sloshing around in our tums, or maybe it was how quickly they brought it all to out. Whatever it was, I might...MIGHT... be okay with the name Sparky now.    I might be even more okay with it when I come back at 3AM after an even longer night of drinking. Hell, I might even love it.

XJnK5R63Fq2KIb8KaJEfIA.review_text: I ordered takeout from here this weekend, it wasnt the best and wasnt the worst. Delivery kinda took a while, everything was overcooked on  top of obviously frozen foods.

YLDNjOu7t31HBCjPsg4EMw.review_text: You know, I really wanted to give them some credit. Last time I went, it was brightly lit, service and food was great...this time the host sat us down, brought us water, adjusted our menu's (seriously??) and never returned.  I mean it, we sat there for a good 10-15 minutes, the waiter walked by us twice and never once looked in our direction. They "thanked" us as we left, but that doesn't make up for a damn thing.  Will never go back, and make sure anyone I know doesn't either.

8nWeL26IEhG3x_SGywhJgQ.review_text: I love you guys! Great late night delivery service. you guys rock and I know your job is tough, because you are serving about a million drunks. Keep up the good work! BTW everyone, stick to the basics for this greasy spoon -- the more diner-like the menu item, the better it will be. PASTA, BREAKFAST, BURGERS.

T6IT8bL--h0HTmmcef6lBg.review_text: "We probably have the LEAST picky customers on earth!" - Breaking Bad  Let's break down the Sparky's situation. I've never been there during the day and I bet no one else has either. However, at 5 am, when your stomach is literally burning and your dignity has been left at some bar on the other side of town, Sparky's is the place to stop on the way home. As I'm usually the Designated Driver, I take my carload here to sober them up and stuff them with food. Their food is the kind of food you eat in a pinch when you're on the highway, running from the law, with a bag of clothes, a dream and a guitar... wait, I digress. Wind on your back... no, seriously, Sparky's, San Francisco, and I'm back...  Anyway, food = meh. But, there is a wide variety of meh food, and seeing as you or your carload of people WILL be drunk when you go there - not a problem.   The service varies, probably depending on how many annoying people they've had to deal with that night. (hint: if you're a sober person who makes their lives easier, the service gets better.)  Here's what RULES about Sparky's:  - Your carload of 30-something friends currently acting 4 1/2 will be tolerated at this establishment.   - From my experience Sparky's appears to be clothing-optional.   - The food comes on large plates for slightly high prices, but again - drunk people are not picky.  - Various folk tell me their milkshakes are quite good.  - They serve espresso drinks all night! YES - this is for me, the DD and wrangler of a carload of fools.   - They have a lot of tables and they move them quickly.   - They have a jukebox with a variety of musical styles. Usually, if you are the DD, you can hear your own music because the rest of the place is too drunk to figure out where the music is coming from.   - They actually deliver to a small area -- even espresso. Did I mention espresso? Because I like espresso. Just sayin'.. espresso. However, if you do order delivery - you should be drunk when consuming the food.  Warning: Their bathrooms are disgusting with frequent clogs of the undefined type.

Mlx7ZLwbhzjU7RmRVs4ngg.review_text: Me and a friend randomly searched for a 24 hour diner in my GPS at around 1am on a Tuesday night, and this was the first place to pop up. Kinda surprised to find ourselves in the Castro District, but hey no problem there.  It's kind of creepy walking into the place though. Before we even got into this place, we got scared by this creepy looking mummified doll staring at us from the kitchen window. Then when we walk in, we get greeted by both another creepy looking doll, this one presumably of Sparky, and a surly looking waitress that did nothing that night except sit in the corner. If we weren't starving we woulda been gone, but we needed some food.  The food here was pretty good though. More than made up for the creepy intro. Me and my friend definitely got what we paid for. I ordered 2 pork chops, 2 eggs, and 2 pancakes. My friend ordered the Philly Cheese Steak sandwich. Oh man, the pork chops were not what I was expecting. I was expecting just some plain pork chops, but the ones I got were covered in gravy. It was delicious. It got a little salty after awhile but man it was so good. The pancakes were perfect also. I've been so used to eating the sub-par flat pancakes from places like IHop and Dennys that I forgot how real pancakes tasted like. One pancake here was about as thick as two pancakes at any of those chain diners. Super fluffy also. It had the texture of a memory foam mattress. Seriously, I pressed my fork down on it, and it sprang back up just like foam. I bet if they stacked a few of these pancakes up, I'd have the most delicious pillow ever. They were a thing of beauty. My friend said that his Philly Cheese Steak was good, but the Mac and Cheese he got along with it was bad. I tried it to make sure it wasn't just his taste buds, and yeah it was bad. No flavor at all. Kind of sad.  This was a pretty cool place though. It's nice knowing that there's good 24 hour food places open in the city. Gonna be heading here after those late nights of shenanigans in the city.

WCPqHaizXMUw9J8yx8YY-w.review_text: If only I could give this shit hole a negative rating... It's too bad that in San Francisco we are faced with the lesser of two evils when it comes to 24-hour food places. The best part of this review is that it won't matter for Sparky's because when it comes down to it, they still get their business.  That being said, for folks that care: the service is terrible, the food is less than mediocre, take out time is absolute crap, and they couldn't care less if you showed up.  Long story short, Sparky's is reason alone to leave this nine-to-five town.

zH_MaYBOFARFfGC_7DTa_A.review_text: The worst place ever. My roomate and I have given it a few tries because its always open and delivers to us. EVERY ORDER IVE EVER PLACED IS WRONG. They give me things i never ordered but forget other things. Food is soggy and cold. Absolutely nothing is good about this place.

wkwQ6iaqK8_tMNA_CXgowg.review_text: The food is expensive, the portions are tiny, and the taste is abysmal. Everyone hated their food and we were disapointed in the service. The only benefit of this place is the 24 hour service and $1.50 pint beer at happy hour. Please, stay away.

n-eYeIpSTiKhoDeubO1mmA.review_text: The Case of the Half Eaten Burger   It was a windy night. The wind so strong, it could peel the paint off a railroad apartment, making the bottom of my trench coat flap like so many middle aged housewives' upper arms.   I was on Church Street, and I crossed the street car tracks to find refuge in a diner. The food looked warm, the wait staff cold, and young bucks coming down from whatever drunken debauchery looked comfortable in their booths. I wanted that comfort.   I walked in, largely ignored, and figured I'd find a seat myself. If there's anything I've learned in six years back in the Fog, it's that if you want anything, you have to grab it yourself.   And there I saw her, blonde hair parted to one side as if she had something to hide, huddled in a booth like she was up to no good. Of course she was up to no good, what dame isn't?   I threw my coat in the booth and removed my scarf like it was a five-pound wool necktie. This was my seat, and I was taking it.   Of all the burger joints in all the predominantly gay neighborhoods in this city, you pick this one? And this booth?   This one's closer. It's open 24 hours. And they have shakes, I lied. I'd seen this skirt's gams from the window outside, beckoning me in like a pair of flesh-colored, homewrecking lures, and I was a trout looking for a bite.   She looked at me sideways, like I couldn't be trusted. But these days, who can you trust in this town? Not the broads. Definitely not the coppers. Not even your friends. And no one would trust a hard-boiled fella like me, swarthy and ripe as a pile of dog crap at the end of a fishing pier on a sunny day. So I wasn't surprised.   I'll have the Superb Burger, she told the curt waitress, pierced up and full of holes like a piece of Swiss cheese at the end of a shooting range.   The Superb Burger's a real piece of work. Known affiliates: Bacon. Cheese. Avocado. A legendary trio in these parts, and any dame who's in with them, is in with me. I let down my guard and trusted her.   We gnawed on our burgers, not so superb even with the Holy Trinity working for them, and the conversation flowed like some gargantuan river in a balmy South American rainforest - steady in parts, choppy in others, deep and shallow. And the Swiss cheese waitress was kind enough never to interrupt our gabber. Either that or she'd just plain forgotten about us, which suited me just fine.   All the while the grooves were being shimmied out of the best diner jukebox this town's ever seen; a music machine to rival some of the better gin joints out there, with grooves even the most hardened barfly would raise his tumbler of whiskey to.   The shakes were pretty respectable, too. After shaking down Swiss Cheese and gumshoeing the plastic-coated menu, I found out they were supplied by a guy named Mitchell, apparently well known around these parts for his frozen moo juice. I'd have to pay this Mitchell a visit one of these nights, and sleuth just what he puts into his wares to make everyone so crazy for them, like they've been sucking on a peace pipe full of loco weed.   Between the good grooves and the good gab with Blondie, I almost forgot there was even a mystery here. Leave it to a well-stocked jukebox and a well-stacked dame to get in the way of a good story. It'll happen every time.   By the wee hours of the night, the time when the freaks come out and good people lay to rest, I sent the skirt off in a cab - she was good people, after all.   I walked back to my pad through the wind and the darkness of yet another night in Fog City, and I wondered what the hell the mystery of this story would be. Then it hit me   How bad does a bacon and avocado cheeseburger have to be for me not to eat the whole thing?

LMfwB3x1rwpJrh-kfC5h0g.review_text: Sparky's has been there for me several times for late night dates and emergency hamburgers at midnight, but they are really overpriced for what they served.  I would not recommend the hamburgers as they are bland and almost $10 with fries.  Salads on the other hand are decent.  The pie is store bought, when it says "handmade"  on the menu (I saw him take it out of the box)  The slice I had was small, very disappointing, and a little stale.  The atmosphere isn't great either.  It's tolerable when techno isn't programmed to play automatically on the jukebox. However, it is one of the only semi-decent places to go late at night, other than the taquerias, and that is why I will give Sparky's 3 stars instead of two.

3HHLpfU7q4HoREEOXtt7pw.review_text: The handful of times I've been to Sparky's, it was after 2 a.m. and I was drunk and need something to soak up all the drinks I had.  Sparky's is open 24 hours so there are always people in there but I've never seen it so busy as when the bars/clubs close up shop. Everyone has one thing on their mind: FOOD.   I've tried a few things, but my go-to order is grilled cheese sandwich with a side of curly fries and all under ~$10! The food is overall pretty average and I don't know about you, but quality is not the first thing on my mind when it comes to my food at 2 a.m. The food is good for a place that's open 24 hours a day.  Service is also pretty average, but what do you expect from a place that's open all day/night? The food comes out pretty fast, I think our whole order came out within 15 minutes and we had a sandwich w/fries, grilled cheese w/curly fries, and a breakfast plate.  Sparky's is a good spot to grab food late night; it's open 24 hours and it's pretty cheap, you can't go wrong with that.

QVDJPwfVQULuJaTkZeqr3w.review_text: This is just an FYI for Sparky's customers:  Although Sparky's menus, flyers and website state that they're using Mitchell's Ice Cream for their desserts, they haven't purchased ice cream from our company in about two years.  We have written to them and called them requesting that they remove our name from all of their advertising, but as of this date, they have ignored us.

XHuNSjrPA3Vyi7n4iVhZaQ.review_text: Very Important Edit, 2007:  Those three stars are extremely generous as the food here is greasy, overpriced and not good. But, it's 2:30am, so they've got you trapped and you ain't got shit else to go. So, in Sparky's, we (drunkenly) trust. Also, if you've lived in this city for any substantial amount of time, you WILL run into someone you know here, whether you want to see them or not. Lucky for you, they will be mashed and what could have been potentially awkward ends up being somewhat pleasant.

5V1azKNKRbnmxu2bXDy95g.review_text: For late night food, there is no place better.  They have a huge menu including lots of milkshakes.  And they use Mitchell's ice cream.  I'm a huge fan of the homemade gravy, esp. when used for dipping cheese fries.  Jersey folk call that "disco fries".  Hell yea.  The real clincher, tho, is that they deliver from 11pm until 4am.  Which is a godsend if you hate Mr. Pizza Man but want to get your grub on late without driving or schlepping anywhere.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: I remember the first time I came to Sparky's........well, actually, I don't remember. It was shortly after college. We still acted like we were in college. I was drunk. Really drunk. My friends who lived in San Francisco knew of a greasy spoon that served 24/7. Food that allegedly minimized hangovers. I probably had a turkey burger or something. I also probably passed out while eating it.  Regardless, it did not prevent a hangover.  Fast forward a few years, I'm back at Sparky's. Very sober and anxious to try things that were not on my radar the first go around, namely the house veggie burger and parfait. Both were very good, reasonably priced, and in the case of the parfait, literally bursting with granola.  This all makes me wonder, if booze one day has me back at Sparky's in the middle of the night, will a parfait prevent a hangover?

JgPUVaNG4vArVLVO7uR9nw.review_text: Sparky's...you are wasting money staying open 24 hours because your sales will never amount to much considering how shitty your service is and how disgusting your food is.  My friends and I were starving after catching a movie at the Roxie and walked past Sparky's. Being in the mood for greasy, diner food we figured we hit the jackpot. Man, were we mistaken. I think starving would have been more fulfilling than the meal we received here.  First, we were seated in an inconspicuous area with little attention given to us until way later. Our waiter was...an imbecile. I don't even know how I could sugar coat it. One of my friends is a Belgian waffle fiend and ordered it, while my other friend and I decided on TWO-yes TWO orders of fries (I will explain the emphasis on TWO later).  We sat there impatiently waiting for our food to arrive since we were 3 of about 5 people in the restaurant (the other table was already chomping away). After several minutes, our waiter comes out with ONE plate of fries, but no Belgian waffle. Where is my dear friend's Belgian waffle? WHOOPS, imbecile waiter forgot to mention they ran out. Gee, thanks for the head's up! So she ordered something else that of course did not satisfy her. Then I asked him where our other plate of fries were. His reply: "Oh wait you wanted 2 orders?" ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!  Needless to say, the experience at Sparky's was terrible-we wasted our time and money for horrible food and even worse service.

sFdDdpCBMi9P3o9uogrJsw.review_text: I've only ever been here at 2 or 3am just before the sun begins to rise over the city and I'm deciding weather or not to throw up on the street corner or have a snack before heading home from the bar. I can't imagine eating here during the day...sober. Its one of those places thats great for what it is. A 24-hour diner thats open when nothing else in the area is. I've had some great memories of this place but the food itself is just mediocre, as the food at most diner style establishments usually is! Its all about the atmosphere, location and friendly 24-hour service.

Ppm_nqivtMfP4eFIvOm19A.review_text: 4 stars mainly for the sheer magnitude of the menu, and the 24hr status of the place.  Both sides are covered in items full of greasy goodness that sound absolutely perfect when you're wasted.  I'm looking forward to trying their BLT w/avocado (which I heard was on there from listening to the table with the random chick who hit on me later - a pleasant first for me, and she was cute too, even if I don't swing that way).  I got the eggs and hashbrowns - eggs were fine, but due to the shredded carrots(!) I didn't care for the hashbrowns so much (this almost inspired a rant about how carrots have no place in hashbrowns, but since I was too drunk to notice until I was nearly done I won't go there right now).   If I do breakfast food there again, I'll see what the other potato options are, or ask if they can make them without carrots.

LI969E9Vrqvx4ls_bKo4kw.review_text: Food: Ok, Customer Service: HORRIBLE, delivery: ATROCIOUS!!! So I've been into Sparky's before and while their food is rather good (especially for late night eats), their employees are constantly bitter, mean, and rude. Had almost THE worse delivery experience of my life and felt I had to share. I ordered food from their online delivery service provider (Eat24Hours.com). They warned me it would take 60-90 minutes for delivery, which is long but I was willing to wait. The food arrived after about 80 minutes, and the delivery guy rang my doorbell 3 times within the 1 minute it took me to get the door. He handed me the food and walked away. I got inside, opened the bag, and much to dismay my Two Eggs any Style was without its advertised toast, and my salad was delivered with their not-good-tasting balsamic vinaigrette, despite my explicit request for Ranch. I contacted Sparky's to tell them about the mistake. They put me on hold for 4 minutes, came back to say that their delivery guys were out and it'd be about 30 minutes until they could redeliver me my toast and salad dressing. They suggested 3 times that I just ask for a refund of the toast and salad dressing (for like $2 back). I told them I wanted the delivery and requested they deliver my missing ingredients before they went and delivered other people's food. Fast forward 1 hour. I contact Eat24Hours.com requesting that they deal with Sparky. The representative informed me that Sparky had a shift change and "lost" my redelivery form. I then had to wait another 30 minutes for them to deliver me my salad dressing and toast. Total delivery time: 3 hours !!! For a freaking salad and eggs meal. And of course when the toast arrived it was cold and soggy. I wish that I had ordered food from somewhere closer and more reliable. I'd only suggest this place if it is late and NO WHERE ELSE IS OPEN!! That is the only time it seems worth the wait/crappy service. I will say that Eat24Hours.com was extremely helpful through this irritating ordeal, and they even refunded me the cost for the salad (not Sparky's). Good to know some companies still care about customer service.

jMV_J2YwgBtiYZu3OCl4Ow.review_text: I've been going to Sparky's for the last five or so years. As a transplanted NYer, I love nothing more than a good diner.   The people working there are perfectly nice and totally competent. It's always clean, they're always willing to open up the back section or let you sit in a different spot, and my food always comes out perfectly.   Once I went in when I was having a really bad day, and the waiter offered me a refill of my drink on the house.

PJPAdYfNIzvhwDrNgofl_w.review_text: I used to get sparky,s 2 or 3 times a week but the last few times has not been so good. After my last experience I will never order from them again. I wanted to resolve this with a manager who I asked to call me back twice and they never did. I would like to add a pic of what they sent me as food so you could  see for yourself why I wanted the manager to call me. It's a health and safety issue. I had ordered eggs Benedict and at first glance it looked like scrambled eggs on the top. It was a dry curdled yellow flakey substance piled on the top sent to me as hollandaise sauce. I can't believe someone in the kitchen put this out. There is no way that they wouldn't know that it was rancid. Sauce especially since it was dry flakey scooped on goop. I feel the way they have handled the situation is the same way they handle your food. Beware.

mZ3PIY2nsnQuwRvw2rEGPg.review_text: After Cockblock last night, my friends and I drove to Orphan Andy's...not quite sure why because I don't think any of us were hungry, but it just seemed like the right thing to do. Upon seeing the line outside, my friend said there was no way we were waiting and that she knew another place close by. "Close by" proved to be quite the trek...I basically walked 5 ft behind her and whined "are we there yeetttt?" the whole way.   Even though it was super crowded in Sparky's, we were seated right away. I love when restaurants put the word "vegan" with the title of an entree...it makes my life a lot easier...especially when it's 3 AM and I'm drunk and vaguely know where I am. I ordered the vegan burger and fries, as did another one of my friends, and it was AMAZING. I'm sure it tasted 10x better because it was 3AM and I was drunk, but that wouldn't stop me from ordering it again while sober.  The walk back to the car was HELL.

tx407EtvKoXXEZqYQFQVJA.review_text: Yeah, this place is Mel's for Hipsters.  So?  Personally, I don't mind hipsters, and if they can cook a fuckin' cheeseburger, neither should you. It's pretty good, it's fairly priced, they DELIVER, and the menu is huge.  I personally thing Bagdad is better, but if I'm even slightly closer to Sparky's, I'll go there.  For drunk food, it's great. During non-drunk hours, Sparky's is still pretty good.  I've been there at all varying levels of sobriety and never had an issue with the place.  And it's a helluva lot better than the Crepevine. Delivery is nothing special, aside from the fact that it exists.  But that's mighty nice when me and the roommates can't make the grueling one-and-a-half block trek ourselves. sanfrancisco.menupages.c…

mlpEK2e0hr3EmZxKN2WTYA.review_text: Worst service ever! Sat there for about 10 mins n didn't even ask for a drink order.........and the waitress just walked by and didn't even look at us to go back n sit with other customers n talk, and the host was the most unsocial person ever! Never going back there again!

FT9ZVtxEj5tje6RMzeqPJg.review_text: Understand that if I give Sparky's a 3-star rating that 3rd star is largely sentimental and based as much on past experience as it is on potential. I was here between 3am-4am on January 17, 2014 for the first time in years and a good deal had changed and not all of it for the better.   Positives: Nice new laminate floors would give a clean appearance if the lights weren't down so low (might've been a kindness at this time of the morning?). Also, the kitchen, which can be seen but not walked though (thanks!) on the way to the restrooms, was notably and surprisingly the cleanest restaurant I saw on a weeklong stay in the Bay Area.   Negatives: The egg florentine was so laden with feta I could barely make it through and the hash browns...I have no idea what was going on with the hash browns.   It's a diner and given its location is one of the best people-watching experiences I've got on my list of SF diners and dives (and that's some steep competition).

H5etmQbifze8ZAf77l3roQ.review_text: Sparky's day is long past.  It's a ghost town now, usually only with one staffer.  The food is really just underwhelming - diner food doesn't have to be great but this was just boring.  Indifferent attention from the only waiter despite the fact that we were one of only three tables there.  Next time we are on Church we'll go to the crepe place next door, which clearly is packed for a reason.  The 1990's never seemed so long ago as they did today.

_hZwPA_olEGNrh_q_BTXlA.review_text: When I first discovered this place, I had just moved to SF for college.  My native boy-friend took me here once and I was in love-- a 24 hour diner with a jukebox, neon signs and a ridiculously large and greasy menu?  Sign me up!  And it WAS great... for awhile.  Like, when you've danced your ass off at The Cafe and need some drunken munchies.  In fact, that might be the only time Sparky's is good, because every OTHER time I've eaten there, I've ended up with that gassy, greasy regret that comes with ordering cheese fries and chocolate shakes.  Don't ever order delivery-- both times I've done it, the food has come completely cold and soggy (I live maybe 20 blocks away).  I'll always love this place in my heart, but there are definitely other better diners.

5JvWxMBSBhEIyDcP1pdOKg.review_text: I would've e-mailed an owner directly rather than leave a review, but their website offers no e-mails for questions, concerns, etc... Wonder why? Maybe there's not enough time in the day to read the complaints. I ordered a Heartstopper burger last night for delivery because the picture looked good. I didn't know you could mess up on a burger so much. It was barely edible, but I was starving so I was eating it. After a few bites, I saw a hair under the burger. I have super long hair and the hair was brown and only about 6 inches, so definitely not my own. I gave them benefit of the doubt and hoped maybe it just floated in from somewhere in the kitchen and they hadn't noticed. Nonetheless, I decided I wouldn't eat any more of it, but decided to inspect further. It took me about 5 seconds to find another hair. It was the same color and length of the other one and when I pulled on it, half of it was cooked into the burger, so it most definitely from someone in the kitchen staff. THOROUGHLY DISGUSTED. I'll never ever be back or allow anyone I'm with to order from there.... terrible.

pcR_cDHqQip0RY11SVLxPg.review_text: The food is okay, average late night American grubs. But the wait is ridiculous. Or maybe that's just Halloween weekend? The service was terribly terribly slow. I'll probably take my business elsewhere.

-Vj7dr0-38zRV6wGlLOEbg.review_text: I've always enjoyed Sparky's food, and the times I've dined in the atmosphere is nice. The last two times I ordered from them, though, the driver was odd about cash. The first time I asked for $15 back in change and he just turned and walked to his car. I followed him thinking he was grabbing change and he was surprised I was there, but he ended up having it on him. Last night my total came to $24 and change and I only had two $20s. I handed it to him and asked for $10 back. He took the money, handed me the food, and said he didn't have change. I asked him to repeat it and he said "No change." I ordered through GrubHub specifying cash as the payment option, why would he not have change? Never had this problem with any other delivery restaurant anywhere I've ever lived, and I won't be ordering here from home again.

5Tc0YXgYDvTTlps0e8xTNg.review_text: Apparently I am one of the very few who have never eaten at Sparky's after or in the near proximity to 2am.   In fact, I ate at Sparky's for the FIRST TIME today!  At 2pm. I enjoyed my huevos rancheros and my best friend Natalie N. enjoyed her club sammie too.  Pleasant service, reasonably priced eats, extensive menu and GREAT tunes means I could see myself eating here again in the future. The drunken future.  Like maybe tonight/tomorrow morning.

-jvNk13xR2-M2kV3Ylyxbw.review_text: I like this place most of the time. :)  There burgers and fries here are very good (the curly fries are pretty delicious and not that greasy), and I've had nothing but good service each time I've come. The waiters/waitresses are friendly and funny, and super cute too.  The bathroom is pretty gross though, They should fix that. You can also see the kitchen on the way to the bathroom, which is kind of gross too. I once saw a baby cockroach scurry beneath my feet there.  They have pretty tasty shakes too, and their calzones are ginormous. Like a medium can feed 3-5 people, I bet a large can feed 5-7. Very tasty with ricotta. Yum!  I had breakfast food there once, the eggs became cold in a minute, and the hashbrowns were cold right away. The biscuits and gravy was interesting. The gravy was kind of sweet, but the biscuits were hard like hockey pucks. Kind of disappointing. So like I said...I like this place most of the time...

ZGBaby3K0ye7msmgut45AA.review_text: Eee.  Now I know why I ONLY come here at 4am and I'm shitfaced. I spent the last two nights here (in a row) SOBER. My god. I can't believe the shit that tastes good to me when my tastebuds are in a coma from well bourbon and girly shots. The food is definitely gross.  I ordered the Peanut Butter Cup, and it was all gritty/grainy from too much peanut butter.  You couldn't really taste the chocolate. Last night, I ordered the cheese fries and bacon.  Props for the extra crispy bacon.  Hell no for the cheese fries.  It's like, something smokey, like gouda?  I'm not sure.  But it was not tasty.  Also, I vaguely remember eating an omelette when hammered.  Even tossed, that was gross.  Word to the wise!  ONLY GO HERE WHEN COMPLETELY TANKED.  You will think this is the best food on earth.

2XZ-wSBRZDc_jqOtk1yY1w.review_text: HORRIBLE, horrible experience. My friend found used sugar packets in the bottom of his milkshake. When he alerted the waitress she was completely unapologetic. Then we spoke with the manager who was hostile and refused to take the milkshake off the bill. AWFUL. This place needs to have a HEALTH INSPECTION.

mIv8ytAcryKNyFoNSPZAig.review_text: Best jukebox I know of in San Francisco. Obscure hits from bygone years... Joy Division?  The veggie selections are excellent.  It's comfort food served in a comfortable, bizarre environment.  You won't know if you're in a diner or a truck stop crapper.  Cheese fries, fake meat done right, sodas, signature mixed drinks?  Anything less than 5 stars means extra time in purgatory, noobs.

FQWGEabA-GiyEBMcZOPGRw.review_text: My brother woke me up and asks, "Mom says she wants to go to some place called Sparkys? Do you know where thats at?" "I'm a yelper, of course I know where that's at!"  We went and ordered to-go. I got the eggs, hash-browns, and sausage. My parents and brother got omelets. I was a little surprised how my brother found parking literally in front of the place, and the place was almost empty. It was a sunny Saturday morning around 9:30am! Hmm, how odd.  Overall everything was tasty! I will come back and try a dine-in sometime.

-66GkyHaPk9jMyGHd-QqQA.review_text: Pro:  The only place in this neighborhood that is open 24 hours.  Waiters always friendly.  Cons:  I've eaten here a few times over the years and it is always disgusting.  Was there last night and ordered corn beef hash.  What was I thinking?  It was clearly the canned crap you buy for a buck at Safeway.  Even the hash browns were the frozen stuff.  Yet, I was drunk enough that I actually at the stuff.  Avoid this place if you can.

Qv-qgZn8nO1Dfdt8DDQ8nA.review_text: Not a professional business.  Horrible food.  Just not a good experience overall.

vmOGlBA_RwN87G148qxKcg.review_text: Music is cool, but my friend and I got food poisoning from pancakes and coffee :(

58v49MNYAJXxzxNsJvsoKA.review_text: I like Sparky's.   Why?   Well because when I've been out all night partying, slightly tipsy, dancing my booty off and in need of serious re-fueling. This is the place. It's open 24 hours, the shakes are yum-tastic and it's just convienant. Ok ok the food is not that great...but!!! They have Veggie Options with is awesome since most 'diners' would be lacking in that department.  It's a chill place... and it's everything Rudy's Can't Fail in Emeryville strives to be...  It's a rockabilly, hipster, emo, mock 1950's joint... and I haven't had anything so bad I had to send it back. And I've never had bad service...although slow @ times but... it was crowded so it doesnt bug me. All in all I'm glad this place is here!

srSq6CKx38VuOXJC7UPDhA.review_text: I don't know why people are hating so much. This place is good. It's not gourmet. It's good diner food. I got cheesy curly fries, and huevos rancheros and my friend got a burger. The first two were delicious and the waitress did as I requested - serve the fries first.  I don't eat beef so don't know how the burger tasted but was told it was good. And. It was definitely HUGE.

0Sit4QNs4H84B74rPj1jOw.review_text: i don't know if it was cuz I was wasted or if it was 3 in da morning and I was friggen hungry, but YUM. I think I ate everything on the left side of the menu, and  didn't leave a crumb.    I started with a chocolate Malt, then had fettuccine alfredo with garlic bread and pizza.. oh and shared another 2 meals with someone else.. but this is when it gets fuzzy.. I think there was breakfast involved and perhaps some passing out

ZbOK_2m4kifew3lzTep1yQ.review_text: See, *I* never had a problem with the place. I was surrounded by good company, and time just flew by through the hour or so we were waiting there.   BUT! I was reminded of all these things, like:  -How our server came by like, twice--once to take the order, and another to drop it off an hour later. -How he never walked by the table so I couldn't ask for a second cup of coffee because my strep-infested friend drank from MY cup. (GOSH DAMMIT AARON!) -How the eggs weren't really that good, neither were the sausages,and the toast was soggy and gross.  -How the coffee was tasteless, anyways. And kind of burnt.   But I will say that the hashbrowns were awesome. The service + the rest of the food just minus-ed the stars down to one. One star for hashbrowns! Another invisible star for showing my friends that I can't do the New Yorker's crossword puzzle to save my life.

1vT-1gtksBsx14uKi7UsbQ.review_text: Home Restaurant is open until Midnite, every night of the week if you want to be classy.  Having a night that runs later than twelve, and you'll get at Sparky's, getting gassy.  Sparky's is what it is: a greasy, late-night eatery that is loud and rambunctious: it's the after-party for the drunks who want to get their fat-girl grub on. A glance at the menu while sober may induce a heart attack, but everything looks good (and tastes better) when inebriated.  The service is a bit slow and it seems like they could benefit by adding another person or two for the post-bar rush.   But here's a tip: drunk-dial Sparky's on your way out of the club and either pick it up, or have it delivered. That way, you and whoever you're taking home that night can enjoy curly fries and onion rings in bed before passing out. You won't regret it.

pE6wPN8JoIbelNkCDumNbA.review_text: I have avoided Sparky's for over a year despite hanging out a lot in the area.  Everyone told me the food was awful.  Well.  Finally ventured in for milkshakes late one night.... and they were pretty awesome.  I know why though: they use Mitchell's ice cream.  With that as a base, they really couldn't mess it up.  An additional star for the best damn happy hour in SF.  $1.50 pints 5-9 pm EVERYDAY!  And not pints of Bud or Miller either, but rather Newcastle, Sierra, and Pyramid Hef.  Dude.  That is cheaper than buying a six pack (pint &gt; bottle!)  *Aside: Yelp won't let me use the "is greater than" symbol, wtf?  Was reluctant to try their other food, but ordered a plate of wings to munch on.  They were actually good!!  Really good!!  Not your typical Buffalo sauce, but a very tasty blend of fresh onions, peppers, Tabasco, and lime.    I don't doubt that a lot of their food is bad or mediocre at best  -- because with a menu that ridiculously large, there is no way they can do it all well (steamed clams at a 24 hour diner?  seriously??)  But I have been very happy with what I have had so far.  And I intend to go back and stick to it.

ulIBsUJbmkgUUnFkg7zlUQ.review_text: Disgusting... As soon as you sit down  you feel dirty. I got the disco fries which were very tasty, but when I saw the amount of oil underneath them, I got disgusted.  I attached a picture along with my comment.  The people cooking obviously threw the fries along with their frying oil on my plate.  FRESH LEMONADE. .. MORE LIKE ARTIFICIAL POWDER.   I had all the powder sitting at the bottom of my cup..disgusting $2.25 for garbage.   My bf got a burger with hard over cooked old bacon and the had the nerve to charge .75 cent for extra bbq, which was totally necessary for that dry gross burger.  we had two fruit Flies flying around our heads and food the whole time...makes me wonder how the cooking area is..  On the good note... they had good music.  Don't eat here.....

KOJzjMYipgqj2W-FrdRQCg.review_text: It's pretty cut and dry. If you're extremely drunk, desperately hungry for just about anything, and don't mind being treated like shit, then by all means go here. Otherwise, just keep walking and get a burrito a few blocks over.  Your waiter will most likely be disappearing for 15 minutes at a time to do meth in the bathroom. The shakes are great, but come on, have you ever had a bad one at any point in your life?  Last night was the kicker. The cracked-out waiter was absolutely abusing the table next to ours.
