The poor couple had been there for over an hour and he was still refusing to take their order! What a douche.  Shitty does not even begin to describe it.

vAItpWX3R7H453l7kvWucA.review_text: I love this place, open late, great food, and my favorite waitress Betsy always serves me with a smile :)

qloXUglVQX73Ml5eJdB82Q.review_text: Talk about a place that used to be great and has now degenerated to being the home of complete d-bags.  I just got here for lunch--one of two customers in the restaurant.  Our server, "Reynaldo", first advises that "we don't serve pizza before 5pm" (never mind this isn't on the menu) and then (after I ordered) sneered "We only accept cash and our ATM machine is over there.")  When I mentioned that this was ridiculous, he loudly stated that I could "go somewhere else if I didn't like the way things were here". He then SLAMMED the soda down on my table and, when I pointed out that there was no reason for him to be rude, said "You were rude first."  Oh, best part is there is no manager in until 5pm.  While I was there some other poor slob was complaining because they had 2x charged his credit card (apparently, SOME people get to use debit and credit cards here) and of course, Renalydo told him to stuff it.

8Ces6YdT6j7BYycnZLrSng.review_text: Open 24 hours.  One of 3 American diners open late night along Market street - Bagdad Cafe (now closed), and Orphan Andy's.  I dined here a few times because Chow across the street, closes at midnight. The extensive diner menu now includes pizzas ($14-$24.75) and a delivery service, until 3:45am only. Good for neighborhood residents.  The huge variety of the menu is x4 larger, and burgers & salads prices are $1-3 less than Bagdad Cafe. Entrees are priced around $12, a few around $15. Since I don't live in this area I've never tried their delivery service or the pizza.

XluC1NPYrZdP1kYyN2x3Wg.review_text: I see from most of the posts that Spark'y has not gotten any better in 20 years. I am Sorry we tried it again tonight.  You'd think 20 yrs later...but no...  Back then the food was just average and there was this waiter with the worst attitude on the planet.  The food was always over priced and below average in taste.  It was a good night if you did not get "that waiter with attitude".  I lived nearby back then and even stopped going there back then.  Now the same ole' sh-t...Grade of an F for food taste.  Fettuccine Alfredo was something Hells Kitchen would have throw out and yelled at the chief about for hours but their not even in their caliber.  Honest to god; The Safeway brand Fettuccine Alfredo has better quality and taste.  I left most on the plate which was hard considering the plate and a coke was $14.05 .   The waiter was fine for 2/3 of the visit.  I had requested a split bill and got his acknowledgement but when it came it was one bill and he was not that busy.   I waited for him to return to let him know but he never came back so I assumed we pay at the register.  I went there to request a split bill and the cashier called over our waiter instead of simply splitting the check.  The waiter was still was nice but asked how I wanted it split as if he had forgotten the request.  I told him I wanted it split like I has requested and he did so w/o asking who had what--at least he knew that.  With just an ever so slight attitude he put my new bill on the table for me to pay and left--no thank you etc.    20 years later new staff though all the same nationality this time.  Likely family owned but again the same below average taste and a waiter with attitude.  How can that carry over from the previous owners and still be there 20 years later. Guess you cant beat a dead horse in this case.

IDH_oauSqwz0n3kFaDmM1g.review_text: Yummy milkshakes! Veg friendly! One time I got the 'My Body is a Temple' breakfast with scrambled egg whites, veggie sausage patty and fruit I think and it was SO good. Diner food can be hit or miss and it's always been a hit for me.  I've had the veggie burgers here too and enjoyed. Not the best I've ever had but still good!

hBfQPnxywB21TjDctpvICw.review_text: Maybe it's better in person, but I ordered a burger medium rare that arrived like a cold hockey puck, and cold fried. Bad customer service, bad food. Not worth it.

IhCAVnWWnwDjyrJyPpiBPg.review_text: Came in last night craving some breakfast, hoping they'd have biscuits & gravy...they did! Yay BUT instead I glanced over at the Sandwiches, the choice of mac n cheese caught my eye.  Chicken Club, three pieces of warm tender chicken, three layers, bacon, and lettuce/tomatoes.  Best i've had.  The King milkshake tastes like peanut butter wonderland with a slight drizzle of bananas.  Highly recommended.  Although, this place is a bit pricey our bill was around 40 for three plates and a shake, the food was very food.  Service could have been better, but our waiter was really nice all around it just took us a while to get our check and a box & I just hate waiting.

I3URSVRu24EaGWpvZB0cuA.review_text: ok, the thing about Sparkys that you have to remember: it is what it is.   its a 24 hour diner, on the edge of the castro, with slightly cracked out (though very loveable) wait staff, mediocre food (although some of their milkshakes are amazing), generally good music that most people go to at 2am after the clubs and thus it feels strange as hell to go to in the day.  have that in your head going in and you'll be fine.  it also was kind of my home away from home for a while. when i was up late writting a paper, suffering from insomnia, middle of the afternoon writting a paper, early morning needed food, whever, it was kind of my go to spot. i learned what i liked there and generally stuck to it.   yes, there are times when the service was beyond terrible. i had to send back food a few times. there was a waitress who, without fail, would forget something in every order.   but the peanut butter cup shake is freaking crack in a glass. and their curly fries are *always* amazing -with ranch and BBQ sauce please.   there was one time, when i was in college, my friend and i came in after a club and we had just enough money left to share some fries and a cup of soup. the waiter took pity and gave us the shake that we would have ordered plus some onion rings.that, ladied and gentlemen is love.

GFoPL0oIOZxyByRIXGZ6ng.review_text: This place gets 3 stars instead of 2 for one reason and one reason alone: they are open 24 hours. Though next time - if there is a next time - we come, we'll probably drive instead of taking the OWL bus. It was kind of creepy walking seven deserted blocks at 3 in the morning.  But we both agreed that the food tasted a little "off." My macaroni and cheese tasted more like pepper than like cheese and the slice of ham was pretty thin for the price, but salty and hammy like normal. The pancakes were just "meh" and the "maple syrup" I thought tasted like wood shavings - maple-flavored wood shavings.  Service was okay, though the place was incredibly loud despite the fact that there were only two other tables of people there. Not sure I thought this was worth the twenty bucks we paid, but whatevs. Again. 3 AM.

EsoGUze9fiRVrEWR31pKMw.review_text: Arrived here in the wee morning after some alcohol in the system.  Menu wasnt that appealing.  Typical burger, breakfast, and fries type of thing.  I ordered the chilli and it tasted a bit sour and cold.  I swear soup is suppose to be HOT, but it came out cold and our food took forever to arrive.  Took us less than 15 mins to eat and took the waitress overly too long for our bill.  So when the bill arrived we decided to take the bill to the front to speed up the process.  The front told us to give that to our waitress.... great another wait... bs!!!!!!  The service and the food is mediocre.  I wouldnt come here for a late night snack.  Better off at a cheaper place like denny's or something.  Or hell crepes a go go.  Shoulda went there instead.  Sparky's taste like cold left over food.  Not worth the money.  Did i mention service is horrible?

a9gIpre7NPS_CMqNxHU6lQ.review_text: damn... im really suprised to see even a few bad reviews. its my belief that sparky's is first class in the game of late night eating in san francisco, and its close proximity to the mission makes it really hard to beat. i like that the menu has all sorts of stuff at all hours of the day and the staff is generally pretty friendly. this place comes through so very clutch when i've completely blown it and not been able to make it to farolito in time (damn that place for closing at 3-4AM)   sparky's blows any place like ihop/denny's, the lucky penny and a handfull of other bullshit places out of the water. im sure that all these people complaining about their sparky's horror stories must have caught the place on a bad night, because i myself have left the place very satisfied many times over. if you live in this town long enough at some point you're gonna have to end up at sparky's

JSPE5bMOg6rAKvKVEdfIXw.review_text: Your milkshake brings all the drunks to the door...and I must say their pretty damn good.  I don't think the waiter liked our milkshake war - have two starving boys and one ravenous girl fight over two milkshakes with only two spoons and two straws. Hmm I taste malty danger. He was nice enough to bring us extra napkins, as well as a spoon and straw for me, but the messy table triggered a look of momentary horror.   I had some of my friend's medium well burger - which normally makes me cringe because I love my meet rare, but the double decker was insanely tasty and the creamy mac n' cheese reminiscient of Velveeta Cheese and Shells rocked my world.   At least I have one thing to be thankful to my ex for - for introducing me to means to getting fat and happy when late night part-aying!

sOhv5LHFsyf8t1JpgnocMQ.review_text: I would give this place 3.5 stars. My friend wanted to take me out to celebrate my birthday. We needed a late night snack. The menu is interesting with a lot of hamburgers and chicken sandwiches, as well as sides and shakes. We got a fried egg sandwich, which is something I can make at home. The bread was really buttery and burnt. We got a side of macaroni and cheese and some potato hash. With a diet coke, the total came to $15. This diner does not have the same experience as Mel's Diner, but it is a little cheaper. It also doesn't have any dessert offerings besides shakes, so if you are looking for a piece of pie or cheesecake, this is not your place...I wanted a piece of pie.

z73utYRpqXc7mrM_5xhTJA.review_text: Leaving Cafe Du Nord at 1:30am after a show and hungry??  Walk a few blocks and head to Sparky's. The food is what you'd expect from and all night diner and has all the usual suspect. I prefer the breakfast plates as nothing helps absorb all that alcohol better then a stack of pancakes.   The place is generally crowded even at 3am in the morning but generally the wait is not long if at all. The staff is always friendly even though they are busy. My one complaint would be that more then a few times I have used their bathrooms and I'm guessing the drunks that come in have problems hitting their target and it seems like nobody cleans them as often as they need to be cleaned. I'm guessing its just a late night thing.

EHFInBQVZphHQPwC4JZbHA.review_text: We should all be aware that three stars means A-OK.  (Too bad so many self-entitled people give 1 star for stupid reasons.)  Sparky's is great.  The food tastes decent and they are open all night.  I had biscuits and gravy which came with eggs and bacon. The bacon was thick, crispy and delicious.  the eggs were not overcooked.  The biscuits were fairly mediocre and absolutely tiny but the gravy was acceptable (possibly from a mix). The cheese fries, which I also had, were delicious and their cheese sauce was decadent (somehow a cross between nacho and fondue).    The service was absolutely excellent especially for 2 AM.   I would assume that on a busy weekend this place would be intolerably crowded. But on a Thursday night it was just perfect.  Also, I gotta say that their music playing was quite good.  I'll be back-- especially when everything else is closed.  (Ahem, Baghdad Café!?)

c4Zc_PbfijlSTM4y1tuydA.review_text: The food was yummy!  The plates had good-sized portions.  And, yes, our son absolutely LOVED the ORANGE DREAMSICLE milkshake!! And the waitstaff was friendly and funny.  Our server was cheerful and she was indeed courteous. And the music was definitely hip.  It was good to know that Sparky's had maintained the friendly and positive atmosphere after all these years.  Thanks for staying open!!!

MmW5Cyx_SrzmuLWjNwzZjQ.review_text: Ordered delivery from them last night and it NEVER came. No email, no call, nothing. Second time this has happened. Do not order from here if you actually want to get your food.

HXHVEg2a2QIkPcoIThGM6Q.review_text: I've been here only once. And I have a feeling that was the last time I'll be dining at that establishment.  So my friends and I were hungry and didn't know what to eat around the Castro area since most of the surrounding places were closed and lo and behold, a place that's 24 hours and it looks like a charming diner with a charming name. Lies and deceit! Anyway we get inside and we sat in a booth in an area of the diner that was oddly dim. I was craving waffles at the time so I was ecstatic to find that they had belgian waffles on the menu. Yipee. But once I got to order all dreams were dashed when the server said that they didn't have any waffles at that time. What the fuck? I don't see this place selling out of waffles or running out of batter. The guy next to me can order his pancakes but I can't get my waffles?! At the time I was upset and settled for a mocha milkshake instead to drown my sorrows in. My friends had 2 orders of fries and a milkshake as well. They ordered the Chai milkshake. It was tasty. I'll give them that.  The fries took unusually long to cook. The people next to us who had come in maybe 15 minutes after us already got their EXTRA LARGE pizza delivered to their table. What gives? Our server is nowhere to be found and the one time he comes around we flag him down and ask where the orders of fries were. He looks dumbfounded and says they'll be right up. The place wasn't busy by any means so it shouldn't of been a problem to get us 2 orders of plain french fries. A couple minutes later he comes with a plate with a hefty portion of fries. Is this supposed to be our 2 orders of fries combined into one? Whatever, the server was out of sight until we were done with our meal and ready to give us the check. We look over it and an order of waffles was on the receipt. Where were these delicious waffles? I did not see them. I did not taste them. Were they magical waffles? Or phantom waffles? Apparently I had to pay for these elusive waffles. So we get the server to change up the check, paid for our shit, and got out of there. Needless to say if we were desperate for some food around the Castro in the middle of the night, we'll probably just hit up Orphan Andy's instead.

wjprcTyR3_RvySm7OCHtQA.review_text: We ordered online for delivery last night.  I am still pretty disgusted by the whole experience the next day, so I am compelled to write a review. The best part of the experience was ordering online.  The software is really good.  Ordering was easy.   The prices seemed reasonable.    Then we waited for delivery.    There is a statement that the order will take around 20mins to prepare and 45-60 mins to deliver.  I hoped that my food would not be sitting in a box for up to an hour.  I hoped in vain.  It took an hour and 10 mins for the food to arrive.   We were all VERY hungry and ate what arrived, even though it was luke warm, we ate it anyway.    The burger wasn't cooked properly.  Nor did it come with the things asked for.    The garlic cheese bread was cold and seemed to be re-solidified cheese with whole chunks of garlic in it.    The $12 steak sandwich was slightly smaller in size than my smart phone.  The tomato slices for it were inedible.  They were clearly not cored before cutting and were mostly stem.  And they were limp and grainy.  Onion had seen better days too.   The BBQ chicken ordered was so bad the guy eating it told me, if he wasn't so hungry he wouldn't have been able to eat his.  Indigestion followed.  When I posted about it on my Facebook wall a thread began of locals and former visitors about how really bad the place has been in recent years.  I wish I had posted before we ordered and wasted money and time.   I have no idea how this place has reviews here with any more than one star.  As this was shockingly bad. Even for diner food.

K9HrpqaxNjB-FpQxJ5v6ew.review_text: I would feel more rightful in giving a one star rating had I actually had the privilege of trying Sparky's food, which I did not, since my friends and I got up and left after waiting 45 minutes for some chili cheese fries and a salad.   It was indeed 2am--most likely a busy time for such an establishment--but was notably a Thursday night rather than a Friday or Saturday. Mis amigos and I were not rowdy or particularly drunk. We ordered fairly simple items. One friend did, however, take all of the sugar packets off the table in bitter protest after the nearby tables that had arrived after us got their orders first.   I'm going with 2 stars in hopes that this was a rare occurrence rather than the rule, but just barely, since a more appropriate response to your patrons leaving disappointed would be something along the lines of "sorry guys" rather than "peace out!"

jkiinjUy8RUZKzW5gBpXNg.review_text: "Suck" is a word I don't use loosely, and I'm conservative in my use of the caps lock, but I just need to start by telling you that last night, SPARKY'S ABSOLUTELY SUCKED.  The place wasn't even half full, and still our food took over an hour to arrive, while other tables got up and left unfed.  We compromised on waiting five more minutes before walking out, and 30 seconds short of the deadline, our food arrived without apology.   In fact, our server never spoke to us between taking our order and delivering our food, never checked in on us during the hour we waited, never gave us any indication that our food would take a while or when we could expect it.  Once he delivered our plates, he never stopped by to refill water and coffee or ask how our meal was.  When we flagged him for the check, he dropped it wordlessly, not even thanking us for our patronage.    A slow kitchen and egregiously bad service (yes I'm talking to you, Mr. It's-Hipster-Not-Flock-Of-Seagulls-Because-I-­Shave-Around-The-Sides-Of-My-Head) are forgivable, but the food was offensively lousy as well.  The mac and cheese is described as having a "creamy aged cheddar sauce," but tasted like it came from a box, and not the tasty Annie's; we're talking store-brand Kraft knock-off.  The sausage and eggs were lousy and the toast was soggy and limp.   I'll never go back to this place and warn everyone I know to stay clear.

T81dEo4yH-O9JUQ71-Dgpw.review_text: Expensive cafeteria food, good for when your drunk and want to satisfy your hunger. Don't order for breakfast or lunch  when you're sober and can actually taste the food. Come on guys put some love and effort to your product.

JIm-e5q15prsTz_505cvSQ.review_text: No matter what, the staff won't care.  You could be throwing utensils at your buddies, you can be dancing on the tables, you can be trying to stab each other with any sharp-edged objects on your table; you can be throwing shit everywhere; you can make small pyramids of salt on your table in an attempt to rebuild a mini replica of the age of the Pharoahs (all things I have seen here); but if you are somehow short on the bill...the staff will be on you faster than Anna Nicole reaching for her painkillers.   The food is good; but chances are that your late night hunger is relating to the flavor factor exponentially.  I'm sure that there's someone out there that has muttered the words; "This is the best ______ EVER!", at Sparky's sometime in the early morning hours.  It's a great place to get a tasty omelette before going to bed; and before it sits in your stomach like a brick...taunting your late-night impulsive decision.  The service here...it can be questionable.  However, I do give them a lot of credit.  Not because they are surprisingly cheerful.  Not because they are exceedingly expedient in getting your orders.  But rather for their nonchalant attitude no matter what you throw at them.  I must admit that I have made it my personal mission to get them to get me a beer after last call.  So far, no success.    Not the best diner I've ever been to, but the decent place to get late night snacks.

VfkA4OlerlF2LRq_m3ql5Q.review_text: sparkys.  so after a night of non-stop dancing guzzeling down drink after drinks, this is probably not a place you would wanna go for the following reasons:  A.. YOU GOTTA WAIT FOR SEATING... and when you're drunk or hungry or possibly and certainly both, the wait is about the biggest bitch since you'll probably be waiting in the good ol' san fran brisk weather.  the food there wasn't bad at all, however, SUBSTITUTIONS are NOT ALLOWED!  me: Hi can i order XYZ, but instead of X may i get V instead. waitress: NO!.......... the cook will not allow it.. ** and for whatever reason why.. i didn't ask.. even though it made no sense** me: okay...  my voice inside: BULLSHIT!!!!  after all this.. i can whole-heartedly deem this joint 3 stars worthy.   bye sparkys!

fwxsOuJDM4BTD-xwq_V5WA.review_text: I ordered through Grubhub on a Wednesday evening.  Our order showed up 65 minutes later, with only 1 of the 3 total items ordered, which were completely cold.  At that time, the driver got the restaurant on the phone, and they confirmed that the remainder of the order would be delivered within 15-20 minutes.  Twenty-five minutes later, I called Sparky's, was put on hold, and then when a manger was given the phone he had zero customer service, would not provide his name, and was generally degrading saying things like, "you have never made a mistake before?!"  I tried to my best patience to be reasonable, and received zero consideration for a complete failure of service.  I will not be ordering from here ever again.

YVHStdEt7ktaEbvYuNkXQA.review_text: If I could give 0 stars I would.  The only reason this restaurant has any business is because its open 24 hours and there aren't many restaurants that offer that.  The food is mediocre and their service is completely terrible. Stay away!!!  Don't waste your money.

eUjJ0SDe6eBoZB7iKYifnw.review_text: I have pretty much tried all the vegetarian and vegan options and loved each one of them..the sandwiches, the pizza, the lasagna, the milkshakes and chai...yum yum n mre yummmmm...  this is my usual lunch place and I really appreciate the friendly service and the flexible menu...haven't had any peeves and hence won't complain :)

RuPy2Jak7bv9shDRRiWG7w.review_text: Tonight I called to order dinner from your restaurant. The girl who answered the phone could not hear anything I said because your music was so loud she could not hear my order.   After trying to tell her what a "BLT' was, she said I'm sorry the music here is really loud. My response was well, that's not my fault, why don't you turn it down?... She replied with a snotty " it's not my fault either, I don't set the music". Nice.. really nice customer service and manners....   With all the food places in this city there is NO WAY I will give a dime to a shop that has such attitude, no manners, and hires a completely unprofessional moron who apparently thinks that keeping her job, making tips, and having an income in this time where NO ONE can even get a job.. is not worth saving or caring about.   I have ordered from Sparky's in the past.. but I will NEVER do it again. It's not rocket science to know that if your staff is so uneducated that they can't turn down "music" to hear and take your order.. your business is not appreciated either.  And so where is the owner? Who is the manager and owner of this place that consistantly get's one star here on yelp... ? Don't they care, don't they have any self worth or integrity? If I owned a place and it got one star reviews.. I'd be humiliated, ashamed, pissed..   I guess if the owner doesn't care it makes sense the staff doesn't either.   Go anywhere else..

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Late night meal: BALT and a side of hash browns.  Woo! Open 24hrs!

rStWEkRar-JD0IWysuVYOw.review_text: You really have to keep your expectations realistic when eating at an all night establishment that is probably better known for cocaine than food.   Doing a majority of its business after 2am, Sparky's is more of a lounge than a restaurant.  Some dishes are actually decent, but the quality is similar to that of typical fast food.  Avoid the french fries at all costs - frozen, unseasoned and bland.

WDyILww9HxfTwq5zKOGymw.review_text: This is the place you slink off to during the wee hours of the morning, when nothing else (palatable) is open, when you're drunk and crying and can't feel your face anymore, when you and your lover are starved after a long evening of wild-monkey-love-making and couldn' find anything edible in the fridge.  This is not where you go during the day, because there are much better places to eat in that and every other neighborhood in SF.    This is where you go at night.  You wind up here at 3 am with your girlfriends, giggling, and all of you order cheese fries and chocolate shakes.  You know how good a chocolate shake and fries taste at 3 am?!  They taste that good here.  They get four stars for offering this service to humanity, the 3 am chow-hookup.    Why not five stars?  Well, like I said, their food only tastes good really, really late at night.  And their waitstaff is on the seriously grumpy side.  The prices ain't cheap.  The parking nearby sucks (that's really not their fault).    But, oh, those milkshakes at 3 am.......

X2101VEe19Ju3Q1RM6KphA.review_text: What's the 24-hour diner in my hood? Sparky's, and let me tell you, this could not have gone any better! How close is it to, say, Cafe Du Nord? Stones are being thrown, I'll get back to you.  Omelettes, burgers, fries, shakes, pancakes, pig, and much more! Seriously, I'm sorry it has taken this long for me to write this, but that chocolate milkshake nearly made me cry it was so good! ...I had my own shit going on, but whoa, nice milkshake!

V1SOy8pmuLVso8sJisFm8A.review_text: I have a special place in my heart for 24 hour diners, those beacons of light in the late night.   This is a great place to stumble upon after a night of drinking in the Castro when everything else is closed. While I've had better burgers the food's not bad and the waiters are usually pretty friendly.

8DXWOA7Ya0oPa98NyUezMQ.review_text: Used to be mediocre. Now it's dreadful.   The food was stale, over cooked, and obviously frozen for weeks before cooking.  The garlic fries (so hard to screw up) were stale, flavorless, dry fries dusted with garlic POWDER instead of tossed with fresh garlic. Seriously?  This is bad even when you're drunk and want greasy spoon food.   The only redeeming factor is their milkshakes, which are great.   But if you want a burger, pancakes, or anything to satisfy after a night of partying, go up the street to It's Tops instead.

OhsTFtSTMEREcZJyq2FS8A.review_text: Cute girl with tats. =)  Oh what else...bomb French Toast. She was right when she recommended them. Seriously one of the best French Toast I've had in a while. It was perfectly crispy on the outside and gooey in the middle. Noms.   Fries were ok. Not that great, not crispy enough for me. Open late.

pF7uEfsYCT_7AIKqBel2Xg.review_text: Came here for one reason: it was 23:30 on a Sunday and nothing else was open.  I had just finished watching the thoroughly depressing 'There Will be Blood' (there wasn't much blood, but there was a lot of oil) and needed some sustenance.  Cafe Baghdad, which was close to the Castro theater that I had just exited claimed to be closed, contrary to their sign, so off we went in search of food, and hence Sparky's.  To me, a diner is a place with lots of plastic, linoleum, chromed metal, and kitchy music from before 1965.  The menu must consist of things that could probably make at home, mostly from cans and it must not be healthy.  The servers should be older women with names like 'Helen' and 'Edith' and 'Fran' and they must, when referring to you, call you something that would give you cavities (honey, sweetheart, honeypie, sugar, sweetpea, etc).  Finally, it cannot be hip...not intentionally at least, coincidental hipness is ok.  Sparky's has some of these things, there is a lot of plastic and such, all in bright colors.  The menu is largely made up of stuff you can make at home, mostly from cans, and the food comes out hot and bathed in gravy.  But there was a bit too much hipness, and not to discriminate against the quick, courteous and attentive waiter, but I don't he was called 'Helen.'  Plus, the food was hot but not super tasty.  And there was a definite effort to be hip...which kind of kills it for me.  So overall, it wasn't a bad place, but not an excellent place--solid three stars.  I think I'll have to go back to Atlanta where I went to school, where there are real diners.  I call those places 'Waffle House.'

r7aJNrD4nHfgudKoc_GKOw.review_text: It's been a long day.  You've barely eaten and you know that means one thing--treat yourself to a good o'l homecooked meal from a diner.  Sounds perfect!  So I decided to do just that.  Ordered breakfast for dinner- Eggs Benedict--was just fine, not splendid, but fine.  Ordered A sundae for dessert, paying extra for bananas and hazelnut syrup...Ummm..where is my toppings?  Yeah, that's right, not there.  Ordered a tuna on white for lunch the next day.  Tuna, NOT spoiled stinky turkey.  It had that taste that makes you cringe and once I smelled it I knew why.  GROSS.  Notto mention it WASN'T What I ordered.  They were NOT willing to refund my order, but were willing to give me 7 bucks towards my next order.  Nice right? NO!  I waited an hour for their crappy food to arrive, half of it wrong.    DO NOT EAT HERE.  I rarely complain, even when a little mistake is made, but there were HUGE mistakes, and BAD SPOILED food.    SPARKY'S SUCKS

leKtNh_i4YES5fIvOhtHoA.review_text: Why does fried food taste so much better in the middle of the night?  I love stopping off at Sparky's after concerts when the music's still ringing in my head and all I want is some comfort food and some time to sit and regroup.  They have some of the best breakfast around, and the hash browns are one of a kind.  For those not in the know, Sparky's mixes green onions and shredded carrots into their hash browns.  Tonight I had the spanish omelette, but really it doesn't matter what you get since I've never had a bad breakfast at Sparky's.  The music selection in the juke box is perfectly awesome, as well.

d6sCLJs4Ahw0FsciLaefsA.review_text: I love this place. Service can be slow sometimes, but always super friendly. Wide array of veggie options and you can get a blackberry coke! Great late night spot and good location when out and about in the Castro.

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: Neither the amazing jukebox or delicious fluffy omelet can fully remedy the horrible service of Sparky's.

BOU25_BWQnLdFJBKUe2XdQ.review_text: This place was better before they had changed ownership. Their staff were a bit more friendly. Now, it's like a local Denny's.

viRKYUAGqScrC_OTugyJQg.review_text: Ordered the chicken and waffles. After waiting 30 minutes, the food arrived...chicken was completely raw in the middle. Yuck. Although there was an offer to remake it, I had totally lost my appetite. Save your money and head to Chow across the street.

Pt5OuNW7uyWCb-V-KJtHOg.review_text: Both times I have been to Sparky's have been after drinking. Despite having my beer goggles on at the time, I'm able to recall the disgusting chili cheese fries from my last visit: soggy, thin fries, canned, pasty, room temp chili and melted cheese velveeta goo. My friend got some sort of grilled sandwich that consisted of a hamburger patty slapped between two pieces of white bread. Gross. Like the drunken sleepover invite at the end of the night, Sparky's will leave you questioning your judgment in the morning.   It's BAD late night food and I hope the only reason anyone goes there is that it's the only place open. It would be a 1-star review but I'll give Sparky's the second one for being open 24-hours a day.

_zgihfGq7JmexW7q_Q3qMg.review_text: Ordered calamari got garlic bread (-1 star). Arguing with the customer about the mixed up order with everyone sitting beside him attesting to a calamari order (-1 star).   I could remove another star for not getting comped but it's not a formal restaurant it's more like a fast food joint. Service was good, staff was friendly, you get what you pay for.

5Y9dhbMtd06MdcoiBwsBZg.review_text: open really late, which makes it awesome, they say hunger is the best cook, world better then nations. do not get the eggs benedict. they fake the holendaise.. if you like eggs bendidct go to mommmas royal in Oakland yelp.com/biz/mamas-royal… or venus in Berkeley yelp.com/biz/venus-resta… or for what its worth my new fav chop bar in Oakland. I like there potatos.. yelp.com/biz/chop-bar-oa…

qGi0xjK3HM3Lfr6kSwKZdw.review_text: Sparky,  You're cute - I always see you drunk. Take what you may.  I am upset that we had our Craig's List-esque missed connection yesterday night/this morning. I am highly sorry for last night for when I arrived with an entourage that started fighting on the bench because they were two bitches. Getting kicked was sad and not nice since I was drunk and didn't get to eat a burger.  But moving on.  Being the quasi-SF drunk that I am, you are a legend. Nothing tastes better than a Sparky's burger late at night after a good dose of Ketel One. Your menu has expanded entirely, and I used to love that I would call you to deliver when I lived two blocks down. This was because I was again, being that quasi-SF drunk.  Your menu has grown bigger, but to me... I will just stick to what I know you can be good at. And that is your burger. However, I think it's still impressive that you are trying your hand at pastas and pizzas to breakfast. I've had some instances here where service is sketchy, and food is spotty... but I mean I can assume you are trying the best that you can. Because when most of your clientele, is inebriated, homeless or just generally weird folk - it can get hard.  I'm glad I can count on you, Sparky. I'll see you soon.  xoxoxo Your Not-So-Secret Admirer (refer to my waistline)
